original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: Again, it is said:

original: gal te ji ltar de 'dzin byed //
analyzed: gal te ji ltar de 'dzin byed //
translated: If it is asked, “How does it apprehend?”

original: de yang gcod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi //
analyzed: de yang gcod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi //
translated: And “That also has the character of cutting,”

original: shes pa de phyir ji ltar dang // ci 'dra bar zhes dogs mi bya //
analyzed: shes pa de phyir ji ltar dang // ci 'dra bar zhes dogs mi bya //
translated: Then one should not doubt, “How is it like that?”

original: zhes so // de'i phyir 'di la /
analyzed: zhes so // de'i phyir 'di la /
translated: Therefore, in response to that, it is said:

original: gang tshe gzung bya shes pa yi //
analyzed: gang tshe gzung bya shes pa yi //
translated: When there is an object to be apprehended,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: tha dad pa'i don yongs su gcod pa'i bdag nyid du grub na 'di thams cad du 'gyur na de nyid grub pa ma yin te /🔽'di ltar zhes pa ni yod pa tsam gyis yongs su gcod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i don yongs su gcod pa'i bdag nyid du grub na 'di thams cad du 'gyur na de nyid grub pa ma yin te / 'di ltar zhes pa ni yod pa tsam gyis yongs su gcod pa ma yin te /
translated: If it were established as having the nature of the exclusion of a different object, then all of this would occur. But that itself is not established.

original: thams cad yongs su gcod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽de'i 'bras bu nyid kyis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad yongs su gcod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // de'i 'bras bu nyid kyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: In this context, “like that” does not refer to mere existence, because it would follow that everything would be excluded.

original: mig la sogs pa yang gcod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa yang gcod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it the result of that, because then the eyes and so on would also be exclusions.

original: gang gis de dang 'dra bas kyang des rig pa btags par 'gyur ba rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis de dang 'dra bas kyang des rig pa btags par 'gyur ba rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis kyang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it the aspect that is imputed to be the object of that, because then it would follow that it would be imputed to be the object of that which is similar to it.

original: de lta bas na gzung bar bya ba yongs su gcod pa gang yin pa de gal te shes pa'i ngo bor gyur pa de lta na shes pa don yongs su gcod pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //🔽de lta ma yin na ji ltar shes pa don yongs su gcod pa'i ngo bo nyid yin zhes bya ba gsal bor brjod par gyis shig / de lta yin dang don yongs su gcod pa las ma gtogs pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid tha mi dad par grub pa'i
analyzed: de lta bas na gzung bar bya ba yongs su gcod pa gang yin pa de gal te shes pa'i ngo bor gyur pa de lta na shes pa don yongs su gcod pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ro // de lta ma yin na ji ltar shes pa don yongs su gcod pa'i ngo bo nyid yin zhes bya ba gsal bor brjod par gyis shig / de lta yin dang don yongs su gcod pa las ma gtogs pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid tha mi dad par grub pa'i
translated: Thus, if the determination of the object of apprehension is the nature of consciousness, then consciousness would be the nature of the determination of the object.🔽If it is not so, then how is consciousness the nature of the determination of the object?

original: phyir rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du grub po //
analyzed: phyir rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du grub po //
translated: Explain this clearly! If it is so, then consciousness is established as mere representation because it is established as not being different from the nature of the determination of the object.

original: 'di snyam du gang gis don kho na yongs su gcod la /🔽de yang 'di lta bu zhig go //🔽zhes bstan par mi nus pa 'di la khyad par ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gang gis don kho na yongs su gcod la / de yang 'di lta bu zhig go // zhes bstan par mi nus pa 'di la khyad par ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: If you think that the object is determined,

original: de ltar don rig ma bstan par //
analyzed: de ltar don rig ma bstan par //
translated: but it cannot be shown that “it is like this,” then what is the difference between the two?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To explain this, he says:🔽If the object is not shown,🔽how can consciousness be shown?

original: 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: The rest is clear.

original: gal te yang thun mong ma yin pa'i dngos po thams cad bstan par mi nus pa de lta na yang btags pa'i kun rdzob tu smras pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang thun mong ma yin pa'i dngos po thams cad bstan par mi nus pa de lta na yang btags pa'i kun rdzob tu smras pa nyid yin no //
translated: Even if it is not possible to teach all the uncommon things, still, it is said in the conventional of designation.

original: de lta ma yin na gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi khyad par yang brjod par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi khyad par yang brjod par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the distinctions of form, etc., would not be expressible.

original: de ltar nges par ma bzung ba'i ngo bos shes pa don rig par byed pa yin pa'i phyir gsal por the tshom mi za bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar nges par ma bzung ba'i ngo bos shes pa don rig par byed pa yin pa'i phyir gsal por the tshom mi za bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because the consciousness is made to cognize the object by means of an essence that is not ascertained, it is clearly taught without doubt.

original: de lta bas na @117b rnam par ma dpyad pa'i ngo bos dngos po rnam par 'jog pa na dngos po rnams legs par rnam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir 'di ni ci yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na @117b rnam par ma dpyad pa'i ngo bos dngos po rnam par 'jog pa na dngos po rnams legs par rnam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir 'di ni ci yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, when things are posited by means of an essence that is not analyzed, things are well posited, and so this is nothing at all.

original: 'di snyam du gcad par bya ba don med pa na 'di gang gis yongs su gcod par byed par 'gyur snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gcad par bya ba don med pa na 'di gang gis yongs su gcod par byed par 'gyur snyam du sems na /
translated: If one thinks, “When the object of cutting is meaningless, by what is it delimited?”

original: de ni gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “That by which” and so on.

original: de'i bdag nyid de gsal ba'i bdag nyid du yongs su gcod pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid de gsal ba'i bdag nyid du yongs su gcod pa zhes brjod de /
translated: The nature of that is the nature of manifestation, which is called “determination.”

original: dper na bde ba la sogs pa nyid kyis sim pa nyid ces bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bde ba la sogs pa nyid kyis sim pa nyid ces bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the statement, “The nature of pleasure, etc. is satisfaction.”

original: bde ba'i zhes bya ba tha dad du bstan pa tsam gyis sim pa nyid de la gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba'i zhes bya ba tha dad du bstan pa tsam gyis sim pa nyid de la gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The nature of satisfaction is not different from that just because it is taught separately as “pleasure.”

original: de lta bas na gal te yang sngon po'i yongs su gcod pa yin gyi ser po'i ma yin no zhes tha dad pa lta bur bstan pa de lta na yang de ni rang bzhin nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na gal te yang sngon po'i yongs su gcod pa yin gyi ser po'i ma yin no zhes tha dad pa lta bur bstan pa de lta na yang de ni rang bzhin nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, even though it is taught as if it were different, saying, “It is the determination of blue, but not the determination of yellow,” still it is the nature of consciousness.

original: de bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bor gsal ba bzhin pa nyid de skad du brjod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bor gsal ba bzhin pa nyid de skad du brjod de /
translated: In the same way, manifestation is said to be the nature of blue, etc.

original: shes pa ni rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa ni rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because consciousness is the nature of reflexive awareness.

original: ci ste gang gi mthus de skad ces brjod par bya bar rang rig pa'i don 'di ci zhig ce na /🔽rang gi ngo bo rig bya la //
analyzed: ci ste gang gi mthus de skad ces brjod par bya bar rang rig pa'i don 'di ci zhig ce na / rang gi ngo bo rig bya la //
translated: But what is the meaning of reflexive awareness, by the power of which it is said to be so?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The meaning of reflexive awareness is stated in the line, “The object of reflexive awareness is one’s own nature.”

original: gal te don rtogs bya phyir rtsol //
analyzed: gal te don rtogs bya phyir rtsol //
translated: If it is argued that “in order to understand the object, it must strive,”🔽and so on, then Kumarila’s objection is anticipated:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang gis ngo bo rig par bya ba la ltos pa med pa zhes bya ba 'di la gzhon nu ma len gyi klan ka dogs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang gis ngo bo rig par bya ba la ltos pa med pa zhes bya ba 'di la gzhon nu ma len gyi klan ka dogs par byed pa yin te /
translated: “This is not dependent on the awareness of its own nature.”

original: de na re gal te yang shes pa gsal ba'i bdag nyid yin pa de lta na yang bdag nyid gsal bar bya ba'i gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin gyi rang gi bdag nyid rtogs pa de shes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de na re gal te yang shes pa gsal ba'i bdag nyid yin pa de lta na yang bdag nyid gsal bar bya ba'i gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin gyi rang gi bdag nyid rtogs pa de shes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Even though consciousness has the nature of clarity, it is not dependent on another that is to be clarified, but it is not the case that it is aware of its own nature.

original: de ni don gsal ba nyid bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni don gsal ba nyid bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the object that is clarified and has activity.

original: gcig la bya ba dang ldan pa de yongs su ma spangs par de nyid kyi tshe gzhan du bya ba dang ldan pa rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig la bya ba dang ldan pa de yongs su ma spangs par de nyid kyi tshe gzhan du bya ba dang ldan pa rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable that it has activity at that time without relinquishing the activity that it has.

original: 'dir sgron mas 'khrul pa nyid du dogs nas phyogs gzhan bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir sgron mas 'khrul pa nyid du dogs nas phyogs gzhan bshad pa ni /
translated: Here, fearing that the lamp is mistaken, another position is explained:

original: 'di 'dra ba nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “It is just like this . . .” and so on.

original: bdag nyid gsal ba med na 'di'i phyi rol gsal ba nyid kyang ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na /🔽dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bdag nyid gsal ba med na 'di'i phyi rol gsal ba nyid kyang ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na / dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If the self is not manifest, how can the manifestation of external things be established?

original: dper na bdag nyid gsal ba med na yang mig la sogs pa rnams gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la gsal ba nyid du rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du 'dir yang ste shes pa la yang 'gyur ro //🔽'di @118a * //
analyzed: dper na bdag nyid gsal ba med na yang mig la sogs pa rnams gzugs la sogs pa'i yul la gsal ba nyid du rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du 'dir yang ste shes pa la yang 'gyur ro // 'di @118a * //
translated: For example, even though the self is not manifest, the eye, etc. are established as manifest with regard to the object, form, etc. In the same way, it is also with regard to consciousness.

original: snyam du bdag nyid kyis nye bas yongs su spangs nas ci'i phyir phyi rol kho na gsal bar byed snyam du sems na /
analyzed: snyam du bdag nyid kyis nye bas yongs su spangs nas ci'i phyir phyi rol kho na gsal bar byed snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think, “Why, having abandoned the manifest self, does it manifest only external things?”

original: phyi rol don la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: phyi rol don la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “The external object, etc.”

original: ci'i phyir bdag gsal ba la nus pa med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bdag gsal ba la nus pa med ce na /
translated: Why is the self not capable of manifestation?

original: dngos po rnams kyi zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “The things, etc.”

original: ji skad du me ni sreg byed nam mkha'i min //
analyzed: ji skad du me ni sreg byed nam mkha'i min //
translated: As it is said, “Fire burns, but not space.

original: 'di la rgal du ci zhig yod //
analyzed: 'di la rgal du ci zhig yod //
translated: What is there to dispute about this?”

original: ces bshad pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ces bshad pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: This is what they say.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed pa yin te /
translated: The response to that is stated in the lines beginning “But if you say that the mind is the self, then it follows that the self is multiple.”🔽

original: gang yang don rtogs bya phyir rtsol //
analyzed: gang yang don rtogs bya phyir rtsol //
translated: But if you say that consciousness is the object’s perceiver,

original: zhes gang smras pa de yang 'brel pa med pa yin te /🔽don rig pa ni shes pa las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa de yang 'brel pa med pa yin te / don rig pa ni shes pa las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: then it would be without an object, and it would be without itself as well.🔽If you say that consciousness is the object’s perceiver, then it would be without an object, and it would be without itself as well.🔽If you say that consciousness is the object’s perceiver, then it would be without an object, and it would be without itself as well.🔽If you say that consciousness is the object’s perceiver, then it would be without an object, and it would be without itself as well.

analyzed: 'di ltar rig pa dang dmigs pa dang don rnam par rig pa zhes shes pa nyid rnam grangs de dag gis brjod pa yin no // de la ni don rig pa la'o //
translated: If you say that consciousness is the object’s perceiver, then it would be without an object, and it would be without itself as well.

analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du gyur na ni shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa na'o //

original: gang gis don rig pa la bya ba dang bcas pa zhes bya bar 'gyur pa na bdag nyid las tha dad pa shes pa don rig pa'i bdag nyid kyi bya bar 'gyur ba gzhan ci 'dra ba zhig yin /🔽bdag nyid la bya ba dang ldan par rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis don rig pa la bya ba dang bcas pa zhes bya bar 'gyur pa na bdag nyid las tha dad pa shes pa don rig pa'i bdag nyid kyi bya bar 'gyur ba gzhan ci 'dra ba zhig yin /🔽bdag nyid la bya ba dang ldan par rig pa ma yin no //
translated: If you say that consciousness is the object’s perceiver, then it would be without an object, and it would be without itself as well.🔽If you say that consciousness is the object’s perceiver, then

original: 'di snyam du gang gis shes pa dang don rig pa dag rnam grangs pa nyid du 'gyur ba ji ltar don rig pa shes pa'i bdag nyid yin snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gang gis shes pa dang don rig pa dag rnam grangs pa nyid du 'gyur ba ji ltar don rig pa shes pa'i bdag nyid yin snyam du sems na /
translated: If one thinks, “How could the awareness of an object be the same as the awareness that knows it?”

original: don ni nyams myong ngo bo nyid //🔽ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don ni nyams myong ngo bo nyid // ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The object is the experience of the essence.

original: 'di ni don nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: 'di ni don nyams su myong ba'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The object is the experience of the essence.

original: rang bzhin khas blang bar bya ste //
analyzed: rang bzhin khas blang bar bya ste //
translated: The nature of that should be accepted.

original: de lta ma yin na ci ltar shes pa de la bya ba dang bcas par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ci ltar shes pa de la bya ba dang bcas par 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could that awareness be related to it?

original: med pa ri bong gi rva la sogs pa la bya ba 'ga' zhig rigs pa ni ma yin no //🔽de lta yin dang de'i don nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo ste rang bzhin gal te shes pa la tha dad par gyur na de'i tshe shes pa las don nyams su myong ba /
analyzed: med pa ri bong gi rva la sogs pa la bya ba 'ga' zhig rigs pa ni ma yin no // de lta yin dang de'i don nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo ste rang bzhin gal te shes pa la tha dad par gyur na de'i tshe shes pa las don nyams su myong ba /
translated: It is not logical for an action to be related to something nonexistent, such as the horn of an ass.🔽If that were so, the essence of the experience of the object would be different from the awareness.🔽The self that experiences the object

original: de don nyams su myong ba'i bdag /'di 'dra ba nyid gsal ba nyid //
analyzed: de don nyams su myong ba'i bdag /'di 'dra ba nyid gsal ba nyid //
translated: would be manifest in that way.

original: ces gang bshad pa de rigs pa nyid du 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: ces gang bshad pa de rigs pa nyid du 'gyur ro ;
translated: That which is explained is just reasoning.🔽Sometimes, when another is being recited,

original: ; res 'ga' gzhan 'don bzhin pa dag / shes pa don nyams myong ba las //
analyzed: ; res 'ga' gzhan 'don bzhin pa dag / shes pa don nyams myong ba las //
translated: one knows it from the experience of the object.

original: tha dad khas len byed na yang //
analyzed: tha dad khas len byed na yang //
translated: Even though one accepts that it is different,

original: de yang med ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de yang med ces bya ba smos te /
translated: one should say that it does not exist.

original: de ni shes pa las tha dad pa nyid kyi nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: de ni shes pa las tha dad pa nyid kyi nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: That is the experience of something different from consciousness.

original: khas blangs na ni shes pa'i bdag nyid rig pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid khas @118b blangs pa'o //
analyzed: khas blangs na ni shes pa'i bdag nyid rig pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid khas @118b blangs pa'o //
translated: If one accepts that, one accepts that the nature of consciousness is devoid of self-awareness.

original: de yongs su dor bar thal bar 'gyur ba ni shes pa nyams su myong ba las tha dad par khas len na rang rig par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yongs su dor bar thal bar 'gyur ba ni shes pa nyams su myong ba las tha dad par khas len na rang rig par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The consequence of its abandonment is that if one accepts that it is different from the experience of consciousness, it follows that it is self-aware.

original: 'di snyam du shes pa don nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir gsal ba nyid du mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di snyam du shes pa don nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir gsal ba nyid du mi 'dod do //
translated: One might think that because consciousness is the nature of the experience of the object, it is not accepted to be clarity.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid gsal ba yin pa 'ba' zhig gi phyir ro zhes 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid gsal ba yin pa 'ba' zhig gi phyir ro zhes 'chad pa ni /
translated: It is explained that it is clarity only because it is the nature of experience.

original: de rang las zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de rang las zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “That itself” is mentioned.

original: gal te shes pa de nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid kho nar skye ba yin gyi /🔽don nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa de lta na yang 'di ni sngon po'i rigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te shes pa de nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid kho nar skye ba yin gyi / don nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa de lta na yang 'di ni sngon po'i rigs pa yin gyi /
translated: If that cognition arises in the nature of the experience of itself,

original: ser po'i ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa tha dad du don rig par grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ser po'i ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa tha dad du don rig par grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: but not in the nature of the experience of the object, then it would not be established that the cognition of the object is different, such as, “This is the cognition of blue, not the cognition of yellow.”

original: ci'i phyir grub par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir grub par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is it not established?

original: ji ltar shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽gzhan la zhes bya ba ni rnam pa dang ldan pa ni phyi rol gyi don yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gzhan la zhes bya ba ni rnam pa dang ldan pa ni phyi rol gyi don yin la /
translated: He says, “How could it be . . . ” and so on.🔽“In another” means that the external object possesses aspects, but the cognition is without aspects.

original: blo ni rnam pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba gang gi lta ba yin pa'i rnam pa med pa'i shes pa smra ba la'o //
analyzed: blo ni rnam pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba gang gi lta ba yin pa'i rnam pa med pa'i shes pa smra ba la'o //
translated: This is the view of the Proponents of Nonexistent Universals.

original: de don nyams su myong ba'i bdag /'di 'dra ba nyid gsal ba nyid //🔽ces gang smras pa 'di la /
analyzed: de don nyams su myong ba'i bdag /'di 'dra ba nyid gsal ba nyid // ces gang smras pa 'di la /
translated: “That itself is the nature of the experience of the object”🔽is what was said.

original: gal te 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, he says, “If it is . . . ” and so on.

original: gal te shes pa bems po'i ngo bo nyid kyis bdag nyid rig par byed pa ma yin pa de'i tshe de rang las mngon sum ma yin pa na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa bems po'i ngo bo nyid kyis bdag nyid rig par byed pa ma yin pa de'i tshe de rang las mngon sum ma yin pa na /
translated: If cognition by its very nature does not illuminate itself, then it is not a direct perception in regard to itself.

original: don nyams su myong ba yang mngon sum ma yin pa nyid du yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: don nyams su myong ba yang mngon sum ma yin pa nyid du yang mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable that the experience of an object is a direct perception.

original: 'di snyam du gal te shes pa mngon sum ma yin na ci'i phyir don nyams su myong ba yang mngon sum du 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te shes pa mngon sum ma yin na ci'i phyir don nyams su myong ba yang mngon sum du 'gyur /
translated: If you think, “If cognition is not a direct perception, why would the experience of an object be a direct perception?”

original: gzugs mngon sum ma yin pas ni sgra yang mngon sum ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: gzugs mngon sum ma yin pas ni sgra yang mngon sum ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: You might think, “Just as form is not a direct perception, sound is not a direct perception.”

original: shes pa nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shes pa nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond:

original: shes pa nyams su myong ba ma gtogs par gzhan gyi ngo bo nges par gzung ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa nyams su myong ba ma gtogs par gzhan gyi ngo bo nges par gzung ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Apart from the experience of cognition, there is no apprehension of another nature.

original: gzhan nyid du nges pa sngon du 'gro ba nges par ma bzung bar tha snyad byed na ci ltar rang dang gzhan dag slu bar byed shes pa de'i ngo bo ma grub pa na de'i don nyams su myong ba gzhan gang zhig grub pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan nyid du nges pa sngon du 'gro ba nges par ma bzung bar tha snyad byed na ci ltar rang dang gzhan dag slu bar byed shes pa de'i ngo bo ma grub pa na de'i don nyams su myong ba gzhan gang zhig grub pa yin te /
translated: If you make statements without first ascertaining the certainty of difference, how could you know that you and others are deceived? When the nature of consciousness is not established, what other experience of its object is established?

original: 'ga' yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' yang ma yin no //
translated: None at all!

original: yang ci ste shes pa gzhan gyis de grub par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: yang ci ste shes pa gzhan gyis de grub par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: But if you think that it is established by another consciousness,

original: rang gis ma myong zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽grub pa ni shes pa ste ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: rang gis ma myong zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / grub pa ni shes pa ste ma grub pa'o //
translated: then Nāgārjuna explains: If it is not experienced by itself, etc.

original: gsal ba @119a * //
analyzed: gsal ba @119a * //
translated: That which is established is consciousness, but it is not established.🔽It is not tenable to say

original: ma grub pa ni gsal ba zhes bya bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma grub pa ni gsal ba zhes bya bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: that what is not established is clear.

original: 'di ltar re zhig bdag nyid don nyams su myong ba'i dus na grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig bdag nyid don nyams su myong ba'i dus na grub pa ma yin te /
translated: In this way, first it is not established at the time of the experience of the object,

original: de'i gsal ba nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin de'i dus na ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gsal ba nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin de'i dus na ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of the experience of its clarity is not established at that time.

original: de gang gi tshe 'grub par 'gyur ba brjod par bya dgos so ;
analyzed: de gang gi tshe 'grub par 'gyur ba brjod par bya dgos so ;
translated: You must explain when it is established.

original: ; de'i shes pa'i shes pa skyes pa na ste /
analyzed: ; de'i shes pa'i shes pa skyes pa na ste /
translated: When the consciousness of that consciousness arises.

original: rang gi shes pa'i shes pa skye ba'i dus su 'grub par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi shes pa'i shes pa skye ba'i dus su 'grub par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: When the consciousness of one’s own consciousness arises, it is established.

original: de ni legs par smras pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni legs par smras pa yin te /
translated: This is well said.

original: gang zhig rang nyams su myong ba'i dus na ma grub pa de ji ltar gzhan nyams su myong ba'i dus na grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang zhig rang nyams su myong ba'i dus na ma grub pa de ji ltar gzhan nyams su myong ba'i dus na grub par 'gyur /
translated: How could that which is not established when one experiences it be established when another experiences it?

original: gal te thug pa med par mi 'gyur na grub par 'gyur ba zhig na de ni bzlog par dka'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te thug pa med par mi 'gyur na grub par 'gyur ba zhig na de ni bzlog par dka'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: If it were established, there would be no infinite regress. But it is difficult to refute that.🔽In order to demonstrate this, he says,

original: de'i yang nyams myong ma grub na //
analyzed: de'i yang nyams myong ma grub na //
translated: If the experience of that is not established,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: etc.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni don shes pa'i shes pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni don shes pa'i shes pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: “That” refers to the second consciousness, the consciousness of the object.

original: dang po zhes bya ba ni don nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba ni don nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: “First” refers to the experience of the object.

original: ma grub pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'di la grub pa med pas ma grub pa ste /
analyzed: ma grub pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'di la grub pa med pas ma grub pa ste /
translated: “Not established” means that it is not established because it does not exist.

original: de'i dngos po ni ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Its nature is not established.

original: gzhan yang gal te shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong bar khas len par byed pa de'i tshe shes pa gzhan de la yang bdag la shes pa'i shes pa skyes so zhes dran pa skye ba nyid yin la de yang gzhan gyis nyams su myong bar brjod par
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong bar khas len par byed pa de'i tshe shes pa gzhan de la yang bdag la shes pa'i shes pa skyes so zhes dran pa skye ba nyid yin la de yang gzhan gyis nyams su myong bar brjod par
translated: Moreover, if you accept that consciousness is experienced by another consciousness, then with respect to that other consciousness, the memory “I have generated a consciousness that is the consciousness of consciousness” would arise.🔽

original: bya ste / nyams su myong ba la ni dran pa skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bya ste / nyams su myong ba la ni dran pa skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, if you accept that consciousness is experienced by another consciousness, then you would have to say that the memory “I was conscious of consciousness” arises from the experience of another consciousness, but it is not logical that memory arises from the experience of another consciousness.

original: de lta yin dang las med pa su zhig shes pa'i phreng ba 'di dag skyed par byed ces bya bar brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: de lta yin dang las med pa su zhig shes pa'i phreng ba 'di dag skyed par byed ces bya bar brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: If that were so, then you would have to say, “Who, without karma, produces this garland of consciousness?”

original: re zhig don ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig don ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not the object,

original: de ni rtsa ba'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rtsa ba'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the object of the primary consciousness.

original: dbang po dang snang ba dag kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po dang snang ba dag kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the sense faculty and the appearance,

original: de dag ni dbang po'i shes pa nyid la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni dbang po'i shes pa nyid la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are applied to the sense faculty consciousness itself.

original: rgyu mtshan med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not without a reason,

original: rtag tu yod pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would always exist and so on.

original: blo snga ma de nyid blo phyi ma skyed par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: blo snga ma de nyid blo phyi ma skyed par byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the former cognition itself produces the latter cognition,

original: de bzhin yul gzhan la 'pho bar //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin yul gzhan la 'pho bar // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then it would not shift to another object.

original: de lta na ni yul gzhan la 'pho bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni yul gzhan la 'pho bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it were like that, then it would not shift to another object.🔽Thus, the former cognition is posited as near by the very fact that it is the substantial cause of the entity that is the object of the latter cognition.

original: 'di ltar / blo snga ma snga ma shes pa phyi ma phyi ma'i yul gyi ngo bos nye bar len pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis nye ba nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i nye bar brjod pa de 'dra ba spangs nas ji ltar mi nye ba'i don 'dzin par @119b byed
analyzed: 'di ltar / blo snga ma snga ma shes pa phyi ma phyi ma'i yul gyi ngo bos nye bar len pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis nye ba nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i nye bar brjod pa de 'dra ba spangs nas ji ltar mi nye ba'i don 'dzin par @119b byed
translated: How could it be that it apprehends an object that is not near, having abandoned such a near expression?

original: pa yin / don nye na yang de la gegs byed par nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: pa yin / don nye na yang de la gegs byed par nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Even if the object is near, it is not able to obstruct it,

original: de ni mi nye ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mi nye ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not near.

original: gal te mi nye yang gegs byed pa yin pa de'i tshe nam yang 'ga' la yang blo nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mi nye yang gegs byed pa yin pa de'i tshe nam yang 'ga' la yang blo nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it obstructs even though it is not near, then at no time would any cognition be experienced.

original: don gang zhig mi nye ba'i gnas skabs de ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir don mi nye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i dran pa yang 'chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: don gang zhig mi nye ba'i gnas skabs de ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir don mi nye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i dran pa yang 'chad par 'gyur te /
translated: Since there is no time when an object is not near, it is not tenable to say that memory is of a near object.

original: nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is not tenable that memory is of a past object because there is no experience of it.

original: gzhan yang gang dag 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i yul nye ba med par 'byung ba de dag la 'pho ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i rgyud la 'khor ba ji srid par gnas pa'i phyir sus kyang don shes par mi 'gyur ro
analyzed: gzhan yang gang dag 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i yul nye ba med par 'byung ba de dag la 'pho ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i rgyud la 'khor ba ji srid par gnas pa'i phyir sus kyang don shes par mi 'gyur ro
translated: Moreover, since the object of past and future conceptual thoughts does not exist, and since there is no cause for the transition to another object, the continuum of conceptual thoughts would remain for as long as cyclic existence does. Therefore, no one would ever understand the meaning of a word.

original: // don gzhan la 'pho ba mi 'thad pa yin du chug mod /
analyzed: // don gzhan la 'pho ba mi 'thad pa yin du chug mod /
translated: Even if it is not tenable that the mind passes to another object,

original: de lta na yang mtha' shes pa gang yin pa de su zhig gis nyams su myong bar byed ces bya ba brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: de lta na yang mtha' shes pa gang yin pa de su zhig gis nyams su myong bar byed ces bya ba brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: it must be said that someone experiences the cognition of the end of the sound.

original: yang ci ste blo phyi ma 'di nyid don gzhan 'dzin pa'i blo snga ma dang don gnyi ga 'dzin pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: yang ci ste blo phyi ma 'di nyid don gzhan 'dzin pa'i blo snga ma dang don gnyi ga 'dzin pa yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you say that this later cognition is the experience of the earlier cognition that apprehends the other object, and that it is the experience of both the sound and the object,🔽then that is not tenable.

original: 'di ltar sgra'i shes pa'i mjug thogs su gzugs 'dzin pa'i shes pa 'byung ba de'i tshe gzugs 'dzin pa'i shes pa de la sgra'i shes pa snang ba'i phyir de la snang ba'i sgra yang snang bar 'gyur ro //🔽gang gi ltar na shes pa rnam pa med pa de'i ltar na yang sgra 'dzin pa med par de 'dzin par byed par 'dzin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra'i shes pa'i mjug thogs su gzugs 'dzin pa'i shes pa 'byung ba de'i tshe gzugs 'dzin pa'i shes pa de la sgra'i shes pa snang ba'i phyir de la snang ba'i sgra yang snang bar 'gyur ro // gang gi ltar na shes pa rnam pa med pa de'i ltar na yang sgra 'dzin pa med par de 'dzin par byed par 'dzin par mi rigs te /
translated: Thus, when a consciousness apprehending form arises in the wake of an auditory consciousness, at that time, the consciousness apprehending form would perceive the auditory consciousness, and the sound that appears to it would also appear.🔽Even for those who claim that consciousness is devoid of aspects, it is illogical for that consciousness to apprehend sound without apprehending the consciousness that apprehends sound.

original: dbyig pa 'dzin pa med par de 'dzin pa byed pa'i dbyig pa can mi 'dzin par rigs so zhes bya bas gzugs 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa la sgra yang snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbyig pa 'dzin pa med par de 'dzin pa byed pa'i dbyig pa can mi 'dzin par rigs so zhes bya bas gzugs 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa la sgra yang snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as it is illogical to apprehend the stick-holder without apprehending the stick, the consciousness apprehending form would also perceive sound.

original: de bzhin du bsam pa'i shes pa la yang ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis yi ge aa la sogs pa'i yul can gyi mngon par brjod pa gnyis gcig la rim ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam pa'i shes pa la yang ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis yi ge aa la sogs pa'i yul can gyi mngon par brjod pa gnyis gcig la rim ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, in the case of a conceptual consciousness, the two expressions that have the letters a and so on as their objects would not occur in a single mindstream in the manner explained.

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe yi ge ai sems pa'i de ma thag tu yi ge aa sems par byed pa de'i tshe de'i yi ge aa sems par byed pa'i shes pa ai 'dzin par byed pa yang sems par byed pa'i phyir rang gi shes pa la snang ba'i
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe yi ge ai sems pa'i de ma thag tu yi ge aa sems par byed pa de'i tshe de'i yi ge aa sems par byed pa'i shes pa ai 'dzin par byed pa yang sems par byed pa'i phyir rang gi shes pa la snang ba'i
translated: Thus, when the consciousness that thinks the letter i immediately thinks the letter a, at that time the consciousness that thinks the letter a also thinks the letter i, because it is the thinker of the letter a.

original: yi ge ai'i brjod pa yi ge aa'i brjod pa'i shes pa la yang snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yi ge ai'i brjod pa yi ge aa'i brjod pa'i shes pa la yang snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the expression of the letter i that appears to one’s consciousness would also appear to the consciousness that expresses the letter a.

original: gzhan yang dngos po thams cad la lan gnyis su snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po thams cad la lan gnyis su snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, all things would appear twice,

original: rang gi shes pa'i dus su dang rang gi rig pas shes pa'i dus su snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi shes pa'i dus su dang rang gi rig pas shes pa'i dus su snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they would appear at the time of one’s consciousness and at the time of the consciousness that cognizes itself.

original: de ltar snang ba yang yod pa ma yin pa'i @120a * //
analyzed: de ltar snang ba yang yod pa ma yin pa'i @120a * //
translated: But such appearance does not exist.

original: phyir blo phyi mas gnyis 'dzin pa ni mi rigs pas smras pa yin no //🔽yang ci ste ma'i shes pa gcig po de nyams su ma myong ba dang ma dran par 'gyur mod /
analyzed: phyir blo phyi mas gnyis 'dzin pa ni mi rigs pas smras pa yin no // yang ci ste ma'i shes pa gcig po de nyams su ma myong ba dang ma dran par 'gyur mod /
translated: Therefore it is said that it is illogical for the subsequent cognition to apprehend two.

original: skyon cir 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: skyon cir 'gyur snyam na /
translated: Moreover, if the single consciousness of the mother does not experience itself and does not remember itself, what is the problem?

original: spyod yul gzhan du 'pho ba can //
analyzed: spyod yul gzhan du 'pho ba can //
translated: And it would be transferred to another domain.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus, it is said.

original: rang rig pa khas mi len pa'i phyir rang las ma yin la thug pa med pa'i nyes pas gzhan las kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: rang rig pa khas mi len pa'i phyir rang las ma yin la thug pa med pa'i nyes pas gzhan las kyang ma yin no //
translated: Since it is not accepted that consciousness is reflexive awareness, it is not established from itself. Nor is it established from another, because of the fault of infinite regress.

original: 'di'i mtha' ma grub pa na snga ma snga ma yang ma grub ste /
analyzed: 'di'i mtha' ma grub pa na snga ma snga ma yang ma grub ste /
translated: When the latter is not established, the former is not established either,

original: dmigs pa mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object is not directly perceived.

original: de ltar na don yang ma grub pa'i phyir nam yang 'ga' yang dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na don yang ma grub pa'i phyir nam yang 'ga' yang dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, since the object is not established, nothing is ever observed.

original: de ltar yin dang 'gro ba mtha' dag long ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang 'gro ba mtha' dag long ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, the entire world would be blind.

original: ci se ji skad bshad pa'i nyes pas 'jigs nas /
analyzed: ci se ji skad bshad pa'i nyes pas 'jigs nas /
translated: Fearing the faults explained above,

original: tha ma rang las te rang rig pas grub par khas len par byed na de'i tshe /
analyzed: tha ma rang las te rang rig pas grub par khas len par byed na de'i tshe /
translated: some accept that the final cognition is established by reflexive awareness.

original: de kho na bzhin du thams cad shes pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir rang rig pa yin la rag mod /
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du thams cad shes pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir rang rig pa yin la rag mod /
translated: In that case, since there is no difference between that cognition and all other cognitions, it is certainly reflexive awareness.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig shes pa yin pa de ni bdag nyid rig pa las gzhan gyi byed pa la ltos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig shes pa yin pa de ni bdag nyid rig pa las gzhan gyi byed pa la ltos pa ma yin te /
translated: The application is that whatever is consciousness does not depend on the activity of another, since it is reflexive awareness.🔽

original: shes pa yin pa'i phyir mtha'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shes pa yin pa'i phyir mtha'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: The application is this: whatever is knowledge does not depend on the activity of another, because of being knowledge, like the knowledge of the end.

original: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa yang shes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa yang shes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And the basis of the dispute is knowledge. This is a natural inference.

original: de lta ma yin na gang zhig rang las ma grub pa de ni bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du gzugs kyi yul can gyi shes pa nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //🔽mig la sogs pa gsal byed par //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gang zhig rang las ma grub pa de ni bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du gzugs kyi yul can gyi shes pa nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o // mig la sogs pa gsal byed par //
translated: Otherwise, whatever is not established from itself, like a pot, etc., would be the nonestablishment of the object of knowledge of form. This is a valid refutation.

original: rnam par gzhag pa mthong ba ltar //🔽zhes bya ba 'di la /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa mthong ba ltar // zhes bya ba 'di la /
translated: The statement “Just as the eye, etc., are posited as illuminators,”

original: mig ni gzugs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mig ni gzugs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: is responded to with “The eye, etc., are not illuminators,” and so on.🔽The statement “The eye, etc., are not illuminators” is responded to with “The eye is said to illuminate form,” and so on.

original: mig ni gzugs kyi yul can gyi shes pa skyed pa na gzugs kyi gsal bar byed pa brjod kyi /
analyzed: mig ni gzugs kyi yul can gyi shes pa skyed pa na gzugs kyi gsal bar byed pa brjod kyi /
translated: The eye is said to illuminate form when it produces the knowledge that has form as its object.

original: rnam par shes pa ni gzugs la cung zad kyang byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni gzugs la cung zad kyang byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Consciousness does not do anything to form.🔽

original: gzugs nyid de skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs nyid de skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Consciousness does not do anything at all to form, because form itself produces it.

original: cung zad kyang mi byed pa ni gsal bar byed par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: cung zad kyang mi byed pa ni gsal bar byed par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not reasonable that what does not do anything at all is the illuminator,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: des na ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because of that,

original: mtshungs pa ni 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa ni 'dra ba'o //
translated: similarity is likeness.🔽In order to establish that the aspect of blue and the cognition of that are non-different, he says:

original: gang zhig rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngon po'i rnam pa dang de'i blo dag tha mi dad par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zhig rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngon po'i rnam pa dang de'i blo dag tha mi dad par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The cognition of blue, etc.

original: shes pa rnam pa med par smras pa la tshad ma byed pa yin te /
analyzed: shes pa rnam pa med par smras pa la tshad ma byed pa yin te /
translated: He makes a valid cognition that refutes the assertion of consciousness without aspects.

original: gang ni rig pa ste gang zhig @120b rig pa na gang rig pa de nyid nges par gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: gang ni rig pa ste gang zhig @120b rig pa na gang rig pa de nyid nges par gzhan ma yin te /
translated: What is cognized - when what is cognized is ascertained to be not different from that which cognizes,

original: de lta bas na dang po'i gang zhig gi sgras brjod par bya ba'i tha mi dad pa nyid du nges pa de ni gcig tu gang gi sgra gnyis pa'i brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na dang po'i gang zhig gi sgras brjod par bya ba'i tha mi dad pa nyid du nges pa de ni gcig tu gang gi sgra gnyis pa'i brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: therefore, the non-difference expressed by the first what is ascertained to be the sole object expressed by the second what.

original: yang na bzlog nas tha mi dad pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na bzlog nas tha mi dad pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: Or else, the opposite of that is the probandum.

original: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: gang zhig gang las logs shig ma yin par rig pa nyid de ni de las tha mi dad pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang las logs shig ma yin par rig pa nyid de ni de las tha mi dad pa yin te /
translated: That which is not known to be different from something is not different from that.

original: dper na sngon po'i blo rang gi rang bzhin yin pa lta bu'am /
analyzed: dper na sngon po'i blo rang gi rang bzhin yin pa lta bu'am /
translated: For example, the cognition of blue is not different from its own nature.

original: yang rab rib can gyi shes pa la snang ba'i zla ba de zla ba gnyis pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yang rab rib can gyi shes pa la snang ba'i zla ba de zla ba gnyis pa bzhin no //
translated: Or, the moon that appears in the cognition of one with eye disease is not different from the second moon.

original: rig pa 'di la yang sngon po'i blo yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs la chos nye bar bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa 'di la yang sngon po'i blo yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs la chos nye bar bsdus pa'o //
translated: In this case, the cognition of blue is the property to be proven.

original: chos can 'di la sngon po'i rnams pa dang de'i blo de dag tha mi dad pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos so //
analyzed: chos can 'di la sngon po'i rnams pa dang de'i blo de dag tha mi dad pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos so //
translated: The non-difference of the aspect of blue and its cognition in this subject is the property to be proven.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: The ascertainment of co-observation as explained is the reason.

original: slob dpon gyis lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba la gtan tshigs kyi don 'di 'dra bar 'dod do //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba la gtan tshigs kyi don 'di 'dra bar 'dod do //
translated: The master [Dharmakīrti] asserts that this is the meaning of the reason in the syllogism, because of the ascertainment of co-observation.

original: de la btsun pa dge srungs na re /
analyzed: de la btsun pa dge srungs na re /
translated: The Venerable Vasubandhu says:

original: gtan tshigs 'di 'gal gang gi phyir //
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di 'gal gang gi phyir //
translated: This reason is contradictory, because

original: 'jig rten 'di na lhan cig sgra //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di na lhan cig sgra //
translated: in this world, sound is never

original: gzhan med par ni gang na'ang med //
analyzed: gzhan med par ni gang na'ang med //
translated: perceived apart from the other.

original: gal te lhan cig rig yod na //
analyzed: gal te lhan cig rig yod na //
translated: If it were perceived together with the other,

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs 'di 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs 'di 'gal lo //
translated: then this reason would be contradictory.

original: zhes zer ba de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes zer ba de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not correct,

original: gang zhig mi mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pa de ni gtan tshigs 'gal ba yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig mi mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pa de ni gtan tshigs 'gal ba yin la /
translated: because a reason is contradictory if it exists only in the discordant side.

original: 'di mi mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di mi mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But this reason does not exist only in the discordant side,

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it also exists in the similar side.

original: 'di ltar zla ba gnyis lhan cig dmigs par 'jig rten na mngon par 'dod mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar zla ba gnyis lhan cig dmigs par 'jig rten na mngon par 'dod mod kyi /
translated: Thus, although the world does accept that two moons are perceived together,

original: de dag don dam par tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag don dam par tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: they do not exist ultimately as separate.

original: de ltar yang smra ba po kho bos zla ba gnyis dmigs so zhes bya bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang smra ba po kho bos zla ba gnyis dmigs so zhes bya bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the speaker would say, “I perceive two moons.”

original: de bzhin du 'di la yang shes pa las tha mi dad kyang phyi rol lta bur snang ba'i rnam pa gnyis par byas nas brtags pa'i tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi lhan cig pa'i sgra sbyong ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la yang shes pa las tha mi dad kyang phyi rol lta bur snang ba'i rnam pa gnyis par byas nas brtags pa'i tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi lhan cig pa'i sgra sbyong ba yin no //
translated: Likewise, here, although it is not different from consciousness, it is imagined to be different, having the two aspects of appearing as if it were external.

original: gang las gtan tshigs 'gal bar 'gyur ba gang gis lhan cig pa'i sgra sbyong ba tsam gyis dngos po dang 'brel ba'i rtags gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba sgra las byung ba'i tha snyad thams cad dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang las gtan tshigs 'gal bar 'gyur ba gang gis lhan cig pa'i sgra sbyong ba tsam gyis dngos po dang 'brel ba'i rtags gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba sgra las byung ba'i tha snyad thams cad dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The reason for applying the term “co-present” is that it is not the case that all terms that arise from sound apply to things in accordance with reality, merely by the application of the term “co-present,” which is the reason for the contradiction of the reason.

original: yang de nyid na re /🔽gal te lhan ci @121a * //
analyzed: yang de nyid na re / gal te lhan ci @121a * //
translated: Again, he says,

original: gi sgra don gcig yin pa de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: gi sgra don gcig yin pa de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin te /
translated: If the term “co-present” has the same meaning as “different,” then the reason is not established.

original: 'di ltar gar dang zla ba dang gyad la lta ba dag la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gar dang zla ba dang gyad la lta ba dag la /
translated: Thus, when one sees dancing, the moon, and a wrestler,

original: lta ba po gcig kho nas dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: lta ba po gcig kho nas dmigs pa'am /
translated: only one observer observes them.

original: sngon po la sogs pa la yang sngon po dang de dmigs pa dag gcig kho na las dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa la yang sngon po dang de dmigs pa dag gcig kho na las dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, with respect to blue and so on, it is not the case that only one thing is observed, namely, blue and its observation.

original: 'di ltar sngon po dmigs na yang rgyud gzhan du gtogs pa'i de dmigs pa rnams ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon po dmigs na yang rgyud gzhan du gtogs pa'i de dmigs pa rnams ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, even when blue is observed, the blue that is observed in other continua is not observed.

original: yang gang gi tshe srog chags thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyud thams cad mkhyen pas sems pa de'i tshe ji ltar gcig kho nas dmigs par grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe srog chags thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyud thams cad mkhyen pas sems pa de'i tshe ji ltar gcig kho nas dmigs par grub par 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, when the mind of all sentient beings is known by the Omniscient One, at that time how could it be established that only one thing is observed?

original: gzhan yang gzhan gyis dmigs pa bkag pa na gcig gis dmigs pa nges par grub par gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzhan gyis dmigs pa bkag pa na gcig gis dmigs pa nges par grub par gyur na /
translated: Moreover, when the observation of another is refuted, the observation of one thing is established.

original: gzhan gyis dmigs pa dgag pa srid pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis dmigs pa dgag pa srid pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not possible to refute the observation of another,

original: rang bzhin gyis bskal ba ni bsgrub pa dang dgag par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //🔽yang lhan cig pa'i sgra dus gcig la brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis bskal ba ni bsgrub pa dang dgag par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro // yang lhan cig pa'i sgra dus gcig la brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: because it is not logical to establish or refute that which is naturally isolated.🔽Moreover, when the word “together” is asserted to mean “at the same time,”

original: dus gcig brjod par 'dod pa yis //
analyzed: dus gcig brjod par 'dod pa yis //
translated: then the word “together”🔽is asserted to mean “at the same time.”

original: sangs rgyas mkhyen par bya sems dang // sems dang sems las byung rnams kyis //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mkhyen par bya sems dang // sems dang sems las byung rnams kyis //
translated: The mind and mental factors

original: kun du gtan tshigs ma nges so //
analyzed: kun du gtan tshigs ma nges so //
translated: are not ascertained as the reason.

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen par bya ba'i rgyud gzhan gyi sems gang yin pa de dang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes 'di lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa yin pa na yang sna tshogs pa nyid yin pa dang de bzhin du sems dang sems las
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen par bya ba'i rgyud gzhan gyi sems gang yin pa de dang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes 'di lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa yin pa na yang sna tshogs pa nyid yin pa dang de bzhin du sems dang sems las
translated: The mind of another continuum that is to be known by the Buddha Bhagavān and the wisdom of the Buddha are ascertained as co-apprehended, but they are also various.🔽Similarly, the mind and mental factors are ascertained as co-apprehended, but they are not one. Therefore, the reason is not ascertained.

original: byung ba rnams lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa yin na yang gcig nyid ma yin pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no zhes zer ba de thams cad yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byung ba rnams lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa yin na yang gcig nyid ma yin pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no zhes zer ba de thams cad yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: All of that is not correct.

original: 'dir gcig kho nas dmigs pa ni gcig dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i don 'di mngon par 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gcig kho nas dmigs pa ni gcig dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i don 'di mngon par 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: Here, the meaning of “apprehended by one alone” is not asserted as “apprehended by one.”

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: shes pa dang shes bya dag ni phan tshun gcig nyid du dmigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya dag ni phan tshun gcig nyid du dmigs pa yin gyi /
translated: Consciousness and the object of consciousness are mutually apprehended as one.

original: logs shig tu ni ma yin no zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: logs shig tu ni ma yin no zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: But not separately.

original: shes pa dmigs pa gang yin pa de kho na shes bya dmigs pa yin la shes bya dmigs pa gang yin pa de kho na shes pa dmigs pa'i yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes pa dmigs pa gang yin pa de kho na shes bya dmigs pa yin la shes bya dmigs pa gang yin pa de kho na shes pa dmigs pa'i yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that whatever is the object of consciousness is the object of the knower of that, and whatever is the object of the knower of that is the object of consciousness.

original: gang zhig shes bya dmigs pa'i bdag nyid shes bya dmigs pa ma yin pa dang / gang zhig shes pa dmigs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa gang dang zla ba dang gyad la lta ba dag la @121b shes pa dmigs pa 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gang las ma grub pa nyid yin /
analyzed: gang zhig shes bya dmigs pa'i bdag nyid shes bya dmigs pa ma yin pa dang / gang zhig shes pa dmigs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa gang dang zla ba dang gyad la lta ba dag la @121b shes pa dmigs pa 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gang las ma grub pa nyid yin /
translated: But there is no object of consciousness that is not the nature of the object of consciousness, nor is there any consciousness that is not the nature of the object of consciousness, because there is no consciousness that is the object of any other consciousness, like the perception of the moon and the perception of the conjurer’s illusion.

original: the tshom za ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: the tshom za ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there any doubt,

original: 'di ltar shes pa'i bdag nyid rig pa gang yin pa de nyid kyi don yin no zhes phyi rol gyi don smra ba gzhan gyis kyang khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa'i bdag nyid rig pa gang yin pa de nyid kyi don yin no zhes phyi rol gyi don smra ba gzhan gyis kyang khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: because the other proponents of external objects accept that whatever is the nature of consciousness is the object.

original: 'dis ni gcig kho na dmigs pa zhes de ltar brtags nas ma grub par smras pa gang yin pa de'i phyogs khas ma blangs pa nyid kyis gsal bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni gcig kho na dmigs pa zhes de ltar brtags nas ma grub par smras pa gang yin pa de'i phyogs khas ma blangs pa nyid kyis gsal bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: This shows that the position of the opponent, who maintains that the object is not established as it is imagined, is clearly seen to be untenable, just by not accepting it.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs kyis gzhan gyi rgyud la 'jug pa'i sems kyi skad cig nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs kyis gzhan gyi rgyud la 'jug pa'i sems kyi skad cig nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The mind of the Blessed Buddha does not penetrate the mind streams of others, because it is not a moment of consciousness.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni sgrub pa thams cad spangs pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni sgrub pa thams cad spangs pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Blessed One is free from the stain of subject and object, because he has abandoned all conceptualization.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de la gzung bya med cing 'dzin pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: de la gzung bya med cing 'dzin pa yod ma yin //
translated: There is no object there, nor is there a subject.

original: de phyir shes pa gzhan gyis gzung bya na yang stong //
analyzed: de phyir shes pa gzhan gyis gzung bya na yang stong //
translated: Therefore, even when it is apprehended by another consciousness, it is empty.

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu ste phyin ci ma log pa bsgrub pa ni bdag po tsam gyi yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu ste phyin ci ma log pa bsgrub pa ni bdag po tsam gyi yin no //
translated: The establishment of the nonerroneous is due to the mere dominant condition.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sngon gyi smon lam gyis bsgos pas rtag tu gzhan gyi bya ba la lhun gyis grub par 'jug go zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam gyis bsgos pas rtag tu gzhan gyi bya ba la lhun gyis grub par 'jug go zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: By being imbued with former aspirations, he always engages spontaneously in the activities of others.

original: 'on te slob dpon chos kyi grags pas yul shes pa'i rgyu nyid kyis nye ba na sngar dmigs la /
analyzed: 'on te slob dpon chos kyi grags pas yul shes pa'i rgyu nyid kyis nye ba na sngar dmigs la /
translated: Or does the master Dharmakirti say that it is previously observed by the cause of the object's cognition, which is proximate?🔽

original: phyis rig pa'o zhe na zhes de ltar phyogs snga ma bstan nas /🔽'dir lhan cig pa'i sgra ni dus gcig pa'i don du bstan gyi /
analyzed: phyis rig pa'o zhe na zhes de ltar phyogs snga ma bstan nas / 'dir lhan cig pa'i sgra ni dus gcig pa'i don du bstan gyi /
translated: But if you maintain that the master Dharmakirti says that consciousness is observed first and then known by reflexive awareness because they are the cause and effect of the cognition of the object,🔽then this is the opponent's position that is being presented.

original: tha mi dad pa'i don ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i don ni ma yin te /
translated: Here the term simultaneous means occurring at the same time, but it does not mean that they are not different.

original: dus gcig brjod par 'dod pa na gzhan la dus tha dad du bstan par rigs kyi /
analyzed: dus gcig brjod par 'dod pa na gzhan la dus tha dad du bstan par rigs kyi /
translated: If you assert that they are simultaneous, it is reasonable to teach that they are different in time,

original: tha mi dad na ni ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: tha mi dad na ni ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: but if they are not different, they are not.

original: dus tha dad pa la dngos po tha dad pas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus tha dad pa la dngos po tha dad pas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not so because being different in time is pervaded by being different things.

original: dus tha dad du bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dus tha dad du bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that they are different in time

original: dmigs pa sna tshogs nyid du bstan pa'i don nyid du ches rigs te /
analyzed: dmigs pa sna tshogs nyid du bstan pa'i don nyid du ches rigs te /
translated: is very reasonable as the meaning of the teaching that the object is various.

original: khyab par bya ba khyab par byed pa la mi 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab par bya ba khyab par byed pa la mi 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the pervasion is not mistaken.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mkhyen par bya ba'i sems kyis gtan tshigs ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mkhyen par bya ba'i sems kyis gtan tshigs ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The Buddha's knowledge is not an uncertain reason.

original: 'di ltar de la gcig la dmigs pa nges pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de la gcig la dmigs pa nges pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, there is no certainty that it has a single object,

original: thams cad kyi rang rang so sor rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi rang rang so sor rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because each one is individually cognized.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis kyang 'khrul ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis kyang 'khrul ba ma yin te /
translated: For this very reason, mind and mental factors are not mistaken,

original: de dag kyang so sor bdag nyid rig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang so sor bdag nyid rig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are individually self-cognizant.

original: ci ste bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs kyis gzhan gyi sems mkhyen pa yin du chug mod de lta na yang ma nges pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs kyis gzhan gyi sems mkhyen pa yin du chug mod de lta na yang ma nges pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: But even if it is granted that the mind of the Blessed One cognizes the mind of another, still there is no uncertainty,

original: nges par ldog pa'i phyir ro //🔽gang @122a * //
analyzed: nges par ldog pa'i phyir ro // gang @122a * //
translated: because it is certain and definite.

original: dag phan tshun dmigs pa sna tshogs pa nyid srid pa gang yin pa de ni nges par ldog pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dag phan tshun dmigs pa sna tshogs pa nyid srid pa gang yin pa de ni nges par ldog pa yin gyi /
translated: That which is possible as a variety of mutually observed objects is certain and definite.

original: dmigs pa dang / rgyud gzhan dang / dus tha dad pas rang gi mtshan nyid sna tshogs pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang / rgyud gzhan dang / dus tha dad pas rang gi mtshan nyid sna tshogs pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a variety of individual characteristics due to different observed objects, different continua, and different times.

original: des na don 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na don 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning of this passage.

original: gang dmigs pa kho nan gang dmigs kyi gzhan du yang ma yin pa'i phyir /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes dmigs pa kho na rgyud gzhan du gtogs pa'i sems dmigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang dmigs pa kho nan gang dmigs kyi gzhan du yang ma yin pa'i phyir / bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes dmigs pa kho na rgyud gzhan du gtogs pa'i sems dmigs pa ma yin la /
translated: because it is only the object of that consciousness, and not of any other.🔽The Bhagavån’s consciousness is only the object of his consciousness, and not of the consciousness of another.

original: rgyud gzhan du gtogs pa'i sems dmigs pa kho na bcom ldan 'das kyis ye shes dmigs pa yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyud gzhan du gtogs pa'i sems dmigs pa kho na bcom ldan 'das kyis ye shes dmigs pa yang ma yin gyi /
translated: The consciousness of another is only the object of the consciousness of another, and not of the Bhagavån’s consciousness.

original: 'on kyang gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that it is not the object of any consciousness.

original: rang rang gi sems so sor rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rang gi sems so sor rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because each person’s consciousness is aware of itself.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzugs dang snang ba dag gis 'khrul pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzugs dang snang ba dag gis 'khrul pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the Bhagavån’s consciousness is mistaken with respect to form and light,

original: snang ba 'ba' zhig kyang mthong ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: snang ba 'ba' zhig kyang mthong ba'i phyir la /
translated: because he sees only light,

original: snang ba dang bral ba'i gzugs la srog chags kyi bye brag 'ga' zhig gis dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba dang bral ba'i gzugs la srog chags kyi bye brag 'ga' zhig gis dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because some species of living beings perceive form without light.

original: de lta bas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'ang mi srid pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'ang mi srid pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is impossible for it to exist in a discordant case, the reason is not unestablished.

original: 'di snyam du gal te yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod par ma nges kyang the tshom za ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod par ma nges kyang the tshom za ba ni ma yin no //
translated: If you think that even though it is not ascertained that it exists in the discordant side, it is not doubted,

original: de lta yin dang gtan tshigs ma nges pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang gtan tshigs ma nges pa kho na yin te /
translated: then it is just an uncertain reason,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog pa la tho tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog pa la tho tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is doubt about the exclusion in the discordant side.

original: 'di ltar yul dang yul can gyi ngo bos nges pa'i phyir gzhan du yang lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa srid pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yul dang yul can gyi ngo bos nges pa'i phyir gzhan du yang lhan cig dmigs pa nges pa srid pa kho na ste /
translated: Thus, because of the certainty of the nature of object and subject, it is only possible that there is certainty of simultaneous observation in other cases as well.

original: gang gi phyir shes pa ni 'dzin par byed pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin te /🔽de'i chos ni yul 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes pa ni 'dzin par byed pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin te / de'i chos ni yul 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because consciousness has the nature of being the apprehender,🔽and its property is the apprehension of the object.

original: yul yang de'i gzung bar bya ba nyid kyis rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: yul yang de'i gzung bar bya ba nyid kyis rang bzhin yin te /
translated: And the object has the nature of being the apprehended of that,

original: de dag ni tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i phyir rtag tu lhan cig 'byung ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i phyir rtag tu lhan cig 'byung ba nyid yin no //
translated: because they always occur simultaneously, being dependent on the same collection.

original: lhan cig 'byung bar khyad par med na yang mig la sogs pa yul nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung bar khyad par med na yang mig la sogs pa yul nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Even though there is no difference in simultaneous occurrence, it is not the case that the eye, etc.🔽become the object.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //🔽'di ltar tshogs pas sngon po la sogs pa'i yul can gyi nges pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi shes pa bskyed par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar tshogs pas sngon po la sogs pa'i yul can gyi nges pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi shes pa bskyed par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: Because it does not have a nature that is like that.

original: mig la sogs par nges pa'i ngo bo ni ma yin la /
analyzed: mig la sogs par nges pa'i ngo bo ni ma yin la /
translated: Thus, the collection generates a consciousness that is certain with respect to the object, such as blue, but not a consciousness that is certain with respect to the eye, etc.

original: sngon po la sogs pa yang des nges pa'i ngo bo skyed kyi /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa yang des nges pa'i ngo bo skyed kyi /
translated: Blue, etc., generates a consciousness that is certain with respect to itself,

original: mig la sogs pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems te /🔽'dzin byed shes bya las @122b gzhan med //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems te / 'dzin byed shes bya las @122b gzhan med //
translated: but not with respect to the eye, etc.🔽Thus, the object and the sense faculty are not certain with respect to each other.🔽The apprehender does not exist apart from the object of apprehension.

original: dbang blo yul med par med de //
analyzed: dbang blo yul med par med de //
translated: The sense faculty and the consciousness do not exist without the object.

original: de lta yin dang lhan cig rig / sngo dang de blo gcig ma yin //
analyzed: de lta yin dang lhan cig rig / sngo dang de blo gcig ma yin //
translated: If that were so, then blue and the consciousness of blue would not be simultaneous.🔽The previous collection

original: tshogs pa snga ma nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: tshogs pa snga ma nyid kyis ni //
translated: generates the object-moment,

original: snang ba dang bcas gzugs ldan pa'i //🔽shes bcas yul gyi skad cig byed //
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas gzugs ldan pa'i // shes bcas yul gyi skad cig byed //
translated: which possesses form and is accompanied by appearance.

original: des na lhan cig rigs par 'gyur //🔽zhes kyang bshad do //
analyzed: des na lhan cig rigs par 'gyur // zhes kyang bshad do //
translated: Thus, simultaneity is reasonable.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: shes bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shes bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “The self of consciousness, etc.”

original: 'brel ba med par tha dad par lhan cig dmigs par nges par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'brel ba med par tha dad par lhan cig dmigs par nges par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable to maintain that distinct things are ascertained as simultaneous observations in the absence of a relation.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that would be absurd.

original: 'dir tha dad pa rig pa la 'brel ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir tha dad pa rig pa la 'brel ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, distinct things are not related in any way.

original: 'di ltar 'brel pa yin pa na de'i bdag nyid dam de las byung ba yin grang /🔽re zhig 'di la de'i bdag nyid ni gzhan gyi 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'brel pa yin pa na de'i bdag nyid dam de las byung ba yin grang / re zhig 'di la de'i bdag nyid ni gzhan gyi 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: If there is a relation, is it the relation of identity or the relation of origination?

original: de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: First, they are not identical, because that is what is being proven.

original: de las byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de las byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor do they originate from each other,

original: lhan cig rig pa'i lhan cig 'byung ba dag la ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med pa'i phyir dang / mig la sogs pa rnams kyang dmigs pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig rig pa'i lhan cig 'byung ba dag la ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med pa'i phyir dang / mig la sogs pa rnams kyang dmigs pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because coexistent things are not related as cause and effect, and it would follow that the eye and so on would be objects of observation.

original: tshogs pa snga ma'i dbang gis cig car ba tsam gyis yul dang yul can gyi dngos po yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tshogs pa snga ma'i dbang gis cig car ba tsam gyis yul dang yul can gyi dngos po yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the mere simultaneity of the object and subject due to the power of a previous collection,🔽because that would contradict the fact that the object and subject are simultaneous.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang / mig la sogs pa rnams kyang phan tshun yul dang yul can gyi ngo bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽tshogs pa so sor nges pas yul dang yul can gyi ngo bor skyed pa'i phyir ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes kyang brjod par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams dang / mig la sogs pa rnams kyang phan tshun yul dang yul can gyi ngo bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // tshogs pa so sor nges pas yul dang yul can gyi ngo bor skyed pa'i phyir ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes kyang brjod par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: because it follows that mind and mental factors, and the eyes and so on, would also be subject and object.

original: rnam par dpyad pa nyid kyis yul dang yul can nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro ;🔽;'brel pa grub na yul dang yul can rigs na /
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa nyid kyis yul dang yul can nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro ; ;'brel pa grub na yul dang yul can rigs na /
