translated: It is also illogical to say that the subject-object relationship is produced by the specific collection of causes, because the subject-object relationship is not established through analysis.🔽If the subject-object relationship were established, then the subject-object relationship would be reasonable.

original: gang gi phyir yul dang yul can gyi dngos po rnam par gzhag pa na 'brel pa de nyid rnam par dpyad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yul dang yul can gyi dngos po rnam par gzhag pa na 'brel pa de nyid rnam par dpyad par bya ba yin no //
translated: But when the subject-object relationship is established, the relationship itself must be analyzed.

original: gang las yul dang yul can gyi dngos po grub par 'gyur ba de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba las ma gtogs pa 'brel ba gzhan yod pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: gang las yul dang yul can gyi dngos po grub par 'gyur ba de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba las ma gtogs pa 'brel ba gzhan yod pa ni ma yin la /
translated: Apart from the identity of the object and the arising from the object, there is no other relationship that would establish the subject-object relationship.

original: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag gis yul dang yul can gyi dngos por rigs pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan zin to //🔽de'i phyir tha dad pa la ji ltar yang lhan cig dmigs pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs the @123a * //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag gis yul dang yul can gyi dngos por rigs pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan zin to // de'i phyir tha dad pa la ji ltar yang lhan cig dmigs pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs the @123a * //
translated: It has already been demonstrated that it is illogical for them to be objects and subjects by way of identity and origination.

original: tshom za'i ma grub pa ga la yin /
analyzed: tshom za'i ma grub pa ga la yin /
translated: Therefore, since it is impossible for different things to be observed together in any way, how could the reason be unestablished or doubtful?

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir sgrub par byed pa gnyis pa bshad pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir sgrub par byed pa gnyis pa bshad pa ni /
translated: A second proof is stated in order to prove that consciousness has aspects:

original: rig pa 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rig pa 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: These cognitions, etc.

original: gang dang rang rig pa yin pa de dang de ni shes pa las don gzhan du gyur ba'i yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dang rang rig pa yin pa de dang de ni shes pa las don gzhan du gyur ba'i yul can ma yin te /
translated: That which is reflexive awareness is not a subjective cognition that is different from the object,

original: bdag nyid rig pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid rig pa bzhin no //
translated: like reflexive awareness.🔽The observation of an evidence that is pervaded by a contradiction is stated:

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'di yang rig pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'di yang rig pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa ste /
translated: This aspect of blue, etc. is reflexive awareness.

original: don gzhan gyi yul can nyid dang 'gal ba don gzhan du gyur ba ma yin pa'i yul can nyid kyis rig pa la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gzhan gyi yul can nyid dang 'gal ba don gzhan du gyur ba ma yin pa'i yul can nyid kyis rig pa la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the subject that is not different from the object is pervaded by the awareness that is not different from the object.

original: khyab pa de nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir //🔽rang rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khyab pa de nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir // rang rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to prove that pervasion, he says,🔽“because all things are devoid of activity.”

original: chos thams cad ni bya ba med pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni bya ba med pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because all things are devoid of activity,

original: don dam par 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig gis 'dzin pa ni ma yin gyi gsal ba'i bdag nyid yin pas de ltar snang ba na rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid 'dzin par byed par brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: don dam par 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig gis 'dzin pa ni ma yin gyi gsal ba'i bdag nyid yin pas de ltar snang ba na rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid 'dzin par byed par brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: ultimately nothing apprehends anything. But because they appear to have the nature of manifestations, it is said that consciousness, which has the nature of awareness, apprehends them.

original: de ltar shes pa dngos su don 'dzin par byed par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar shes pa dngos su don 'dzin par byed par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that consciousness directly apprehends objects,

original: dngos po thams cad rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all things abide in their own nature.

original: de'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi ma yin no //
translated: That which is of the nature of that is not of another.

original: 'di snyam du shes pa'i dngos su rig pa ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba don gyi yin par ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di snyam du shes pa'i dngos su rig pa ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba don gyi yin par ni mi 'dod do //
translated: We do not accept that the object is similar to the way consciousness is directly aware of it.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: rang snang ba skyed par byed pa nyid don rig par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rang snang ba skyed par byed pa nyid don rig par byed pa yin no //
translated: The object is said to be known by the consciousness that produces its own appearance.

original: de lta yin dang gal te dngos su rig pa gtan tshigs su len par byed pa de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de lta yin dang gal te dngos su rig pa gtan tshigs su len par byed pa de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin la /
translated: If you accept that direct awareness is the reason, then the reason is not established.

original: yang ci ste ji zhig ltar rig pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid du sgrub par byed pa yin pa de lta na yang rnam pa de lta bu las 'dod pa sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: yang ci ste ji zhig ltar rig pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba nyid du sgrub par byed pa yin pa de lta na yang rnam pa de lta bu las 'dod pa sgrub pa yin te /
translated: If you are proving that the object is something that is expressed by the word “known,” then you are proving what is already accepted.

original: go'i sgrar mtshungs pas ngag la sogs pa rnams rva can du grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: go'i sgrar mtshungs pas ngag la sogs pa rnams rva can du grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that because the word “cow” is the same, speech and so on are established as having horns.

original: yang shes pa la yod pa'i sngon po'o la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i chos can la brten nas shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs la rnam pa gnyis ka yang gtan tshigs su 'dod pa de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: yang shes pa la yod pa'i sngon po'o la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i chos can la brten nas shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs la rnam pa gnyis ka yang gtan tshigs su 'dod pa de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: Again, in the context of consciousness with aspects, such as the aspected subject “blue,” if both aspects are asserted as the reason, then it is the proof of what is already established.

original: ji skad du /🔽shes pa rnam bcas phyogs la ni //
analyzed: ji skad du / shes pa rnam bcas phyogs la ni //
translated: As it is said:🔽In the context of consciousness with aspects,

original: de yi rnam pa rig pa nyid //🔽de ni tha mi dad grub na //
analyzed: de yi rnam pa rig pa nyid // de ni tha mi dad grub na //
translated: the cognition of its aspects🔽is already established as being undifferentiated.

original: grub pa sgrub pa nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: grub pa sgrub pa nyid du 'gyur //
translated: To prove what is already established is pointless.

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o snyam du sems pa 'di thams cad btsun ba dge srungs de'i @123b dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o snyam du sems pa 'di thams cad btsun ba dge srungs de'i @123b dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: All of these are the thoughts of the venerable Śrīgupta.

original: don gyi rnam pa'i gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don gyi rnam pa'i gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to his qualms is stated with “The reflection that is the aspect of the object…”

original: 'di ni don gyi rnam pa ste don dang 'dra ba yang yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni don gyi rnam pa ste don dang 'dra ba yang yin la /
translated: This is the aspect of the object, which is similar to the object.

original: gzugs brnyan te /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan te /
translated: It is a reflection.

original: snang ba yang yin pas don gyi rnam pa'i gzugs brnyan no //
analyzed: snang ba yang yin pas don gyi rnam pa'i gzugs brnyan no //
translated: It is an appearance. Therefore it is the reflection that is the aspect of the object.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This is the two-part proof.

original: gang gi phyir rnam pa med par smra ba la lta bas yin pa des na grub pa la sgrub pa la ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam pa med par smra ba la lta bas yin pa des na grub pa la sgrub pa la ma yin no //
translated: Because this is so, for the Proponents of Non-Feature, the view is not a proof of what is to be established.

original: nye bar btags nas don gzhan rig pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nye bar btags nas don gzhan rig pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, there is no awareness of a different object that is imputed,

original: gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no reason for imputation.

original: de ltar re zhig rnam pa med pa'i shes pas phyi rol gyi don shes pa ma yin no zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rnam pa med pa'i shes pas phyi rol gyi don shes pa ma yin no zhes bstan nas /
translated: Thus, in this way, it has been demonstrated that consciousness without features does not cognize external objects.

original: phyogs gnyis pa la brten nas rnam pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la brten nas rnam pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is also not the case that there are features, in dependence on the second position, it says:🔽“But if the features are similar to the object,🔽then the object is not cognized by a false feature,

original: 'o na 'dra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'o na 'dra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: because such a feature exists even in a mistaken consciousness.”

original: gang las de'i dbang gis don rnam par 'jog par 'gyur ba yang dag pa'i rnam par rig pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang las de'i dbang gis don rnam par 'jog par 'gyur ba yang dag pa'i rnam par rig pa ma yin la /
translated: The object is not cognized by a correct awareness, by the power of which the object is posited.

original: brdzun pa'i rnam pas don rig par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: brdzun pa'i rnam pas don rig par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Also, the object is not cognized by a false feature,

original: rnam pa de lta bu ni 'khrul ba'i shes pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu ni 'khrul ba'i shes pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because such a feature exists even in a mistaken consciousness.

original: ji ltar rnam pa rnams brdzun pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa rnams brdzun pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How are the aspects false?

original: shes las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shes las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “because of consciousness,” and so on.

original: stan khra bo mthong ba na shes pa gcig las tha mi dad pa'i phyir shes pa'i rang bzhin bzhin du rnam pa rnams kyang du ma nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stan khra bo mthong ba na shes pa gcig las tha mi dad pa'i phyir shes pa'i rang bzhin bzhin du rnam pa rnams kyang du ma nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When one sees a multicolored object, because the aspects are not different from the single consciousness, like the nature of consciousness, the aspects also do not become multiple.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa las tha mi dad pa'i phyir shes pa yang du ma nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa las tha mi dad pa'i phyir shes pa yang du ma nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, because they are not different from the aspects, consciousness also becomes multiple.

original: gang dag rigs 'dra ba'i shes pa rnams kyang rnam pa'i grangs bzhin du mang por stan khra bo la sogs pa la rig mi 'dra ba'i gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du cig car skye bas /
analyzed: gang dag rigs 'dra ba'i shes pa rnams kyang rnam pa'i grangs bzhin du mang por stan khra bo la sogs pa la rig mi 'dra ba'i gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du cig car skye bas /
translated: Those who assert that consciousnesses of the same type, like the consciousnesses of a multicolored object, arise simultaneously, like the consciousnesses of different types of forms, sounds, and so on, are refuted by the argument that consciousnesses of the same type do not arise simultaneously.

original: de lta yin dang thal bar 'gyur ba grub pa la sgrub pa yin no snyam du sems pa de dag gi ltar na yang stan khra bo la ji ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa mang po rig pa de ltar dkar po la sogs pa'i rnam pa
analyzed: de lta yin dang thal bar 'gyur ba grub pa la sgrub pa yin no snyam du sems pa de dag gi ltar na yang stan khra bo la ji ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa mang po rig pa de ltar dkar po la sogs pa'i rnam pa
translated: If you think that the proof of the consequence is the proof of the original proposition, then, just as one sees many aspects of blue, etc., on a multicolored object,🔽so too, one would see many aspects of white, etc., on a single object, because the nature of the object has many parts, such as the front, middle, and back parts.

original: gcig la yang tshu rol dang dbus dang pha rol gyi cha'i ngo bo'i rnam pa mang po yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid de la yang shes pa rnam pa du ma'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig la yang tshu rol dang dbus dang pha rol gyi cha'i ngo bo'i rnam pa mang po yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid de la yang shes pa rnam pa du ma'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the consciousness would also have the nature of many aspects.

original: 'dod pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: If you accept that,

original: da ni gcig pa ji lta bu zhig yin pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni gcig pa ji lta bu zhig yin pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: then now you must explain what kind of singularity you are talking about.

original: rdul phra rab cha med pa'i yul can gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab cha med pa'i yul can gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the object of a partless subtle particle.

original: zhe na / de ni nyams su myong ba dang 'gal te /
analyzed: zhe na / de ni nyams su myong ba dang 'gal te /
translated: That contradicts experience,

original: gang du yang rdul phra rab cha med pa'i ngo bor snang bar mi mngon no //
analyzed: gang du yang rdul phra rab cha med pa'i ngo bor snang bar mi mngon no //
translated: because the nature of a partless subtle particle is not seen anywhere.

original: gang gis de bden pa nyid du grub par @124a * //
analyzed: gang gis de bden pa nyid du grub par @124a * //
translated: By what means is it established as real?

original: bya ba'i phyir shes pa du ma brtags pa legs par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: bya ba'i phyir shes pa du ma brtags pa legs par 'gyur ba /
translated: It is good to examine the many consciousnesses that are for the sake of the object.

original: yul can ma yin pa'i shes pa la yul gyis byas pa'i snga ma dang phyi mar gnas pa rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yul can ma yin pa'i shes pa la yul gyis byas pa'i snga ma dang phyi mar gnas pa rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable that a non-objective consciousness is made by the object to endure in the past and future.

original: yul la khyab pa dang ldan par snang ba yang brdzun pa nyid yin na ji ltar rnam pa rnams bden par 'gyur /
analyzed: yul la khyab pa dang ldan par snang ba yang brdzun pa nyid yin na ji ltar rnam pa rnams bden par 'gyur /
translated: If the appearance of the object as if it were all-pervading is false, how could the aspects be true?

original: yul la khyab par gnas pa'i sngon po la sogs par snang ba las ma gtogs pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa gzhan rigs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yul la khyab par gnas pa'i sngon po la sogs par snang ba las ma gtogs pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa gzhan rigs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Apart from the appearance of blue, etc. as all-pervading in the object, it is not reasonable that there be another aspect of the consciousness of blue, etc.

original: des na shes pa du ma brtags pa don med pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na shes pa du ma brtags pa don med pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is pointless to examine the many consciousnesses.

original: skyon gzhan yang bshad pa ni /
analyzed: skyon gzhan yang bshad pa ni /
translated: Another fault is stated:

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: If it is not all-pervading, etc.

original: mi shes pa ni bems po'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: mi shes pa ni bems po'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The nature of the insentient is non-knowing.

original: sogs pa'i sgras 'dod chags dang bcas pa ma yin pa dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa ma yin pa zhes pa bya ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras 'dod chags dang bcas pa ma yin pa dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa ma yin pa zhes pa bya ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase “and so on” includes “not associated with attachment” and “not associated with aversion.”

original: gzhan gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs gsum pa 'di la brten nas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs gsum pa 'di la brten nas /
translated: This third alternative, “having a different aspect,” is based on the following.

original: gal te gzhan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽yang ci ste shes pa 'ga' zhig gang gis bskyed pa de ni de nyid rig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / yang ci ste shes pa 'ga' zhig gang gis bskyed pa de ni de nyid rig par 'gyur te /
translated: If you think that consciousness is produced by something else,🔽then how could consciousness be aware of itself?

original: des na thams cad rig par mi 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: des na thams cad rig par mi 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If you think that some consciousness is produced by something else, then that consciousness would not be aware of itself.

original: rgyu yang nges par byed par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyu yang nges par byed par mi 'gyur /
translated: If you think that the cause is not necessarily the agent,

original: mig la sogs pa yang rig par bya ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa yang rig par bya ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: then it follows that the eye and so on would be the object of awareness.

original: ji ltar khyed kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas btsun pa dge srungs kyi lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar khyed kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas btsun pa dge srungs kyi lan gyi dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
translated: The venerable Vasubandhu anticipates the objection of the Bhadanta Vasumitra with the words “If you say that consciousness is produced by something else,” and so on.

original: de na re /
analyzed: de na re /
translated: He says this:

original: ji ltar rnam par shes par smra ba khyed cag gi rnam par shes pa don dam par rnam pa med pa yin te /🔽chu khams gser dang nam mkha' rnams //🔽dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par shes par smra ba khyed cag gi rnam par shes pa don dam par rnam pa med pa yin te / chu khams gser dang nam mkha' rnams // dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod //
translated: Just as you Proponents of Consciousness say that consciousness is ultimately devoid of aspects,🔽because it is said, “Just as water, gold, and space are pure,

original: ces gsungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ces gsungs pa'i phyir /
translated: so too are these three said to be pure.”

original: yang rnam pa yang rig par 'dod pa de bzhin du phyi rol la yang yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yang rnam pa yang rig par 'dod pa de bzhin du phyi rol la yang yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Again, just as you assert that aspects are cognition, so too external objects are also like that.

original: 'dir sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dir sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here “mind and mental factors” and so on are mentioned.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa ni dngos su rig pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa ni dngos su rig pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: False means that in actuality there is no cognition.

original: 'di ltar gsal ba'i bdag nyid thun mong ma yin pa nga rgyal gyi gzhan sim pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos snang ba gang yin pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi rang bzhin bdag nyid de dag gi dngos su rig pa yin la shes pa'i bdag
analyzed: 'di ltar gsal ba'i bdag nyid thun mong ma yin pa nga rgyal gyi gzhan sim pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos snang ba gang yin pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi rang bzhin bdag nyid de dag gi dngos su rig pa yin la shes pa'i bdag
translated: The nature of mind and mental factors is that they appear in the form of the uncommon, clear nature of the self-appearance of the mind and mental factors. That is their direct cognition. The nature of the self-appearance of the mind and mental factors is the nature of the self-appearance of the mind and mental factors.

original: nyid de las gzhan de yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam pa rnams kyi rig pa de ni dngos su rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nyid de las gzhan de yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam pa rnams kyi rig pa de ni dngos su rig pa ma yin te /
translated: That cognition of those unreal aspects is not a direct cognition,

original: de dag yang dag pa ma @124b yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag yang dag pa ma @124b yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are not real.

original: btags pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: btags pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it an indirect cognition,

original: gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //🔽'di ltar tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa nyid dam rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid dang / sogs pa'i sgras 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa nyid dam rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid dang / sogs pa'i sgras 'dra ba ste /
translated: because there is no basis for indirect designation.

original: 'di dag gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di dag gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur na /
translated: In this way, the basis for indirect designation would be either dependence on the same collection or the nature of cause and effect, and so on.🔽But none of these are the basis for indirect designation.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa la ni 'di thams cad yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa la ni 'di thams cad yod pa ma yin la /
translated: In the unreal, none of these exist.

original: nye bar btags pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan yang med de /
analyzed: nye bar btags pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan yang med de /
translated: And there is no other basis for indirect designation.

original: ma rig pa'i dbang gis yul med pa nyid du yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam pa ston par byed pa'i shes pa 'khrul pa skye ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i dbang gis yul med pa nyid du yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam pa ston par byed pa'i shes pa 'khrul pa skye ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: It is simply that, due to the power of ignorance, a mistaken consciousness arises that manifests unreal aspects without any object.

original: 'o na 'khrul pa de nyid med pa'i rnam pa rig pa'i gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'khrul pa de nyid med pa'i rnam pa rig pa'i gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if that error itself is the ground for the designation of cognition, then it is the cause of the non-existent aspect.

original: 'dir smra ba ci ste yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir smra ba ci ste yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Here, he says, “What is the use of saying ‘also’?”

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam pa'i yul can du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam pa'i yul can du bstan pa'o //
translated: “That” refers to the object of the unreal aspect.

original: 'di ltar don dam par yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam pa rig par bya ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar don dam par yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam pa rig par bya ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, ultimately, the object of the unreal aspect does not exist,

original: de rig pas rig par bya ba nyid du khas len na yang dag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rig pas rig par bya ba nyid du khas len na yang dag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it is accepted that it is cognized by cognition, it would follow, absurdly, that it is real.

original: yang de nyid na re /
analyzed: yang de nyid na re /
translated: Again, he says,

original: sangs rgyas kyi ni ye shes la'ang /🔽de ni rnam bcas rnam med dang // dus mtshungs dus mi mtshungs skye zhes //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ni ye shes la'ang / de ni rnam bcas rnam med dang // dus mtshungs dus mi mtshungs skye zhes //
translated: “Why does the Buddha’s gnosis🔽Not cognize the existence of the aspect

original: bsam pa ci yi phyir mi 'jug / ces so //
analyzed: bsam pa ci yi phyir mi 'jug / ces so //
translated: As being simultaneous or non-simultaneous with it?”

original: dper na rnam pa dang bcas pas don 'dzin par byed pa rigs pa ma yin no zhes sems par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na rnam pa dang bcas pas don 'dzin par byed pa rigs pa ma yin no zhes sems par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as it is not correct to think that the object is apprehended by the aspect,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes kyis don 'dzin pa la yang ci'i phyir mi dpyod ces zer ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes kyis don 'dzin pa la yang ci'i phyir mi dpyod ces zer ro //
translated: Why does he not investigate the apprehension of objects by the Buddha's knowledge?

original: 'dir de ni rnam pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dir de ni rnam pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here he says, It is not in that way, etc.

original: gang gis 'di la yang sems par byed pa bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes ni de'i 'dzin par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: gang gis 'di la yang sems par byed pa bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes ni de'i 'dzin par mi 'dod do //
translated: He does not accept that the Buddha's knowledge is the apprehender in this case.

original: gang gi phyir de ni sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is free from all obscurations,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog yod pa ma yin no zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog yod pa ma yin no zhes 'dod do //
translated: it is accepted that it does not have the conceptualization of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: gal te yang phyi rol gyi don gzung bar bya ba med pa de lta na yang rgyud gzhan la gnas pa'i sems gzhan yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te yang phyi rol gyi don gzung bar bya ba med pa de lta na yang rgyud gzhan la gnas pa'i sems gzhan yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Even if external objects are not apprehended, is there not another mind existing in another continuum?

original: ci'i phyir de bcom ldan 'das kyis ye shes kyi gzung bar bya bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de bcom ldan 'das kyis ye shes kyi gzung bar bya bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why would that not be apprehended by the Buddha's knowledge?

original: 'di la gzhan gyi 'dod chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di la gzhan gyi 'dod chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here he says, The Buddha's knowledge, etc.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa rig pa ni 'dra ba nyid ston par lhur len pa yin te /🔽de lta ma yin ha cang thal bar @125a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa rig pa ni 'dra ba nyid ston par lhur len pa yin te / de lta ma yin ha cang thal bar @125a * //
translated: The knowledge of the attachment, etc. that exist in the mental continuum of another is the teaching of the mere similarity of that.

original: 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be an absurd consequence.

original: de lta yin dang gal te bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'dra ba nyid yin na de'i tshe bcom ldan gyi ye shes kyang chags par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta yin dang gal te bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'dra ba nyid yin na de'i tshe bcom ldan gyi ye shes kyang chags par 'gyur la /
translated: If that were so, if there were similarity in all respects, then the gnosis of the Bhagavat would be attachment.

original: de lta yin na nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ma spangs par 'gyur ba'i phyir sgrib pa yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ma spangs par 'gyur ba'i phyir sgrib pa yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then the obscurations would exist because the afflictive obstructions would not be abandoned.

original: dmigs pas spyod pa na dmigs pa can te /
analyzed: dmigs pas spyod pa na dmigs pa can te /
translated: When one engages in the object, one is an objectifier.

original: de dag gi lta ba ni gzhung lugs so //
analyzed: de dag gi lta ba ni gzhung lugs so //
translated: Their view is a scriptural system.

original: yang na bcom ldan 'das kyi lta ba la dmigs pa can du khas len pa na zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin no //
analyzed: yang na bcom ldan 'das kyi lta ba la dmigs pa can du khas len pa na zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin no //
translated: Or, the meaning of the phrase “when one accepts the Bhagavat as an objectifier of the view” is this.

original: yang phyogs gcig gis 'dra ba de lta na yang gnyis kyis rnam pa ma spangs pa'i phyir shes bya'i sgrib pa yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang phyogs gcig gis 'dra ba de lta na yang gnyis kyis rnam pa ma spangs pa'i phyir shes bya'i sgrib pa yod par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, even if there were similarity in one respect, the obscurations to omniscience would exist because the two aspects would not be abandoned.

original: gzung bar bya ba'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it possesses the aspect of an apprehended object.

original: 'di ltar gcig la yang dag pa'i ngo bo gnyis rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir de ni gdon mi za bar 'khrul pa nyid du rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gcig la yang dag pa'i ngo bo gnyis rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir de ni gdon mi za bar 'khrul pa nyid du rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, because it is not reasonable for a single entity to have two real natures, it is to be determined that it is certainly a mistake.

original: de lta yin dang 'khrul ba'i sa bon gnas ngan len ma spangs pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis sgrib pa ma spangs pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'khrul ba'i sa bon gnas ngan len ma spangs pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis sgrib pa ma spangs pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then because the seed of error, the negative reflex, is not abandoned, the Lord would not have abandoned the obscurations.

original: 'o na gal te cung zad kyang mi shes na thams cad mkhyen par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te cung zad kyang mi shes na thams cad mkhyen par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If he does not know anything at all, how can he be omniscient?

original: dpag bsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽ma gzigs zhes bya ba ni 'di la gzigs pa ste /
analyzed: dpag bsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / ma gzigs zhes bya ba ni 'di la gzigs pa ste /
translated: He says, “The wish-granting tree,” etc.🔽“Not seeing” means not seeing this, because the object is not present.

original: dmigs pa yod pa ma yin pas na ma gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa yod pa ma yin pas na ma gzigs pa'o //
translated: “Not seeing” means not seeing because the object is not present.

original: sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis lhun gyis grub par dpag bsam gyis shing ltar skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba mtha' dag gi don sgrub par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis lhun gyis grub par dpag bsam gyis shing ltar skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba mtha' dag gi don sgrub par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: By the power of former aspirations, it spontaneously accomplishes the aims of all transmigrating beings in accordance with their fortune, like a wish-granting tree.

original: thams cad mkhyen par brjod kyi /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen par brjod kyi /
translated: Therefore, it is called omniscience,

original: dmigs pa'i stobs kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i stobs kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: but not by the power of an object,

original: rang bzhin gzhan rnam pa thams cad du dmigs par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan rnam pa thams cad du dmigs par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible in any way to perceive a nature that is other.

original: de ltar phyi rol gyi don 'gegs par byed pa'i tshad ma brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar phyi rol gyi don 'gegs par byed pa'i tshad ma brjod nas /
translated: Having thus stated the valid cognition that refutes external objects,

original: gzhan gyis smras pa de'i sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa de'i sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to eliminate the valid cognition that proves what others have said,

original: blo rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽'di ltar phyi rol gyi don mngon sum gyis sam /
analyzed: blo rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'di ltar phyi rol gyi don mngon sum gyis sam /
translated: he says, “The cognitions . . . ,” and so on.🔽In this way, external objects would be established by direct perception

original: rjes su dpag pas grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas grub par 'gyur /
translated: or by inference,

original: tshad ma gzhan yod na yang 'dir 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan yod na yang 'dir 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if there were another valid cognition, it would be included here.

original: de la re zhig mngon sum gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig mngon sum gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: Among those, first, it is not by direct perception.

original: 'di ltar mngon sum du mngon par 'dod pa'i shes pa rnam pa med pas don 'dzin par 'gyur ram rnam pa dang bcas pas yin grang /
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon sum du mngon par 'dod pa'i shes pa rnam pa med pas don 'dzin par 'gyur ram rnam pa dang bcas pas yin grang /
translated: Thus, does a consciousness that is asserted to be perception apprehend an object without an aspect or with an aspect?

original: re zhig rnam pa med @125b pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig rnam pa med @125b pas ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it does not apprehend it without an aspect,

original: nye ba'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye ba'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no cause for the appearance.

original: blo dkar po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin na blo de ci ltar don de'i nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: blo dkar po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin na blo de ci ltar don de'i nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it is not the entity of white, etc., how could that consciousness be the experience of that object?

original: mi 'gyur pa kho na'i zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: mi 'gyur pa kho na'i zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: It could not be, as was previously explained.

original: ci ste rnam pa dang bcas pas yin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste rnam pa dang bcas pas yin na de'i tshe /
translated: But if it is with an aspect, then at that time,

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gcig pu shes par gtogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi don lkog tu gyur ba kho nar 'gyur gyi mngon sum ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gcig pu shes par gtogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi don lkog tu gyur ba kho nar 'gyur gyi mngon sum ni ma yin no //
translated: because the aspect of blue, etc., which is a single entity included in consciousness is observed, the external object would be completely hidden and not a perception.

original: 'di ltar gcig ni shes pa'i gzugs brnyan la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gcig ni shes pa'i gzugs brnyan la /
translated: Thus, one is the reflection of consciousness,

original: gzhan ni de gtod par byed pa sngon po gnyis ni nam yang rig pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan ni de gtod par byed pa sngon po gnyis ni nam yang rig pa med do //
translated: and the other is the object that casts it. Blue and consciousness are never known.

original: de ltar re zhig mngon sum gyis ma grub po //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig mngon sum gyis ma grub po //
translated: Thus, it is not established by direct perception.

original: 'o na rjes su dpag pas grub pa la rag mod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na rjes su dpag pas grub pa la rag mod ce na /
translated: Well, it is established by inference.

original: 'di la btsun pa dge srungs tshad ma byed pa ni gang zhig mi slu ba nyid na shes pa'i rnam pa yin pa de ni rnam pa de lta bu'i dngos po gzhan gyis bskyed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di la btsun pa dge srungs tshad ma byed pa ni gang zhig mi slu ba nyid na shes pa'i rnam pa yin pa de ni rnam pa de lta bu'i dngos po gzhan gyis bskyed pa yin te /
translated: In this regard, Bhadanta-Srilata says: “The valid cognition is that which is non-deceptive, and it is a form of consciousness that is generated by an object that has a form like itself.

original: dper na 'dzin pa'i rnam pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'dzin pa'i rnam pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the form of the object.

original: de ltar 'di dogs pa bsu nas /

analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: mi slu ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni de ltar bur gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gsum pa'o //

original: mi slu ba nyid kyis nye bar mtshon pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa gang dag yin pa de dag rgyu de shes pa'i rnam pa rigs mthun pa las skyes par bsgrub par byas so //

translated: The aspect of consciousness that is characterized by nondeceptiveness is established as arising from a cause that is a concordant type with the aspect of consciousness.

original: shes pa bzhin te 'dzin pa'i rnam pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa bzhin te 'dzin pa'i rnam pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: de thob par nus pa'i mi slu ba nyid du gtan tshigs kyi khyad par du 'dod pa de'i tshe phyi rol gyi don la bsnyon pa'i rnam par rig pa tsam du smra ba la de ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs gang yang rung ba la grub pa yin
analyzed: de thob par nus pa'i mi slu ba nyid du gtan tshigs kyi khyad par du 'dod pa de'i tshe phyi rol gyi don la bsnyon pa'i rnam par rig pa tsam du smra ba la de ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs gang yang rung ba la grub pa yin
translated: then the reason is not established.🔽If

original: no // ci ste mngon par 'dod pa'i don byed par snang ba'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid mi slu ba nyid du 'dod pa de'i tshe bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: no // ci ste mngon par 'dod pa'i don byed par snang ba'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid mi slu ba nyid du 'dod pa de'i tshe bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you maintain that the non-deceptiveness of the cognition that appears to perform the desired function is the reason, then the counterexample is not refuted, because the evidence is not shown to be inconclusive.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las bzlog pa la the tshom za bas gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin te /🔽dmigs pa med pa'i shes pa la yang rnam pa de lta bu'i @126a * //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las bzlog pa la the tshom za bas gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin te / dmigs pa med pa'i shes pa la yang rnam pa de lta bu'i @126a * //
translated: The reason is inconclusive because there is doubt about the reversal of the counter-position.

original: mi slu ba nyid mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi slu ba nyid mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because non-deceptive cognition is not contradictory even in the case of cognition without an object.

original: mi 'gal ba nyid du sgrub pa'i don du dper na chu la sogs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mi 'gal ba nyid du sgrub pa'i don du dper na chu la sogs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to prove that there is no contradiction, he says, “For example, water, etc.”

original: gzhan yang dmigs pa med pa nyid yin na yang rjes su dpag pa la mi slu ba nyid yod pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod par nges pa'i phyir gzhal bya la sogs pa bzhin du gtan tshigs thun mong gi ma nges pa nyid du gsal lo //
analyzed: gzhan yang dmigs pa med pa nyid yin na yang rjes su dpag pa la mi slu ba nyid yod pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod par nges pa'i phyir gzhal bya la sogs pa bzhin du gtan tshigs thun mong gi ma nges pa nyid du gsal lo //
translated: Moreover, even if there is no object, there is non-deceptiveness in inference, so it is clear that the reason is inconclusive due to being present in the counter-position, like the object of cognition, etc.

original: 'di snyam du rjes su dpag par rnam par rtog pa'i dmigs pa med pa nyid ma grub pa yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du rjes su dpag par rnam par rtog pa'i dmigs pa med pa nyid ma grub pa yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that the non-existence of the object of the conceptualizing of inference is not established,

original: mi la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mi la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: [the author] says, “a man, etc.,” etc.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gis rnam pas stong pa de ni de'i yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gis rnam pas stong pa de ni de'i yul can ma yin te /
translated: The application is this: that which is empty of the aspect of that is not the object of that,

original: dper na gzugs kyi shes pa sgra'i yul can ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gzugs kyi shes pa sgra'i yul can ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: like the consciousness of form is not the object of sound.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa yang phyi rol gyi rnam pas stong pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa yang phyi rol gyi rnam pas stong pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The pervasion is: the consciousness of inference is empty of the aspect of the external object.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The reason is not unestablished.

original: 'di ltar me la sogs pa gsal ba gang yin pa de ni rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa de dang 'dra ba ste mtshungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar me la sogs pa gsal ba gang yin pa de ni rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa de dang 'dra ba ste mtshungs pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, that which is manifest, such as fire, is not similar to the aspect of the consciousness of inference.

original: de ni mi gsal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mi gsal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because it is not clear.

original: de lta ma yin na ji ltar so sor nges pa'i rtsva dang lo ma'i me la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi ngo bos mngon sum gyi shes pa la snang ba de ltar rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa la yang snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ji ltar so sor nges pa'i rtsva dang lo ma'i me la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi ngo bos mngon sum gyi shes pa la snang ba de ltar rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa la yang snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then just as the particular things, such as the fire of grass and leaves, appear in the cognition of direct perception, so they would also appear in the inferential cognition.

original: 'di ltar so sor nges pa'i ngo bo spangs nas go bar byed pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i spyi'i ngo bos rjes su dpag pa la lkog tu gyur pa'i me la sogs pa snang la /
analyzed: 'di ltar so sor nges pa'i ngo bo spangs nas go bar byed pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i spyi'i ngo bos rjes su dpag pa la lkog tu gyur pa'i me la sogs pa snang la /
translated: Thus, having abandoned the particular thing, the fire, etc., which is hidden, appears in the inferential cognition by means of the universal thing which is the subject of the proposition, and which is the cause of the cognition of the hidden thing.

original: spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid kyis phan tshun 'gal ba gnyis gcig la rigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid kyis phan tshun 'gal ba gnyis gcig la rigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not reasonable that two things which are mutually exclusive by the nature of being universal and particular should be one.

original: zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: This has been explained previously.

original: gtan tshigs 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the reason contradictory,

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is present in the similar instance.

original: ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it inconclusive,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would lead to absurdity.

original: gzhal bya nyid sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'od byed pa'i tshad ma dag dogs par byed pa yin te de na re /🔽gang 'di sngon po la sogs pa yul rnam par chad par snang ba de ni nyams su myang ba las chad pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhal bya nyid sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'od byed pa'i tshad ma dag dogs par byed pa yin te de na re / gang 'di sngon po la sogs pa yul rnam par chad par snang ba de ni nyams su myang ba las chad pa yin te /
translated: The passage beginning “The object itself, etc.” expresses the doubt about the illumination of valid knowledge.

original: gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir dang / mi rtag pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dang / rkyen yin pa'i phyir dang / rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir /🔽rgyud gzhan gyi sems bzhin no @126b zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs thams cad la 'khrul pa ste ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir dang / mi rtag pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dang / rkyen yin pa'i phyir dang / rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir / rgyud gzhan gyi sems bzhin no @126b zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs thams cad la 'khrul pa ste ma nges pa yin te /
translated: In that regard, some say: “The appearance of a discrete object such as blue is discrete from the experience because it is an object of comprehension, because it is impermanent, because it is an effect, because it is a condition, and because it possesses a cause.🔽It is like the mind of another continuum.”

original: nang du nyams su myong ba la yang gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang du nyams su myong ba la yang gzhal bya nyid la sogs pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All those reasons are mistaken, that is, inconclusive, because it is possible that the internal experience is an object of comprehension, and so on.

original: de bzhin du rab rib can la sogs pa'i shes pa la yang snang ba'i zla ba gnyis la sogs pas kyang ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rab rib can la sogs pa'i shes pa la yang snang ba'i zla ba gnyis la sogs pas kyang ma nges pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, the appearance of two moons, etc., in the consciousness of someone with an eye disease is inconclusive.

original: zla ba la sogs pa'o snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul nyid kyis zla ba gnyis la sogs pa gzhal bya nyid du blta bar bya'i shes pa gang la de dag snang ba de la ltos nas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: zla ba la sogs pa'o snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul nyid kyis zla ba gnyis la sogs pa gzhal bya nyid du blta bar bya'i shes pa gang la de dag snang ba de la ltos nas ni ma yin te /
translated: The object of a conceptual consciousness that thinks “moon” and so on is the object of comprehension of the two moons and so on.

original: de dag la don du zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la don du zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not in terms of the consciousness in which those appear that they are objects of comprehension, because there is no conception of them as objects.

original: skra shad la sogs don min te //
analyzed: skra shad la sogs don min te //
translated: The hairs and so on are not objects,

original: don du zhen pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: don du zhen pa med phyir ro //
translated: because there is no conception of them as objects.

original: zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is explained.🔽Kumārila’s system🔽Kumārila’s system

original: 'di la phyi rol zhes bya ba la sogs pas ku m'a ra ri la'i lugs kyis 'khrul pa'i yul ma grub par dogs par byed de /🔽de na re /
analyzed: 'di la phyi rol zhes bya ba la sogs pas ku m'a ra ri la'i lugs kyis 'khrul pa'i yul ma grub par dogs par byed de / de na re /
translated: Kumārila and others argue that the object of error is not established, as follows.

original: 'dir ser po dang zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i ser po la 'khrul pa'i yul nyid du nye bar bkod pa la phyi rol gyi dung la sogs pa'i don nyid ser po la sogs pa'i ngo bos dmigs te /
analyzed: 'dir ser po dang zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i ser po la 'khrul pa'i yul nyid du nye bar bkod pa la phyi rol gyi dung la sogs pa'i don nyid ser po la sogs pa'i ngo bos dmigs te /
translated: Here, in the case of the presentation of yellow and the two moons and so on as the object of error, the external object, such as a conch, is perceived as having the nature of yellow and so on.

original: de phyir 'khrul par mi 'grub po //🔽zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de phyir 'khrul par mi 'grub po // zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore error is not established.🔽This is what they say.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: snang bzhin ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: snang bzhin ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Appears” and so on.

original: 'dir sdud pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir sdud pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the verse is as follows:

original: shes pa gang la rnam pa gang kho na snang ba de kho na des rig go zhes bya bar rigs kyi de lta ma yin na shes pa thams cad thams cad kyi yul can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa gang la rnam pa gang kho na snang ba de kho na des rig go zhes bya bar rigs kyi de lta ma yin na shes pa thams cad thams cad kyi yul can du 'gyur ro //
translated: It is logical to say that a consciousness is aware of only that image which appears to it. If it were otherwise, then all consciousnesses would have all things as their objects.

original: de lta bas na snang bas rig pa la khyab la /
analyzed: de lta bas na snang bas rig pa la khyab la /
translated: Therefore, awareness is necessarily concomitant with appearance.

original: ser po'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa la dkar po'i rnam pa snang ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ser po'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa la dkar po'i rnam pa snang ba yang ma yin te /
translated: And a consciousness that has the aspect of yellow does not perceive an image of white,

original: snang bar mngon par 'dod pa ma dmigs pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa snang ba log pa na khyab par bya ba rig pa yang ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: snang bar mngon par 'dod pa ma dmigs pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa snang ba log pa na khyab par bya ba rig pa yang ldog pa yin no //
translated: because the appearance of white is not observed, and when the pervader, appearance, is eliminated, then the pervaded, awareness, is also eliminated.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig rnam pa gang la mi snang ba de ni des rig par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig rnam pa gang la mi snang ba de ni des rig par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever does not appear as an aspect to a consciousness is not perceived by that consciousness,

original: dper na sgra'i shes pa la gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sgra'i shes pa la gzugs bzhin no //
translated: like a sound to a consciousness of form.

original: dung dkar po'i ngo bo yang ser po'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa la mi snang ngo zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dung dkar po'i ngo bo yang ser po'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa la mi snang ngo zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the non-observation of a more extensive property.

original: de yang rig la zhes bya ba la 'dis ni rang gi chig dang 'gal bar bstan to //
analyzed: de yang rig la zhes bya ba la 'dis ni rang gi chig dang 'gal bar bstan to //
translated: And this is the contradiction with his own words.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na zhes ha cang thal bar 'gyur bas rang rig pa sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na zhes ha cang thal bar 'gyur bas rang rig pa sgrub par byed de /
translated: Therefore, because of the absurd consequence, it proves reflexive awareness.

original: des na rgyal dpog pas blo mngon sum ma yin pa dang rnam pa med pa'o zhes 'dod pa gang yin pa de yang bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: des na rgyal dpog pas blo mngon sum ma yin pa dang rnam pa med pa'o zhes 'dod pa gang yin pa de yang bsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the assertion of the Jains that cognition is not a direct perception and that it has no aspect is also refuted.

original: de'i phyir @127a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir @127a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa mjug sdud par byed de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa mjug sdud par byed de /
translated: he concludes.

original: rtog par byed pa na don nyid rnam pa gzhan de yod pa bdog pa rtog par byed do zhes 'brel te //
analyzed: rtog par byed pa na don nyid rnam pa gzhan de yod pa bdog pa rtog par byed do zhes 'brel te //
translated: When it conceives, it conceives of the existence of the very object that has another aspect.

original: 'dis kyang ku m'a ra ri las smras pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang ku m'a ra ri las smras pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: This also refutes the statement of Kumārila.

original: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ku m'a ra ri la nyid kyi tshad ma'i phreng ba chad pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ku m'a ra ri la nyid kyi tshad ma'i phreng ba chad pa yin te /
translated: Kumarila’s own series of reasonings is interrupted by the words “If you say” and so on.

original: gang zhig gzugs 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa de ni gzugs de las tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gzugs 'dzin par byed pa'i shes pa de ni gzugs de las tha dad pa yin te /
translated: The cognition that apprehends form is different from that form,

original: gzugs de rig pa na de mi rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs de rig pa na de mi rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when that form is cognized, it is not cognized.

original: la sogs pa 'dzin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: la sogs pa 'dzin pa bzhin no //
translated: Like the apprehension of taste and so on.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na gzugs la sogs pa'i gzung bar bya ba'i 'dzin pa las tha dad pa yin te /🔽'di lta ste gang gi phyir 'dzin pa de rtog pa ma rtog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na gzugs la sogs pa'i gzung bar bya ba'i 'dzin pa las tha dad pa yin te / 'di lta ste gang gi phyir 'dzin pa de rtog pa ma rtog pa'i phyir te /
translated: Or, the apprehension of the object such as form is different from the apprehension of form and so on,

original: ro la sogs pa 'dzin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ro la sogs pa 'dzin pa bzhin no //
translated: because the apprehension of that is conceptual, unlike the apprehension of taste and so on.

original: yang na gnyis po ni gzugs la sogs pa dang ni 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: yang na gnyis po ni gzugs la sogs pa dang ni 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Or, the two, form and so on and the apprehension of form and so on,

original: phan tshun tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun tha dad pa yin te /
translated: are mutually different,

original: gang yang rung ba rnam par rtog pa na gzhan mi rtog pa'i phyir ro dang gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba rnam par rtog pa na gzhan mi rtog pa'i phyir ro dang gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because when one is imagined, the other is not imagined, like taste and form and so on.

original: yang na gcig tu mi shes pa'i phyir rgyud gzhan gyi sems bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na gcig tu mi shes pa'i phyir rgyud gzhan gyi sems bzhin no //
translated: Or, they are not known to be one, like the mind of another continuum.

original: yang na shes pa ni rang gi cha 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na shes pa ni rang gi cha 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: Or else, consciousness does not apprehend its own parts,

original: shes pa las skyes pa'i phyir bag chags zhes bya ba'i shes pa'i nus pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shes pa las skyes pa'i phyir bag chags zhes bya ba'i shes pa'i nus pa bzhin no //
translated: because it arises from consciousness, like the potentiality of consciousness called a latent impression.

original: de bzhin du shes pa gzung ba'i cha dgag pa yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes pa gzung ba'i cha dgag pa yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the refutation of the apprehended part of consciousness should be stated.

original: 'di lta ste dper na shes pa'i cha ni shes pa'i gzung bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na shes pa'i cha ni shes pa'i gzung bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: For example, a part of consciousness is not the object of apprehension of consciousness,

original: shes pa las skyes pa'i phyir shes pa'i nus pa bag chags bzhin no //
analyzed: shes pa las skyes pa'i phyir shes pa'i nus pa bag chags bzhin no //
translated: because it arises from consciousness, like the potentiality of consciousness called a latent impression.

original: ji ltar de ma thag pa'i gtan tshigs gnyis po 'di la bsgrub bya'i chos dang ldan pa'i dpe grub ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar de ma thag pa'i gtan tshigs gnyis po 'di la bsgrub bya'i chos dang ldan pa'i dpe grub ce na /

analyzed: phyogs 'di yin zhes bya ba ni gzhan du phyi rol gyi don bsgrub pa'i phyir nye bar bkod pa la 'di ni nyes pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: The phrase “this position” refers to the position that is set forth by the opponent in order to prove the existence of external objects.🔽If the opponent asserts that the nonexistence of duality is the object to be established, then how can that be tenable?

original: gzhan gyis ji ltar gnyis su med pa bsgrub bya nyid du 'dod ci snang bzhin pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i ram par shes pa'i ngo bo nyams su myong ba grub pa med pa'i phyir yin na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ji ltar gnyis su med pa bsgrub bya nyid du 'dod ci snang bzhin pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i ram par shes pa'i ngo bo nyams su myong ba grub pa med pa'i phyir yin na /
translated: Because there is no experience of the nature of consciousness that perceives blue and so on, as it really is.

original: 'di ji ltar 'thad pa yin /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar 'thad pa yin /
translated: How can that be tenable?

original: de lta yin na thams cad med par 'gyur bar gang smras pa 'dir brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta yin na thams cad med par 'gyur bar gang smras pa 'dir brjod par bya ste /
translated: If that were the case, then the statement “everything would be nonexistent” would have to be addressed here.

original: thams cad med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad med pa ma yin te /
translated: Everything is not nonexistent.

original: rang las tha dad pa'i gzung bar bya ba sa la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: rang las tha dad pa'i gzung bar bya ba sa la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because the apprehended object, such as earth, that is different from consciousness does not exist by way of its intrinsic identity.

original: rgyud gzhan gyi gzung bar bya ba'i ngo bor med pa'i phyir gzung ba'i rnam pas stong pa yin la de la ltos pa'i rnam par shes par byed pas rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir shes pa'i byed pa po nyid du rab tu brtags pa gang yin pa🔽de med pa'i phyir 'dzin pa'i rnam pas stong pa yin gyi rnam par shes @129a * //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan gyi gzung bar bya ba'i ngo bor med pa'i phyir gzung ba'i rnam pas stong pa yin la de la ltos pa'i rnam par shes par byed pas rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir shes pa'i byed pa po nyid du rab tu brtags pa gang yin pa de med pa'i phyir 'dzin pa'i rnam pas stong pa yin gyi rnam par shes @129a * //
translated: Because it does not exist as the entity apprehended by another mind, it is empty of the aspect of the apprehended. Because it is the consciousness that depends on that, it is consciousness.🔽Therefore, the one imputed to be the agent of consciousness

original: pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyang thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyang thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: does not exist. Therefore, it is empty of the aspect of the apprehender. It is not that the intrinsic identity of consciousness does not exist in any way.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: so sor la sogs gang shes las //
analyzed: so sor la sogs gang shes las //
translated: From the consciousness of each and so on

original: phyi rol lta bur snang ba de //🔽mi bden de phyir phyi rol gyi //
analyzed: phyi rol lta bur snang ba de // mi bden de phyir phyi rol gyi //
translated: that appears as if external,🔽since that is not true,

original: shes bya nyid du byed yod min //
analyzed: shes bya nyid du byed yod min //
translated: external objects do not exist as objects of knowledge.

original: rig pa'i byed po'i ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: rig pa'i byed po'i ngo bo nyid //
translated: The intrinsic identity of the agent of cognition

original: de la ltos par 'dod pa gang //
analyzed: de la ltos par 'dod pa gang //
translated: is asserted to depend on that.

original: de ni mi bden de ltar na //
analyzed: de ni mi bden de ltar na //
translated: Since that is not true,

original: rig pa gnyis med nges par bya //🔽zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rig pa gnyis med nges par bya //🔽zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: it is ascertained that cognition is nondual.

original: de ltar byas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzhung mtshan nyid stong pa nyid nye bar bzung nas rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i ngo bos stong ngo zhes bya ba 'di yang legs par drangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzhung mtshan nyid stong pa nyid nye bar bzung nas rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i ngo bos stong ngo zhes bya ba 'di yang legs par drangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does it that way, then this statement, “Consciousness is empty of the entityness of consciousness,” which is based on the Perfection of Wisdom scriptures that take emptiness of intrinsic identifiability as their topic, is well drawn.

original: de lta na gang dang gang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba la bsgrub bya dang / gtan tshigs kyi khyab pa bsgrubs nas mjug sdud pa ni /
analyzed: de lta na gang dang gang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba la bsgrub bya dang / gtan tshigs kyi khyab pa bsgrubs nas mjug sdud pa ni /
translated: Thus, having established the pervasion of the probandum by the reason in the root syllogism, “Whatever is consciousness is necessarily empty of intrinsic identifiability,” he concludes:

original: de phyir rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur yid //
analyzed: de phyir rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur yid //
translated: Therefore, the mind that is the basis of dispute

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: is not the basis of dispute.

original: rtsod pa'i gzhi'i khyad par gyis ni 'dir skyon med pa'i mig la sogs pa'i khyad par 'di bsgrub bya'i chos can du bstan gyi /
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhi'i khyad par gyis ni 'dir skyon med pa'i mig la sogs pa'i khyad par 'di bsgrub bya'i chos can du bstan gyi /
translated: The qualification of the basis of dispute indicates that the special faultless eye, etc. are taught as the subjects of the probandum here,

original: thams cad kyi spyi ni ma yin no zhes shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi spyi ni ma yin no zhes shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
translated: but not the generality of all. The reason is “because of the knowledge that . . . ”

original: des na dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig gtan tshigs nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: des na dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig gtan tshigs nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason is not one part of the meaning of the thesis.

original: rig bya byed po dang bral phyir //
analyzed: rig bya byed po dang bral phyir //
translated: Because of the absence of an object of cognition and a cognizer.

original: zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i khyad par yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i khyad par yin no //
translated: This is the distinction of nonduality.

original: rig bya dang rig byed gnyis dang bral bas gnyis med par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: rig bya dang rig byed gnyis dang bral bas gnyis med par 'dod kyi /
translated: It is asserted that there is nonduality because of the absence of both an object of cognition and a cognizer.

original: thams cad du med pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad du med pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not because of complete nonexistence.

original: gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba ni yul can la yul btags pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan gyi shes pa ni gzugs brnyan gyi sgras brjod do //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba ni yul can la yul btags pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan gyi shes pa ni gzugs brnyan gyi sgras brjod do //
translated: The cognition of a reflection is referred to by the word reflection because the object is imputed to the subject.

original: yang na bdun pa'i mtha' can gyi ldan par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na bdun pa'i mtha' can gyi ldan par bya ste /
translated: Or, it is connected with the suffix -ana,

original: des na shes pa nyid shugs kyis brten par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na shes pa nyid shugs kyis brten par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: so that cognition itself is implied.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The reason is not unestablished.

original: khyad par gzhan spangs nas rang gi ngo bo nyid de ltar bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: khyad par gzhan spangs nas rang gi ngo bo nyid de ltar bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because its own nature is taught in that way, having eliminated other distinctions.

original: shes pa po nyid du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa po nyid du ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not as a knower.

original: 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it contradictory.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it exists in a concordant class.

original: gzugs brnyan la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan dag dpe bsgrub bya la tshang ba nyid du ston te /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan dag dpe bsgrub bya la tshang ba nyid du ston te /
translated: In a reflection, etc.

original: @129b gang gi phyir mig gi 'od zer dag me long la sogs pa'i ngos la gtugs nas log pa na rang gi byad la sogs pa dang 'brel pa yin la /
analyzed: @129b gang gi phyir mig gi 'od zer dag me long la sogs pa'i ngos la gtugs nas log pa na rang gi byad la sogs pa dang 'brel pa yin la /
translated: Because the light rays of the eye, having struck the surface of a mirror, etc., turn back and connect with one’s own face, etc.,

original: de las de dag de lta bur byad la sogs pa rtogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de las de dag de lta bur byad la sogs pa rtogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: and from that they become the cause of the cognition of one’s face, etc. in that way.

original: des na rang gi byad la sogs pa nyid de ltar me long la sogs pa'i nad du chud pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos snang ba yin no //
analyzed: des na rang gi byad la sogs pa nyid de ltar me long la sogs pa'i nad du chud pa la sogs pa'i ngo bos snang ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, one’s own face, etc. appear in that way in the aspect of the surface of the mirror, etc.

original: de lta yin dang gzugs brnyan gyi shes pa la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis dang bral bar ma grub po //🔽de ltar rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: de lta yin dang gzugs brnyan gyi shes pa la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis dang bral bar ma grub po // de ltar rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: If that were so, the cognition of a reflection would not be established as free from the duality of apprehended and apprehender.

original: rang gi byad la sogs pa de ltar ma thong ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi byad la sogs pa de ltar ma thong ba ni ma yin te /
translated: In response to that, he says, “It is not the case that one’s own face, etc. are not seen in that way.”

original: rang gi byad la sogs pa de mngon sum du phyogs par mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi byad la sogs pa de mngon sum du phyogs par mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the face, etc. are seen to be directly in front of it.

original: yul dang tshad dang kha dog la sogs pa tha dad pas mthong ba'i phyir //
analyzed: yul dang tshad dang kha dog la sogs pa tha dad pas mthong ba'i phyir //
translated: Because the object, the measure, the color, etc. are seen to be different.

original: de ltar rang bzhin la sogs mthong min zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin la sogs mthong min zhes 'brel to //
translated: Thus, the connection is: “because the face, etc. are not seen as having a nature, etc.”

original: dngos po gzhan bzhin no zhes bya ba ni sgra la sogs pa'i dngos po bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan bzhin no zhes bya ba ni sgra la sogs pa'i dngos po bzhin no //
translated: “Like other things” means like the things sound, etc.

original: ji skad du yang bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: ji skad du yang bstan pa yin te /
translated: It is also taught:

original: gal te shes pa byad la sogs pa 'dzin par gyur na de'i tshe ji ltar de'i byad la sogs pa rnam par gnas pa de kho na ltar 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te shes pa byad la sogs pa 'dzin par gyur na de'i tshe ji ltar de'i byad la sogs pa rnam par gnas pa de kho na ltar 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: If consciousness were to apprehend the face, etc., then just as the face, etc. are arranged, it would apprehend them in just that way.

original: gzhan gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa'i gzung bar bya ba gzhan du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa'i gzung bar bya ba gzhan du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that the apprehended object of a consciousness having another aspect be different,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: 'di ltar lho phyogs su kha bltas nas gnas pa me long gi ngos la lta ba na rang gi byad la nang du bltas par mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar lho phyogs su kha bltas nas gnas pa me long gi ngos la lta ba na rang gi byad la nang du bltas par mthong ngo //
translated: Thus, when one stands facing south and looks at the surface of a mirror, one sees one’s face as if it were facing inward.

original: de bzhin du me long shin tu chung ba'i ngos la rang gi byad shin tu chen po yang gzugs brnyan shin tu chung bar dmigs la /
analyzed: de bzhin du me long shin tu chung ba'i ngos la rang gi byad shin tu chen po yang gzugs brnyan shin tu chung bar dmigs la /
translated: Likewise, in a very small mirror, one sees a very large face as a very small image.

original: de bzhin du me long gi ngos dang 'brel pa ni khron par gting du zhugs pa lta bur snang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du me long gi ngos dang 'brel pa ni khron par gting du zhugs pa lta bur snang ste /
translated: Likewise, the face appears to be connected to the surface of the mirror as if it had entered the well.

original: de'i tshe me long gi ngos kyang nge snyed zab pa ma yin la bdag nyid byad de dang 'brel pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe me long gi ngos kyang nge snyed zab pa ma yin la bdag nyid byad de dang 'brel pa yang ma yin no //
translated: At that time, the surface of the mirror is not that deep, and one’s face is not connected to it.

original: de bzhin du mtsho chu dri ma med pa'i 'gram na gnas pa'i shing dang ri la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan shing dang ri'i rtse mo thur du bltas pa dmigs na /
analyzed: de bzhin du mtsho chu dri ma med pa'i 'gram na gnas pa'i shing dang ri la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan shing dang ri'i rtse mo thur du bltas pa dmigs na /
translated: Likewise, when one sees the images of trees, mountains, and so on, standing on the bank of a clear lake, with the tops of the trees and mountains turned downward,

original: de ltar de dag gnas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de dag gnas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: they are not actually standing in that way.

original: de lta bas na de lta yin gyi shes pa ni rang gi byad la sogs pa 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na de lta yin gyi shes pa ni rang gi byad la sogs pa 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is like this: consciousness does not apprehend its own face and so on,

original: de dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir sgra'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir sgra'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is not similar to them, like the consciousness of sound.

original: btsun pa dge srungs na re /
analyzed: btsun pa dge srungs na re /
translated: Bhadanta Shrıghosa says:

original: blo tsam nyid ni @130a * //
analyzed: blo tsam nyid ni @130a * //
translated: The mere mind is the object

original: bsgrub bya la //
analyzed: bsgrub bya la //
translated: to be established.🔽Whatever is the means of establishing

original: shes phyir la sogs sgrub byed gang //🔽rigs mi mthun dang mi 'gal phyir //
analyzed: shes phyir la sogs sgrub byed gang // rigs mi mthun dang mi 'gal phyir //
translated: that it is the object of knowledge, etc.,🔽is not contradicted by anything dissimilar,

original: thams cad lhag ldan yin par brjod //🔽ces zer te /
analyzed: thams cad lhag ldan yin par brjod // ces zer te /
translated: and so it is said to be a universal.

original: de la rnam shes nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la rnam shes nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here, he says, “consciousness itself,” etc.

original: rnam pa med pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang po nyid du khyab pa bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang po nyid du khyab pa bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the pervasion has already been established by “without aspects,” etc.,

original: gtan tshigs ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: the reason is not indeterminate.

original: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas kyis /
analyzed: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas kyis /
translated: Ācārya Dignāga said:

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen rnam par gzhag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen rnam par gzhag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to present the objective condition,

original: nang gi shes bya'i ngo bo ni //
analyzed: nang gi shes bya'i ngo bo ni //
translated: The internal object of knowledge

original: phyi rol ltar snang gang yin te //🔽don yin rnam shes ngo bo'i phyir //
analyzed: phyi rol ltar snang gang yin te // don yin rnam shes ngo bo'i phyir //
translated: appears as if it were external.

original: de rkyen nyid kyang yin phyir ro //
analyzed: de rkyen nyid kyang yin phyir ro //
translated: Because it is an object, and because it is the nature of consciousness,

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is also a condition.

original: 'dis ni gzung ba'i cha la yul du rnam par gzhag par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzung ba'i cha la yul du rnam par gzhag par bstan to //
translated: This shows that the apprehended aspect is posited as the object.

original: gzhan yang yang na nus pa 'jog phyir rim gyis kyang /🔽don du snang ba de ni rang dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i nus pa rnam par shes pa'i rten can byed pas mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang yang na nus pa 'jog phyir rim gyis kyang / don du snang ba de ni rang dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i nus pa rnam par shes pa'i rten can byed pas mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Moreover, in order to posit potency, it is also sequential.🔽The appearance of objects is not contradictory because it is the basis of consciousness that generates the effect that is concordant with itself.

original: 'dis ni don gzhan ma yin pa'i shes pa la rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa'i rgyu mtshan nus pa 'jog pa'i phyir so sor snang ba de rgyu nyid du bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni don gzhan ma yin pa'i shes pa la rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa'i rgyu mtshan nus pa 'jog pa'i phyir so sor snang ba de rgyu nyid du bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: This proves that the individual appearances are the cause because the reason for generating the effect that is concordant with itself is posited as potency in consciousness that is not a different object.

original: de la btsun pa de nyid kyis /
analyzed: de la btsun pa de nyid kyis /
translated: In this regard, the Venerable One says:

original: gal te dbang po'i rnam rig ni ;
analyzed: gal te dbang po'i rnam rig ni ;
translated: If the sense consciousness

original: / gzung ba'i cha ni rgyur gyur na'ang //
analyzed: / gzung ba'i cha ni rgyur gyur na'ang //
translated: is the cause of the apprehended aspect,
