original: de ni de ltar mi snang bas //
analyzed: de ni de ltar mi snang bas //
translated: it does not appear like that,

original: dbang po bzhin du de yul min //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sun 'byin par smras pa 'di la /
analyzed: dbang po bzhin du de yul min // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sun 'byin par smras pa 'di la /
translated: so it is not the object like the sense faculty.

original: mjug thogs shes la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mjug thogs shes la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this refutation, he says, “The immediately preceding consciousness,” and so on.

original: mjug thogs shes pa nus pa la gzhi tha dad pa'i bdun pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: mjug thogs shes pa nus pa la gzhi tha dad pa'i bdun pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second half-verse is about the potential of the immediately preceding cognition.

original: mjug thogs shes la zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen kun gzhi zhes bya ba la nus pa gang yin pa rnam pa de lta bu'i don snang bas bsgrub pa de kho na nyid du mi 'dod do //
analyzed: mjug thogs shes la zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen kun gzhi zhes bya ba la nus pa gang yin pa rnam pa de lta bu'i don snang bas bsgrub pa de kho na nyid du mi 'dod do //
translated: The immediately preceding cognition is the equivalent immediately preceding condition. The potential that is in the foundation consciousness is not accepted as the establishment of the appearance of objects in that way.

original: gang gi phyir slob dpon gyis rdul phra rab la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa'i dmigs pa rigs pa ma yin no zhes rgyas par bstan nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir slob dpon gyis rdul phra rab la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa'i dmigs pa rigs pa ma yin no zhes rgyas par bstan nas /
translated: Because the master has extensively taught that it is illogical for there to be an object of observation that is not included in the subtle particles and so on.

original: thams cad du dmigs pa'i rkyen bkag nas grags pas gnod pa dang / de bzhin du mos las dmigs pa dang / bdag po dang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa dang / rgyu'i rkyen gyis mtshan nyid kyi rkyen bzhi'o zhes gsungs @130b pa'i phyir khas blangs pas gnod par yang 'gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas mi 'gal bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad du dmigs pa'i rkyen bkag nas grags pas gnod pa dang / de bzhin du mos las dmigs pa dang / bdag po dang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa dang / rgyu'i rkyen gyis mtshan nyid kyi rkyen bzhi'o zhes gsungs @130b pa'i phyir khas blangs pas gnod par yang 'gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas mi 'gal bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The dominant condition is the five faculties. The immediately preceding condition is the immediately preceding cessation of the mind and mental factors. The causal condition is the four characteristics.”🔽In order to demonstrate that there is no contradiction, it is said:🔽In the world and in treatises, the objective condition is asserted in whatever way.

original: 'jig rten dang bstan bcos su rnam pa ji lta bu'i dmigs pa'i rkyen mngon par 'dod pa de ltar kun rdzob tu bstan gyi //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang bstan bcos su rnam pa ji lta bu'i dmigs pa'i rkyen mngon par 'dod pa de ltar kun rdzob tu bstan gyi //
translated: It is taught conventionally in that way.

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: But not ultimately.

original: don dam par ni shes pa thams cad dmigs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni shes pa thams cad dmigs pa med pa yin no //
translated: Ultimately, all consciousnesses are without an object of observation.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las phyi rol gyi don brtag pa ste nyi shu brgyad pa'o /🔽// / rang dbang thos la ma zhen cing //
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las phyi rol gyi don brtag pa ste nyi shu brgyad pa'o /🔽// / rang dbang thos la ma zhen cing //
translated: This is the twenty-eighth chapter, on the examination of external objects, from the root text of the Commentary on the Jewel Lamp.

original: zhes bya ba 'di bsgrub pa'i don du gzhan dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di bsgrub pa'i don du gzhan dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to prove this, he says, “Others say that the instigator is the reason for the presentation of dharma and nondharma, etc.”

original: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni rgyal dpog pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni rgyal dpog pa rnams so //
translated: Others are the Lokāyatas.

original: de dag ni 'di skad du zer te skul bar byed pa nyid chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa rnams par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni 'di skad du zer te skul bar byed pa nyid chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa rnams par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan yin te /
translated: They say that the instigator is the reason for the presentation of dharma and nondharma, etc.

original: srog chags thams cad kyi snang bar gyur pa thun mong gi mig lta bur rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: srog chags thams cad kyi snang bar gyur pa thun mong gi mig lta bur rnam par gzhag go //
translated: It is presented as the common eye of all living beings.

original: gdon mi za bar de nyid chos dang chos ma yin pa don du gnyer ba'i rtog pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu rnams kyis tshad ma nyid du brten par bya'o //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar de nyid chos dang chos ma yin pa don du gnyer ba'i rtog pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu rnams kyis tshad ma nyid du brten par bya'o //
translated: Undoubtedly, it is the instigator that is relied upon as valid knowledge by persons who are engaged in seeking dharma and nondharma.

original: gzhan skyes bus byas pa'i tshig la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan skyes bus byas pa'i tshig la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the words of other persons.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags pa dang ma rig pa dang ldan pa'i sems can gyi skyes bu'i tshig ni dbang po las 'das pa phyin ci ma log pa'i don rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags pa dang ma rig pa dang ldan pa'i sems can gyi skyes bu'i tshig ni dbang po las 'das pa phyin ci ma log pa'i don rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the words of a person who is a sentient being, who is endowed with attachment and ignorance, are not able to realize the meaning that is beyond the senses and is nonerroneous.

original: de'i phyir tshig des chos la sogs pa rtogs par nus pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig des chos la sogs pa rtogs par nus pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, those words are not able to realize phenomena and so on.

original: tshu rol mthong ba'i mngon sum gyis rtogs par nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tshu rol mthong ba'i mngon sum gyis rtogs par nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor are they able to be realized by the direct perception of one who sees only this side,

original: de ni dbang po las 'das pa nyid kyi shin tu lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dbang po las 'das pa nyid kyi shin tu lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are extremely hidden, since they are beyond the senses.

original: 'di ltar chos dang chos ma yin pa dag gi mtshan nyid ni 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa sgrub par byed par rung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos dang chos ma yin pa dag gi mtshan nyid ni 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa sgrub par byed par rung ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the characteristics of phenomena and nonphenomena are suitable to be established as desirable and undesirable.

original: ji skad du ri khrod pas byas pa'i bshad pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du ri khrod pas byas pa'i bshad pa las /
translated: As it is said in the commentary composed by Paṇḍitakīrti:

original: legs par byed pa gang yin pa de kho na chos kyi sgras brjod do //
analyzed: legs par byed pa gang yin pa de kho na chos kyi sgras brjod do //
translated: Whatever is well done is expressed by the word “phenomenon.”

original: ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How is this known?

original: gang mchod sbyin nyams su len pa'i skyes bu de ni chos byed yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang mchod sbyin nyams su len pa'i skyes bu de ni chos byed yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: The person who performs the sacrifice is called a dharma.

original: gang gi byed pa po gang yin pa de ni des brjod de /
analyzed: gang gi byed pa po gang yin pa de ni des brjod de /
translated: The one who is the agent of that is called by that name.

original: dper na 'tshang pa yod pa bca' ba po bzhin no zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'tshang pa yod pa bca' ba po bzhin no zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like saying that the one who has a pit is the one who digs the pit.

original: des na gang zhig skyes bu la legs par bsgrub pa de kho na chos kyi sgras brjod do //🔽de'i phyir 'dis ni rdzas la sogs pa 'dod pa'i don sgrub par byed par rung ba nyid @131a * //
analyzed: des na gang zhig skyes bu la legs par bsgrub pa de kho na chos kyi sgras brjod do // de'i phyir 'dis ni rdzas la sogs pa 'dod pa'i don sgrub par byed par rung ba nyid @131a * //
translated: Therefore, whatever is well accomplished by a person is called by the word dharma.

original: chos yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, this shows that dharma is the suitability for accomplishing the desired object, such as substance, and so on.

original: 'di ltar mchod sbyin gyi sgras rdzas dang yon tan dang las legs par sgrub par byed pa'i khyad par rnams brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar mchod sbyin gyi sgras rdzas dang yon tan dang las legs par sgrub par byed pa'i khyad par rnams brjod do //
translated: Thus, the word sacrifice expresses the particular substances, qualities, and actions that are well accomplished.

original: de la chos kyi sgra 'jug par bstan to //
analyzed: de la chos kyi sgra 'jug par bstan to //
translated: It is taught that the word dharma applies to that.

original: gal te yang rdzas la sogs pa de dag rang gi ngo bos mngon sum yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te yang rdzas la sogs pa de dag rang gi ngo bos mngon sum yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, if those substances and so on are directly perceived by their own nature,

original: legs par bsgrub pa nyid kyis ni ma yin la /
analyzed: legs par bsgrub pa nyid kyis ni ma yin la /
translated: it is not by their being well accomplished.

original: de'i ngo bos de dag chos nyid du 'dod kyi rang gi ngo bo tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bos de dag chos nyid du 'dod kyi rang gi ngo bo tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: They are asserted to be the reality of those by the nature of that, but not by the nature of their own substance.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: legs pa skyes bu'i yid 'ong ste //🔽de rdzas las dang yon tan gyi //
analyzed: legs pa skyes bu'i yid 'ong ste // de rdzas las dang yon tan gyi //
translated: The good is pleasing to the mind of a person.🔽It is established by the nature of

original: skul ba'i mtshan nyid kyis bsgrub bya //
analyzed: skul ba'i mtshan nyid kyis bsgrub bya //
translated: stimulating substance and quality.

original: de phyir de dag la chos nyid //
analyzed: de phyir de dag la chos nyid //
translated: Therefore, those are the reality🔽of those.

original: 'di dag dbang po'i yul can na //
analyzed: 'di dag dbang po'i yul can na //
translated: These are the objects of the sense faculties.

original: de yi ngo bos chos ma yin //
analyzed: de yi ngo bos chos ma yin //
translated: They are not the reality by the nature of that.

original: 'di dag legs par sgrub byed pa //
analyzed: 'di dag legs par sgrub byed pa //
translated: These are well established

original: rtag tu rig byed kyis rtogs 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag tu rig byed kyis rtogs 'gyur //
translated: and always realized by the Vedas.

original: de yi ngo bo nyid kyi chos //
analyzed: de yi ngo bo nyid kyi chos //
translated: The reality of that

original: de'i phyir dbang po'i spyod yul min //🔽zhes zer ba bzhin no //🔽de'i ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni legs par bsgrub pa'i ngo bos so ;
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po'i spyod yul min // zhes zer ba bzhin no // de'i ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni legs par bsgrub pa'i ngo bos so ;
translated: is not the domain of the sense faculties.🔽The nature of that means by the nature of good establishment.

original: / de lta bas na rung ba nyid ni chos yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: / de lta bas na rung ba nyid ni chos yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the proper is the reality.

original: chos las bzlog pas shugs kyis chos ma yin pa yang mi 'dod pa'i don bsgrub par rung ba zhes gsal bar nges par bya'o //
analyzed: chos las bzlog pas shugs kyis chos ma yin pa yang mi 'dod pa'i don bsgrub par rung ba zhes gsal bar nges par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be clearly understood that the meaning of the statement is that it is not possible to establish the existence of a non-entity by the negation of an entity.

original: rung ba nyid tshu rol mthong bas mngon du bya bar nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rung ba nyid tshu rol mthong bas mngon du bya bar nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it possible for one who sees only what is near at hand to perceive the possibility of an entity.🔽For that is always to be inferred from its effect.

original: de ni rtag tu 'bras bus rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rtag tu 'bras bus rjes su dpag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As it was said:

original: dngos po rnams kyi nus pa ni //🔽'bras bu don gyi go bas bsgrub //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi nus pa ni // 'bras bu don gyi go bas bsgrub //
translated: The capacity of things

original: ces gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ces gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: is established by the understanding of the meaning of the effect.

original: de lta ma yin na tshu rol mthong ba nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tshu rol mthong ba nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, then one who sees only what is near at hand would be impaired.

original: rnal 'byor ba'i mngon sum gyis kyang dbang po las 'das pa yul du byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba'i mngon sum gyis kyang dbang po las 'das pa yul du byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor does the direct perception of the yogi have as its object what is beyond the senses,

original: mngon sum yin pa'i phyir mngon sum gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: mngon sum yin pa'i phyir mngon sum gzhan bzhin no //
translated: because it is a direct perception, like another direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pas chos dang chos ma yin pa rtogs par byed par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas chos dang chos ma yin pa rtogs par byed par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it reasonable to maintain that one can understand Dharma and non-Dharma by means of inference.

original: 'brel ba grub pa nyid kyis dngos po des yongs su gcod pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: 'brel ba grub pa nyid kyis dngos po des yongs su gcod pa'i phyir la /
translated: because the thing is completely determined by the establishment of the connection.

original: chos kyang de lta bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyang de lta bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not the case with the property.

original: chos rtogs par bya ba la nye bar 'jal ba yang nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos rtogs par bya ba la nye bar 'jal ba yang nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it possible to understand the property by analogy,

original: 'di ltar nye bar 'jal ba ni bskal pa la 'dra ba'i blo skyed par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar nye bar 'jal ba ni bskal pa la 'dra ba'i blo skyed par byed pa yin te /
translated: because analogy produces a cognition that is similar to the one that occurred previously,

original: dper na ba men mthong ba na ba lang dran pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ba men mthong ba na ba lang dran pa bzhin no //
translated: just as when one sees a gayal, one remembers a cow.

original: gang las 'dra ba las de rtogs par 'gyur ba chos dang 'dra ba 'ga' zhig rtogs par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no /
analyzed: gang las 'dra ba las de rtogs par 'gyur ba chos dang 'dra ba 'ga' zhig rtogs par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no /
translated: But there is no understanding of any property that is similar to the property that would be understood from the similarity.

original: @131b chos dang chos ma yin pa rtogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: @131b chos dang chos ma yin pa rtogs par 'gyur la /
translated: One would understand the property and the non-property.

original: don gyis go ba yang nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don gyis go ba yang nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it possible to understand the meaning by implication,

original: 'di ltar mthong ba dang thos pa'i don gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir don gzhan rtog pa ni don gyis go ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong ba dang thos pa'i don gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir don gzhan rtog pa ni don gyis go ba yin la /
translated: because it is not tenable that the meaning of what is seen or heard is different, and the conception of a different meaning is understanding by implication.

original: gang las 'di rtog par 'gyur ba chos med par don mi 'thad pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang las 'di rtog par 'gyur ba chos med par don mi 'thad pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But there is no dharma that is not tenable without an object, from which this could be imagined.

original: tshad ma med pa'i dngos po med pa yang med pa zhes bya ba'i don 'di bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir nus kyi sgrub pa la ni ma yin no //🔽de lta bas na dngos po med pa'i khar zhugs pa'i chos dang chos ma yin pa dag gal te skul bar byed pas gdon mi za bar mi nus na de nyid kyis zos par 'gyur ba'i phyir skul bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don gyi chos la sogs
analyzed: tshad ma med pa'i dngos po med pa yang med pa zhes bya ba'i don 'di bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir nus kyi sgrub pa la ni ma yin no // de lta bas na dngos po med pa'i khar zhugs pa'i chos dang chos ma yin pa dag gal te skul bar byed pas gdon mi za bar mi nus na de nyid kyis zos par 'gyur ba'i phyir skul bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don gyi chos la sogs
translated: And the nonexistence of a thing that is not established by a valid cognition is not established by the word “nonexistence.”🔽Therefore, if the instigator of dharmas and nondharmas, which are nonexistent things, is not necessarily powerless, then he would be devoured by that very thing.

original: pa dbang po la sogs pas mi mtshon gyi /
analyzed: pa dbang po la sogs pas mi mtshon gyi /
translated: Therefore, the instigator of dharmas and so on, which are characterized by instigation, is not perceived by the senses and so on.

original: skul bar byed pas byung ba dang 'byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang phra ba dang / chod pa dang bskal ba zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rigs can gyis don rtogs par nus kyi /
analyzed: skul bar byed pas byung ba dang 'byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang phra ba dang / chod pa dang bskal ba zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rigs can gyis don rtogs par nus kyi /
translated: But the instigator is able to understand the meaning of such things as “arisen from the instigator,” “arising,” “will arise,” “subtle,” “obstructed,” and “remote.”

original: gzhan dbang pos ni nam yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dbang pos ni nam yang ma yin no //
translated: But no one else is able to understand it.

original: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar skul bar byed pa tshad mar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar skul bar byed pa tshad mar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the instigator must be accepted as valid.

original: skul bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba la 'jug par byed pa dang ldog par byed pa'i ngag la brjod de /
analyzed: skul bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba la 'jug par byed pa dang ldog par byed pa'i ngag la brjod de /
translated: The instigator is said to be the speech that engages in action and turns away from action.

original: 'di lta ste dper na mtho ris 'dod pa sbyin sreg gis mchod sbyin bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na mtho ris 'dod pa sbyin sreg gis mchod sbyin bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: For example, “One who desires heaven should perform sacrifice by means of fire” is an instigator to engage in action.

original: 'byung po rnams la 'tshe bar mi bya'i zhes bya ba ni ldog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung po rnams la 'tshe bar mi bya'i zhes bya ba ni ldog par byed pa'o //
translated: “One should not harm living beings” is an instigator to turn away from action.

original: de yang tshad ma yin pa na gang 'di khyed cag gi khams gsum po ni rnam par rig pa tsam mo zhes dam bcas pa'i don de rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang tshad ma yin pa na gang 'di khyed cag gi khams gsum po ni rnam par rig pa tsam mo zhes dam bcas pa'i don de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: If that is valid, then the meaning of your thesis, “The three realms are consciousness only,” is not reasonable.

original: gang las she na /🔽thos pas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang las she na / thos pas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is that?🔽Because it is undermined by scripture.

original: thos pa ste rig byed kyis gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos pa ste rig byed kyis gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is undermined by scripture, that is, by the Vedas.

original: sems las ma gtogs pa'i me'i sbyin sreg la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir dang / bdag nyid kyang sems las tha dad du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems las ma gtogs pa'i me'i sbyin sreg la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir dang / bdag nyid kyang sems las tha dad du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it teaches the fire sacrifice and so on that are not separate from mind, and because the self also exists as separate from mind.

original: sems tsam gyi tshul ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: sems tsam gyi tshul ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: The mode of mind-only is illustrated,

original: de bzhin du skad cig ma dang bdag med pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i dam bca' ba la yang gnod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du skad cig ma dang bdag med pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i dam bca' ba la yang gnod pa kho na ste /
translated: and likewise, the thesis of momentariness, selflessness, omniscience, freedom from attachment, and so on are also undermined,

original: de dang 'gal ba'i don yongs su gsal bas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba'i don yongs su gsal bas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning that contradicts them is clearly established.

original: 'di snyam du gal te ngo tshad ma nyid du grub par gyur na 'di thams cad la gnod par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /🔽de ni @132a * //
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te ngo tshad ma nyid du grub par gyur na 'di thams cad la gnod par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na / de ni @132a * //
translated: If you think that all of this is undermined if valid cognition is established,🔽then he says,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa ni tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa ni tshad ma yin la /
translated: Nonerroneous consciousness is valid cognition,

original: de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de yang tshad ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de yang tshad ma zhes bya'o //
translated: and because it is the cause of that, it is also called valid cognition.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: skyes bus ma byas pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “because it is not made by a person.”

original: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not made by a person.

original: 'dis ni phyin ci log gi rgyu 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa'i tshogs med pas phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyin ci log gi rgyu 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa'i tshogs med pas phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that because it is free from the collection of faults such as desire, which are the causes of error, it is the cause of nonerroneous knowledge.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig log pa nyid kyi rgyu 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang ldan pa dang bral ba de ni phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig log pa nyid kyi rgyu 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang ldan pa dang bral ba de ni phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: That which is free from the faults such as desire, which are the causes of error, is the cause of nonerroneous knowledge,

original: dper na mig rab rib la sogs pas ma bslad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mig rab rib la sogs pas ma bslad pa bzhin no //
translated: like, for example, the eye that is not affected by diseased vision.

original: rig byed kyang skyes bus ma byas pa'i phyir log pa nyid kyi rgyu 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rig byed kyang skyes bus ma byas pa'i phyir log pa nyid kyi rgyu 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: Because the Vedas are not made by a person, they are free from the faults such as desire, which are the causes of error. This is a natural inference.

original: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i sgo nas ma nges pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i sgo nas ma nges pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To eliminate the charge of inconclusiveness by means of an example that is contrary to the conclusion,🔽he says,

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “Thus” and so on.

original: 'dis ni sgrub par byed pa med pa dang bsgrub par bya ba med pa'i khyab pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni sgrub par byed pa med pa dang bsgrub par bya ba med pa'i khyab pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the pervasion that there is no proof and there is no probandum.

original: 'di ltar log pa nyid kyi rgyu nyes pa rnams gang la nye ba de nyid la rang gi 'bras bu log pa nyid nye bar gnas par byed kyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar log pa nyid kyi rgyu nyes pa rnams gang la nye ba de nyid la rang gi 'bras bu log pa nyid nye bar gnas par byed kyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the effect of error, error itself, occurs in relation to those who are proximate to the causes of error, but not in relation to others,

original: rgyu med par 'bras bu mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med par 'bras bu mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because an effect does not occur without a cause.

original: 'byung na yang rgyu med pa can du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung na yang rgyu med pa can du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if it did occur, it would follow that it would be causeless.

original: de med par 'byung ba ni de'i 'bras bu nyid du rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de med par 'byung ba ni de'i 'bras bu nyid du rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not logical that it occurs without that, that is, that it is its effect.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: This is because it would follow that there would be an absurdity.

original: de lta bas na log pa nyid dang nyes pa dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi 'thad pa'i phyir rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur ba ni log pa nyid kyi bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma
analyzed: de lta bas na log pa nyid dang nyes pa dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi 'thad pa'i phyir rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur ba ni log pa nyid kyi bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the reason is not established.

original: yin no // sbyor ba ni gang la gang gi rgyu med pa de ni der 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yin no // sbyor ba ni gang la gang gi rgyu med pa de ni der 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is without a cause of something is not the cause of that,

original: dper na chu la rgyu ba med pa'i du ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na chu la rgyu ba med pa'i du ba bzhin no //
translated: like smoke without a cause of movement in water.🔽Also, in regard to hearing, there is no collection of faults such as confusion, the cause of error.

original: thos pa la yang phyin ci log gi rgyu rmongs pa la sogs pa'i skyon gyi tshogs yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa la yang phyin ci log gi rgyu rmongs pa la sogs pa'i skyon gyi tshogs yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the non-apprehension of the cause.

original: ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the reason is not unestablished,

original: nyes pa yod dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nyes pa yod dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “There is no fault, etc.”

original: nyes pa rnams ni skyes bu la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: nyes pa rnams ni skyes bu la brten pa yin te /
translated: Faults depend on a person.

original: de'i chos yin pa'i phyir de ji ltar de dag rang gi rten med par 'byung bar @132b 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i chos yin pa'i phyir de ji ltar de dag rang gi rten med par 'byung bar @132b 'gyur /
translated: Because they are the qualities of that, how could they arise without their basis?

original: 'gyur na yang rten med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gyur na yang rten med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If they did, it would follow that they would be without a basis.

original: 'di ltar brten pa'i chos ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar brten pa'i chos ni 'di yin te /
translated: Because a phenomenon that is a basis is like this:

original: rten gyi rjes su byed pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rten gyi rjes su byed pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is that which conforms with its basis.

original: nyes pa'i rten yang byed pa po'i skyes bu yin te /
analyzed: nyes pa'i rten yang byed pa po'i skyes bu yin te /
translated: The basis of faults is the person who is the agent,

original: de yang rig byed la sogs pa'i phyir gang gis gtan tshigs the tshom za ba'i ma grub par yang 'gyur ba nyes pa'i dogs pa ga las yin /
analyzed: de yang rig byed la sogs pa'i phyir gang gis gtan tshigs the tshom za ba'i ma grub par yang 'gyur ba nyes pa'i dogs pa ga las yin /
translated: and since he is the object of the Vedas and so on, how could there be the fault of the reason being inconclusive and unestablished?

original: 'di snyam du nyes pa'i rten gyi byed pa po med par yang ji ltar grub snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du nyes pa'i rten gyi byed pa po med par yang ji ltar grub snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think, “How could the person who is the basis of faults be established if he does not exist?”

original: de'i phyir de 'dzin par byed pa'i tshad ma lnga ldog pas de med par ston pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de 'dzin par byed pa'i tshad ma lnga ldog pas de med par ston pa ni /
translated: Then in order to show that he does not exist because the five valid means of knowledge that apprehend him are refuted, he says:

original: re zhig byed pa po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: re zhig byed pa po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The so-called agent and so on.

original: re zhig rig byad kyi byed pa po mngon sum gyis grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig rig byad kyi byed pa po mngon sum gyis grub pa ma yin te /
translated: First, the creator of the Vedas is not established by direct perception.

original: 'di ltar de ni 'di yin no zhes rva nas bzung nas bstan par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni 'di yin no zhes rva nas bzung nas bstan par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible to point out the creator of the Vedas and say, “This is it.”

original: de ltar ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not observed.

original: byed pa po byung bar gyur to zhes /
analyzed: byed pa po byung bar gyur to zhes /
translated: If it is to be imagined that the creator of the Vedas existed in the past,🔽and if that is not seen, then it is said that the creator of the Vedas existed in the past.

original: de ltar brtag par bya ba yin na de yang ma mthong ba na nam zhig byung bar gyur to zhes 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni tshad ma med pa can zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de ltar brtag par bya ba yin na de yang ma mthong ba na nam zhig byung bar gyur to zhes 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni tshad ma med pa can zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: The assertion that the creator of the Vedas exists is called “baseless.”

original: rdzas su dpag pas kyang ma grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir /🔽sngon du 'brel ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rdzas su dpag pas kyang ma grub po zhes bstan pa'i phyir / sngon du 'brel ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate that it is not established by inference, he says,🔽“The connection between the Vedas and the creator of the Vedas is not seen.”

original: rig byed la smos pa rnams kyis rig byed kyi bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi byed pa po'i 'brel ba gang zhig de ltar sngar ma mthong bas byed pa de ni mi shes pa'i rgyu can yin te /
analyzed: rig byed la smos pa rnams kyis rig byed kyi bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi byed pa po'i 'brel ba gang zhig de ltar sngar ma mthong bas byed pa de ni mi shes pa'i rgyu can yin te /
translated: The connection between the Vedas and the creator of the Vedas is the nature of the relationship between the object to be created and the creator. Since that is not seen, the creator of the Vedas is not known.

original: shes par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no valid cognition to prove it.

original: 'ga' zhig gis ma mthong ba'i me dang lhan cig du ba'i 'brel ba gzung bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis ma mthong ba'i me dang lhan cig du ba'i 'brel ba gzung bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: One cannot apprehend the connection between smoke and fire when one does not see the fire.

original: de lta bas na rjes su dpag pa dang bral yang de ni byed pa por rtogs pa byed do //
analyzed: de lta bas na rjes su dpag pa dang bral yang de ni byed pa por rtogs pa byed do //
translated: Therefore, even without inference, one can ascertain the existence of the creator.

original: yang gi sgras mngon sum dang bral ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //
analyzed: yang gi sgras mngon sum dang bral ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //
translated: The word “also” indicates that it is not only the absence of perception.

original: sgra las byung ba'i tshad ma dgag pa ni /
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i tshad ma dgag pa ni /
translated: The refutation of the valid cognition of verbal testimony is as follows:

original: de grub don du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de grub don du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “The purpose of that is established,” etc.

original: rig byed las ma gtogs pa'i ma byas pa med pa'i phyir re zhig ma byas pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rig byed las ma gtogs pa'i ma byas pa med pa'i phyir re zhig ma byas pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since there is no non-ritual action apart from the Vedas, there is no such thing as non-ritual action.

original: byas pa yang med de /
analyzed: byas pa yang med de /
translated: Ritual action also does not exist.

original: de ni rang nyid tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rang nyid tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is not a valid cognition itself.

original: 'di ltar lung byas pa yin pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar lung byas pa yin pa na /
translated: Thus, when the Vedas are said to be created,

original: rig byed dang 'brel ba drang srong shed la sogs pa'i skyes bu byed pa po yin pa'am /
analyzed: rig byed dang 'brel ba drang srong shed la sogs pa'i skyes bu byed pa po yin pa'am /
translated: the creator is either the person who is the author, such as Ṛṣi Vyāsa, or the creator of the world.

original: de dang ma 'brel pa'i sh'akya thub pa la sogs pas byas pa yin grang /
analyzed: de dang ma 'brel pa'i sh'akya thub pa la sogs pas byas pa yin grang /
translated: Or, if it is not related to that, it is made by Śākyamuni, etc.

original: phyogs @133a * //🔽dbang po'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: phyogs @133a * // dbang po'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: The second position is:

original: shed la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shed la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: With regard to the second position, he says, “If it is not related to that, etc.”

original: de nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba ni rig byed kyis te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba ni rig byed kyis te /
translated: “By that” means by the Vedas.

original: 'dis ni rang gis tshad ma'i dngos por bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rang gis tshad ma'i dngos por bstan to //
translated: This shows that it is not established by its own valid cognition.

original: phyogs gnyis pa la yang skyon bshad pa ni /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la yang skyon bshad pa ni /
translated: The error in the second position is also explained:

original: 'brel ba med cing zhes bya ba ste ;
analyzed: 'brel ba med cing zhes bya ba ste ;
translated: “If it is not related, etc.”

original: 'brel ba med pa ni rig byed dang ste /
analyzed: 'brel ba med pa ni rig byed dang ste /
translated: It is not related to the Vedas.

original: de la mi dbang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mi dbang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the authority for that.

original: rig byed pa po'i lung ni rig byed pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: rig byed pa po'i lung ni rig byed pa ston pa'o //
translated: The testimony of the author of the Vedas is the teaching of the Vedas.

original: byed po gzhan can zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba med pa'i skyes bu'i byed pa po can no //
analyzed: byed po gzhan can zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba med pa'i skyes bu'i byed pa po can no //
translated: “Having another agent” means having an agent who is not related.

original: nye bar 'jal ba med par 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: nye bar 'jal ba med par 'chad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the absence of analogy is:

original: gal te rig byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: gal te rig byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
translated: “If the Vedas, etc.”

original: / don gyis go ba med par 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: / don gyis go ba med par 'chad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the absence of indirect understanding is:

original: gal te rig byed byed med par //
analyzed: gal te rig byed byed med par //
translated: “If the Vedas are without an agent, etc.”

original: zhes bya ba ste gzhal bya zhes bya ba ni tshad ma drug gis yongs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste gzhal bya zhes bya ba ni tshad ma drug gis yongs su bcad pa'o //
translated: “The object of knowledge” means that which is determined by the six means of valid knowledge.

original: de med na zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'o //
analyzed: de med na zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'o //
translated: “If it does not exist” means the agent.

original: cung zad ces bya ba ni gzhal bya'o //
analyzed: cung zad ces bya ba ni gzhal bya'o //
translated: “Anything” means the object of knowledge.

original: de yod na zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'o //
analyzed: de yod na zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'o //
translated: “If it exists” means the agent.

original: tshad ma sogs zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras chos la sogs pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: tshad ma sogs zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras chos la sogs pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The phrase “means of valid knowledge, etc.” includes such things as the object of knowledge.

original: dngos po med pas zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i tshad mas med do zhes bya ba de lta bu go ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pas zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i tshad mas med do zhes bya ba de lta bu go ste /
translated: “Because of the nonexistence of things” means that the nonexistence of things is established by the means of valid knowledge of nonexistence.

original: de'i yul ni dgag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yul ni dgag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the object of that means of valid knowledge is a negation.

original: yang na dngos po med par rang gi ngo bor de med do zhes bya ba de lta bur rtogs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽dngos med tshad mas gnod phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na dngos po med par rang gi ngo bor de med do zhes bya ba de lta bur rtogs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // dngos med tshad mas gnod phyir ro //
translated: Or else, it means that the nonexistence of things is understood as having the nature of nonexistence.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshad ma rnams kyis med pa ste ldog pa ni dngos po med pa'i tshad ma zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshad ma rnams kyis med pa ste ldog pa ni dngos po med pa'i tshad ma zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Because of the contradiction of the means of valid knowledge of nonexistence” means that the negation, i.e., the absence, is established by the means of valid knowledge. This is what is meant by the means of valid knowledge of nonexistence.

original: de na gnod pa'i phyir rig byed kyi byed pa po med do zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: de na gnod pa'i phyir rig byed kyi byed pa po med do zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that there is no person who is the creator of the Vedas.

original: 'di snyam du gal te rig byed skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du bsgrubs nas de las tshad ma nyid du bsgrub na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te rig byed skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du bsgrubs nas de las tshad ma nyid du bsgrub na /
translated: If you think that, having established that the Vedas are not created by a person, you will then establish that they are a valid cognition,

original: aa'i 'o na rig byed gzhan las tshad ma nyid du 'gyur te /🔽'di ltar 'di ji srid du skyes bus byas pa nyid du sgrub par mi byed pa de srid du reg byed tshad ma nyid du rtogs par mi 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa la /
analyzed: aa'i 'o na rig byed gzhan las tshad ma nyid du 'gyur te / 'di ltar 'di ji srid du skyes bus byas pa nyid du sgrub par mi byed pa de srid du reg byed tshad ma nyid du rtogs par mi 'gyur ro snyam du dogs pa la /
translated: then, in that case, the Vedas would be a valid cognition in regard to other things.🔽For, as long as you do not establish that the Vedas are created by a person, you will not understand that the Vedas are a valid cognition.

original: tshad ma min pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tshad ma min pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond to this qualm, he says, “They are not a valid cognition in regard to that. . . . ”

original: 'di ni 'di skad du ston te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di skad du ston te /
translated: This is what he is saying.

original: kho bo cag gis tshad ma nyid du ma grub pa la bsgrub pa'i ngo bos sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis tshad ma nyid du ma grub pa la bsgrub pa'i ngo bos sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: We do not establish that which is not established as a valid cognition by means of a proof statement.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What, then, do we do?

original: gzhan gyis tshad ma la yin par thal bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de zlog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis tshad ma la yin par thal bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de zlog par byed pa yin no //
translated: We refute the consequence that the Vedas are a valid cognition in regard to other things.

original: dmigs kyis bsal ba bkag pa @133b na spyir btang ba la mi gnod par rang nyid kyis grub par gnas so //
analyzed: dmigs kyis bsal ba bkag pa @133b na spyir btang ba la mi gnod par rang nyid kyis grub par gnas so //
translated: When the exception is refuted, the general statement remains established without being undermined.

original: gang las de grub par byed pa'i sgo nas shugs kyis gzhan las tshad mar thal bar 'gyur ba skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du bsgrub pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang las de grub par byed pa'i sgo nas shugs kyis gzhan las tshad mar thal bar 'gyur ba skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du bsgrub pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not that the Vedas are established as a means of valid knowledge in relation to something else by implication, through the means of establishing that.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: de ni skyes bus byas pa ldog pa tsam gyi mtshan nyid kyis dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni skyes bus byas pa ldog pa tsam gyi mtshan nyid kyis dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a thing that has the characteristic of merely the negation of being produced by a person.

original: gal te mi bsgrub pa na 'o na ci ltar rang nyid grub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mi bsgrub pa na 'o na ci ltar rang nyid grub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is not established, then how is it established by itself?

original: skyes bus ma byas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says “not produced by a person,” and so on.

original: 'on te gzhan gyi phyogs bsal na yang tshad mas rang gi phyogs ma bsgrubs pa ma yin nam gang gis rig byed smra bas don byas par 'gyur ba ji ltar de grub pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyi phyogs bsal na yang tshad mas rang gi phyogs ma bsgrubs pa ma yin nam gang gis rig byed smra bas don byas par 'gyur ba ji ltar de grub pa yin zhe na /
translated: But if the position of others is refuted, is not one’s own position also not established by a means of valid knowledge? How is it established that the proponent of the Vedas has a purpose?

original: gang dag dngos por gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang dag dngos por gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says “if they are things,” and so on.

original: gtso bo dang ni rdul phran bzhin //
analyzed: gtso bo dang ni rdul phran bzhin //
translated: Like the primal substance and the atom.

original: zhes bya ba 'di 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di 'chad pa ni /
translated: To explain this, he says:

original: gtso bo'i rgyu can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gtso bo'i rgyu can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The primal substance is the cause of the effect,🔽and the atom is the cause of the gross object.

original: gal te yang bye brag pas grangs can gyis nye bar bkod pa'i 'gro ba'i rgyu gtso bo yin pa'i sgrub par byed pa gsal ba de lta na yang gtan tshigs gzhan kho nas 'gro ba rdul phra rab kyis khyab pa bsgrub par bya dgos so //
analyzed: gal te yang bye brag pas grangs can gyis nye bar bkod pa'i 'gro ba'i rgyu gtso bo yin pa'i sgrub par byed pa gsal ba de lta na yang gtan tshigs gzhan kho nas 'gro ba rdul phra rab kyis khyab pa bsgrub par bya dgos so //
translated: Even though the Vaiśeṣika presents the primal substance as the cause of the effect, he must prove that the world is pervaded by the atom by means of another reason.

original: de bzhin du 'di la yan 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la yan 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: In the same way, it is said that this is the case here.🔽He says, “The position of entity is created by a person,”

original: dngos po'i phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po'i phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: dngos po'i phyogs ni skyes bus byas pa'o ;
analyzed: dngos po'i phyogs ni skyes bus byas pa'o ;
translated: The position of entity is created by a person.

original: / de bzlog pa ni dngos po med pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: / de bzlog pa ni dngos po med pa'i phyogs te /
translated: The opposite of that is the position of nonentity.

original: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dang ni gcig dgag pa ni gzhan bsgrub pa med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dang ni gcig dgag pa ni gzhan bsgrub pa med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the characteristic of mutually exclusive and contradictory things is that the negation of one is the non-occurrence of the other,

original: dngos po med pa rang nyid kyis sgrub po snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa rang nyid kyis sgrub po snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: nonentity is established by itself.

original: de bzhin du rig byed kyi sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' skyes pa dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dag bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du rig byed kyi sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' skyes pa dang 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dag bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Likewise, in order to prove that the beginning and end of the Vedas have the characteristics of production and destruction,

original: sangs rgyas pas sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa de bsal ba tsam gyis rig byed skyes bus ma byas pa nyid dang / mtha' gnyis kyis stong pa bsgrub pa na 'dod pa grub pa'i phyir rig byed smra bar bya ba rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pas sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa de bsal ba tsam gyis rig byed skyes bus ma byas pa nyid dang / mtha' gnyis kyis stong pa bsgrub pa na 'dod pa grub pa'i phyir rig byed smra bar bya ba rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: the Buddhist refutes the proof that the theist posits. Since the mere refutation of that establishes that the Vedas are not made by a person and are empty of the two extremes, the proponent of the Vedas has completed his task.

original: 'on te de'i sgrub byed bsams na yang rig byed kyi rtag pa nyid bsgrub pa'i ngo bo 'bad pa gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te de'i sgrub byed bsams na yang rig byed kyi rtag pa nyid bsgrub pa'i ngo bo 'bad pa gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: But if he thinks of a proof, then is not the nature of the proof of the permanence of the Vedas accomplished by another effort?

original: de'i phyir rig byed kyi rtag pa nyid mi sgrub na ji ltar rig byed smra ba'i don byas par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rig byed kyi rtag pa nyid mi sgrub na ji ltar rig byed smra ba'i don byas par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Therefore, if the permanence of the Vedas is not established, how could the purpose of the proponent of the Vedas be accomplished?

original: dngos po'i ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa @134a * //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa @134a * //
translated: With respect to the line, “The nature of things is not established by the Vedas,”

original: smos te / phyogs snga ma gnyis ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i mtha' sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: smos te / phyogs snga ma gnyis ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i mtha' sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: The two prior positions are established as the prior and later limits.

original: ci nas kyang phyogs snga ma gnyis sun phyung na rtag pa nyid rang nyid kyis grub par 'gyur ba de ston pa ni /
analyzed: ci nas kyang phyogs snga ma gnyis sun phyung na rtag pa nyid rang nyid kyis grub par 'gyur ba de ston pa ni /
translated: In order to refute the two prior positions, the establishment of permanence itself is shown:

original: rig byed kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rig byed kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The Vedas are eternal because they are not composed,🔽because they are not remembered as composed,🔽and because if they were composed, they would be remembered.

original: rtag pa ni sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' gnyis dang phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: rtag pa ni sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' gnyis dang phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Permanence is the characteristic of mutually exclusive and exhaustive contraries.

original: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dag ni gcig dgag pa gzhan yod pa med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bshad zin to /
analyzed: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dag ni gcig dgag pa gzhan yod pa med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bshad zin to /
translated: And it has been explained that mutually exclusive and exhaustive contraries are such that the negation of one is the affirmation of the other.

original: gal te de med pa rtag pa yin pa de lta na 'o na rtag pa nyid dngos po'i chos su mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de med pa rtag pa yin pa de lta na 'o na rtag pa nyid dngos po'i chos su mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that nonexistence is permanent, then permanence would not be a quality of things.

original: gang phyir rig byed dang por ni //
analyzed: gang phyir rig byed dang por ni //
translated: Because the Vedas are not composed at the beginning,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: and because they are not remembered as composed,🔽and because if they were composed, they would be remembered.

original: 'dis ni chos 'di'i dngos po'i chos rig byed kyi bdag nyid du gtogs pa nyid yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni chos 'di'i dngos po'i chos rig byed kyi bdag nyid du gtogs pa nyid yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: This shows that this dharma belongs to the nature of the perceptible.🔽Thus, since it is an entity, it is established as impermanent.

original: de ltar na dngos por gyur ba'i phyir 'o na mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur ro zhes gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs dogs par byed pa ni /🔽de 'dod shes bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽shes bya ba ni tshad mas shes par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar na dngos por gyur ba'i phyir 'o na mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur ro zhes gzhan gyi tshig gi go skabs dogs par byed pa ni / de 'dod shes bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / shes bya ba ni tshad mas shes par bya ba ste /
translated: To anticipate the opponent’s statement, he says, “If you accept that . . .”

original: bsgrub par bya ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “ Object of knowledge” means that which is to be known by valid knowledge.🔽It means that which is to be established.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni ma byas pa dang mi 'jig pa gnyis so ;
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni ma byas pa dang mi 'jig pa gnyis so ;
translated: “ Those” refers to the two, non-produced and non-destroyed.

original: / rang gi ngo bo'i sgrub par byed pa ni rang gi bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: / rang gi ngo bo'i sgrub par byed pa ni rang gi bsgrub pa ste /
translated: “ The proof of its own nature” is the proof of itself.

original: dngos po med pa yang dngos po nyid du 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang dngos po nyid du 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not contradictory for a non-entity to be an entity.

original: ma byas pa dang mi 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid yin na yang rtag pa ni dngos po med pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma byas pa dang mi 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid yin na yang rtag pa ni dngos po med pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not thought that although it has the characteristics of non-produced and non-destroyed, permanence is not a non-entity.

original: de ltar re zhig tshad ma rnam pa lnga log pas rig byed kyi byed pa po med par grub pas gang zhig log pa nyid kyi rgyu nyes pa dang ldan pa dang bral zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig tshad ma rnam pa lnga log pas rig byed kyi byed pa po med par grub pas gang zhig log pa nyid kyi rgyu nyes pa dang ldan pa dang bral zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa ma yin la /
translated: Thus, since the five kinds of valid cognition are refuted, the existence of the agent of the Vedas is established. Therefore, this reason, “because of the absence of the cause of the cessation of the Vedas,” is not unestablished.

original: 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it contradictory,

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists in the similar class.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa'i phyir ma nges pa yang ma yin pas rig byed tshad ma nyid du grub pa yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa'i phyir ma nges pa yang ma yin pas rig byed tshad ma nyid du grub pa yin no //
translated: Nor is it inconclusive, because it does not exist in the dissimilar class. Therefore, the Vedas are established as valid cognition.

original: da ni gzhan gyi rig byed tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa gnyis rgyas par sun 'byin pa rtsom mo //
analyzed: da ni gzhan gyi rig byed tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa gnyis rgyas par sun 'byin pa rtsom mo //
translated: Now, the two proofs that the Vedas are not valid cognition are refuted in detail.

original: de la sgrub par byed pa gnyis ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la sgrub par byed pa gnyis ni 'di yin te /
translated: The two proofs are as follows:

original: gang dbang po'i yul can dang bsal ma thag tu @134b byung ba de ni mi rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dbang po'i yul can dang bsal ma thag tu @134b byung ba de ni mi rtag pa yin te /
translated: Whatever is the object of a sense faculty and arises immediately after the cessation of its cause is impermanent,

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: like a pot, for example.

original: sgra yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dag go //
analyzed: sgra yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dag go //
translated: These are natural syllogisms.

original: spyir sgra mi rtag pa nyid du grub pa na shugs kyis rig byed kyang mi rtag pa nyid du grub pas lam po che'i skyes bu'i tshig bzhin du log pa nyid du grub par 'gyur ro zhes pha rol sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa yin no
analyzed: spyir sgra mi rtag pa nyid du grub pa na shugs kyis rig byed kyang mi rtag pa nyid du grub pas lam po che'i skyes bu'i tshig bzhin du log pa nyid du grub par 'gyur ro zhes pha rol sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa yin no
translated: When sound in general is established as impermanent, by implication, the Vedas are also established as impermanent. Therefore, like the words of a person on the street, they are established as false. This is the intention of the opponent, the Buddhist.

original: // 'dir sgra la sogs pa'i tshad ma dam bca' ba la gnod pa rgyas par ston pa yin te /
analyzed: // 'dir sgra la sogs pa'i tshad ma dam bca' ba la gnod pa rgyas par ston pa yin te /
translated: Here, the extensive refutation of the thesis of sound and so on as valid is presented.

original: de la re zhig sgra'i tshad mas gnod pa ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig sgra'i tshad mas gnod pa ni /
translated: In that regard, first, the refutation by the valid knowledge of sound is as follows.

original: gang zhig rig byed ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang zhig rig byed ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “That which is called the Vedas . . .”

original: rig byed las byung ba ni rig byed can te /
analyzed: rig byed las byung ba ni rig byed can te /
translated: That which arises from the Vedas is Vedic.

original: me'i sbyin sreg las mtho ris su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: me'i sbyin sreg las mtho ris su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is like, “Through the fire sacrifice, one will go to the higher realms.”

original: de'i stobs kyis phyogs zlog par byed de /
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis phyogs zlog par byed de /
translated: By the power of that, the opponent’s position is refuted.

original: de gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is refuted.

original: ji skad du 'di'i skul bar byed pa yin nam ma yin zhes the tshom gyi shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: ji skad du 'di'i skul bar byed pa yin nam ma yin zhes the tshom gyi shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not that it generates a doubting cognition, wondering whether or not this is an instigator.

original: 'di ni log pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyin ci log kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni log pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyin ci log kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it a misconception, thinking that this is false.

original: dus gzhan dang skyes bu gzhan dang yul gzhan dang gnas skabs gzhan la yang gnod pa med pa'i shes par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: dus gzhan dang skyes bu gzhan dang yul gzhan dang gnas skabs gzhan la yang gnod pa med pa'i shes par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: It is a cognition that is not undermined in other times, by other persons, in other places, or in other circumstances.

original: gang yang shes pa gzhan phyin ci log tu mthong nas 'dir yang phyin ci log tu byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa las byung ba'i shes pa skyes pa de yang mngon sum 'dis gnod pa na 'gegs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang shes pa gzhan phyin ci log tu mthong nas 'dir yang phyin ci log tu byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa las byung ba'i shes pa skyes pa de yang mngon sum 'dis gnod pa na 'gegs pa yin no //
translated: And when a cognition that arises from inference, which sees another cognition as mistaken, is generated here, it is also undermined by this direct perception.

original: 'on te stobs mtshungs pa dag ji ltar gcig gis cig shos la gnod pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te stobs mtshungs pa dag ji ltar gcig gis cig shos la gnod pa yin /
translated: But if they are equal in strength, how can one undermine the other?

original: ci ste stobs mtshungs kyang gnod na /🔽'o na rjes su dpag pas cig shos la ;
analyzed: ci ste stobs mtshungs kyang gnod na / 'o na rjes su dpag pas cig shos la ;
translated: But if, even though they are equal in strength, they undermine each other,

original: ci'i phyir mi gnod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi gnod ce na /
translated: then why doesn’t inference undermine the other?

original: rig byed can de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
analyzed: rig byed can de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
translated: He says, “The Mīmāṃsaka . . .” and so on.

original: 'o na ji ltar rjes su dpag pa la des gnod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rjes su dpag pa la des gnod ce na /
translated: Well then, how does inference contradict it?

original: gang phyir bstan bcos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang phyir bstan bcos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “Because it is contradicted by inference, etc.”

original: ji skad du rig byed kyi tshig la ni mngon sum gyi shes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ji skad du rig byed kyi tshig la ni mngon sum gyi shes pa yin gyi /
translated: As it is said, “The words of the Vedas are the knowledge of perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum dang 'gal bas tshad mar mi 'gyur zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum dang 'gal bas tshad mar mi 'gyur zhes zer ro //
translated: Inference is not a valid means of knowledge because it contradicts perception.”

original: gang gis de mngon sum dang mtshungs pa nyid yin pa ji ltar rjes su dpag pa las lung stobs dang ldan pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis de mngon sum dang mtshungs pa nyid yin pa ji ltar rjes su dpag pa las lung stobs dang ldan pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that inference is similar to perception? How is it that scripture is stronger than inference?

original: lung ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lung ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “Scripture is stronger than inference, etc.”

original: tshad ma yin pa la zhes bya ba ni zor yang ba la @135a * //
analyzed: tshad ma yin pa la zhes bya ba ni zor yang ba la @135a * //
translated: “It is a valid means of knowledge” means that it is a valid means of knowledge in comparison to what is slower.

original: ltos te yul gyi bdun pa yin no //
analyzed: ltos te yul gyi bdun pa yin no //
translated: It is the seventh object.

original: rjes su dpag pa de lta min //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa de lta min //
translated: Inference is not like that.

original: zhes bya ba de ni dpe la ltos pa'i phyir dang / nyes pa yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ni dpe la ltos pa'i phyir dang / nyes pa yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: That is because it depends on an example and because it has faults.

original: nyes pa mngon sum dang mtshungs pa'i rig byed las byung ba'i shes pas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes pa mngon sum dang mtshungs pa'i rig byed las byung ba'i shes pas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The knowledge that arises from the Vedas is contradicted by the faults that are similar to perception.

original: 'on te gnyi ga la grub pa gang yin pa de kho na sun 'byin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te gnyi ga la grub pa gang yin pa de kho na sun 'byin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Or, is it not the case that only that which is established for both is a refutation?

original: sangs rgyas pa la ni lung tshad ma yang ma yin te /🔽tshad ma ni gnyis kho na'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa la ni lung tshad ma yang ma yin te / tshad ma ni gnyis kho na'o //
translated: For the Buddhist, scripture is not a valid means of knowledge,

original: zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is ascertained that there are only two valid means of knowledge.

original: de ji ltar tshad ma nyid du ma grub pa'i lung gis sangs rgyas pa la gnod pa byed ces dogs pa la /
analyzed: de ji ltar tshad ma nyid du ma grub pa'i lung gis sangs rgyas pa la gnod pa byed ces dogs pa la /
translated: How can a scripture that is not established as a valid means of knowledge refute the Buddhist?

original: rig byed don rtogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rig byed don rtogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In response to this doubt, he says, “The Vedas are understood to have meaning, etc.”

original: 'di snyam du sems te gang gis kha blangs pa tsam gyis ma grub pa'i lung tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ba 'dod pa tsam gyis dngos po grub pa dang ma grub par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems te gang gis kha blangs pa tsam gyis ma grub pa'i lung tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ba 'dod pa tsam gyis dngos po grub pa dang ma grub par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The idea is this: One should not think that a scripture that is not established becomes a valid means of knowledge merely by being accepted, and that things become established or not established by mere assertion.

original: 'o na ci zhe na tshad ma'i stobs kyis te gang grub pa de ni gnyi ga la yang grub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na tshad ma'i stobs kyis te gang grub pa de ni gnyi ga la yang grub pa yin te /
translated: Rather, it is by the power of valid means of knowledge. That which is established is established for both.

original: me la sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i ngag las byung ba'i shes pa 'di ni ches bstan pa yin no zhes bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: me la sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i ngag las byung ba'i shes pa 'di ni ches bstan pa yin no zhes bsgrubs zin to //
translated: This knowledge derived from speech, such as the fire sacrifice, etc., is very much taught.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar tshad ma ma yin no zhes brjod par nus te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar tshad ma ma yin no zhes brjod par nus te /
translated: Therefore, how can it be said that it is not a means of valid knowledge?

original: khyed kyi 'di ni tshig tsam rig pa dang bral ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: khyed kyi 'di ni tshig tsam rig pa dang bral ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: This is mere words, devoid of knowledge, is the condensed meaning.

original: mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: Not accepted means worldly.

original: 'dod pa zhes ba ba ni 'jig rten pa 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes ba ba ni 'jig rten pa 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: Accepted means accepted by the world.

original: ring na gnas pa zhes bya ba ni sh'akya thub pa la sogs pa'i rig byed la ste /
analyzed: ring na gnas pa zhes bya ba ni sh'akya thub pa la sogs pa'i rig byed la ste /
translated: Far removed means the Vedas of Sakyamuni, etc.

original: de 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i las phyi rol du gyur pa'i phyir ro ;🔽/ mngon sbyor de 'brel dgos pa can //
analyzed: de 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i las phyi rol du gyur pa'i phyir ro ; / mngon sbyor de 'brel dgos pa can //
translated: Because the actions of upholding them, etc., are external.🔽That application is related and necessary.

original: zhes bya ba ni rig byed de la mngon par sbyor ba se /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rig byed de la mngon par sbyor ba se /
translated: That application is to that Veda.

original: brjod pa dgos pa skyes bu'i don mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: brjod pa dgos pa skyes bu'i don mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those which have the character of the purpose of a person, such as sacrifice, are so called.

original: tshangs lha sdang ba zhes bya ba ni rig byed las dpa'o //
analyzed: tshangs lha sdang ba zhes bya ba ni rig byed las dpa'o //
translated: The Brahmanical gods are the gods of the Vedas.

original: yang na de las byung ba'i shes pa ni tshangs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na de las byung ba'i shes pa ni tshangs pa'o //
translated: Or, the consciousness that arises from them is Brahman.

original: rnam gcig tu na lung gis gnod par ma gyur mod /
analyzed: rnam gcig tu na lung gis gnod par ma gyur mod /
translated: In one way, it is not contradicted by scripture.

original: de lta na yang dam bca' ba'i don mngon sum la sogs pa sun phyung ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang dam bca' ba'i don mngon sum la sogs pa sun phyung ba nyid yin te /
translated: Even so, the meaning of the thesis is refuted by perception and so on.

original: tshad mas gnod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshad mas gnod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that it is contradicted by valid cognition, he says

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Moreover, etc.

original: @135b 'dis ni mngon sum gyis gnod pa bshad do /
analyzed: @135b 'dis ni mngon sum gyis gnod pa bshad do /
translated: This explains the contradiction with perception.

original: 'dis ltar dus thams cad du de nyid 'di yin no snyam pa'i ngo shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis ltar dus thams cad du de nyid 'di yin no snyam pa'i ngo shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is recognized as that very thing at all times.

original: ngo shes pa zhes bya ba'i mngon sum las mi rtag pa nyid du grub po //
analyzed: ngo shes pa zhes bya ba'i mngon sum las mi rtag pa nyid du grub po //
translated: By the perception called recognition, impermanence is established.

original: yul thams cad du ngo shes pa'i phyir khyab pa nyid kyang grub pas su zhig gis rtag pa dang khyab pa dag gi bzlog pa nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul thams cad du ngo shes pa'i phyir khyab pa nyid kyang grub pas su zhig gis rtag pa dang khyab pa dag gi bzlog pa nges par 'gyur te /
translated: Since it is established that it is all-pervading because it is recognized in all places, who would ascertain the negation of permanence and all-pervasiveness?

original: 'ga' zhig gis kyang ma yin no khyab bdag nyid ni khyab pa dang bdag nyid do //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis kyang ma yin no khyab bdag nyid ni khyab pa dang bdag nyid do //
translated: No one at all. The master is the all-pervading one.

original: phyin ci log dag ni mi rtag pa nyid dang khyab byed ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: phyin ci log dag ni mi rtag pa nyid dang khyab byed ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: The errors are impermanence and non-pervasiveness.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud par byed do //
translated: Therefore is the conclusion.

original: dus kun zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: dus kun zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams la'o //
translated: At all times means in the past, present, and future.

original: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log gi'o //
analyzed: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log gi'o //
translated: Of this means of the errors.

original: me lce la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ngo shes pa 'khrul pa can nyid du dogs par byed do //
analyzed: me lce la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ngo shes pa 'khrul pa can nyid du dogs par byed do //
translated: The doubt is that the recognition of the flame, etc. is erroneous.

original: sogs pa'i sgras yang 'byung ba'i skra dang / sen mo dang rtsva dang / chu bo'i rgyun la sogs pa bzung ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras yang 'byung ba'i skra dang / sen mo dang rtsva dang / chu bo'i rgyun la sogs pa bzung ste /
translated: The word etc. includes the hair of a tortoise, fingernails, grass, a stream, etc.

original: gang gi phyir de la yang sgra 'di dag ni de nyid yin no //🔽rtsva 'di dag ni de dag nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de la yang sgra 'di dag ni de nyid yin no // rtsva 'di dag ni de dag nyid yin no //
translated: Because in that case, there is recognition of the fire, etc.,🔽as being just that, and of the grass, etc., as being just that,

original: chu bo'i rgyun de nyid chu yin rgyud 'di nyid yin no zhes ngo shes pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: chu bo'i rgyun de nyid chu yin rgyud 'di nyid yin no zhes ngo shes pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: and of the stream of water as being just that water and just that stream.

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: 'di ltar de la me nyid la sogs pa'i spyi ngo shes par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar de la me nyid la sogs pa'i spyi ngo shes par byed de /
translated: For in that case, there is recognition of the universals of fire, etc.,

original: de yang rtag par 'dod pa nyid phyir /
analyzed: de yang rtag par 'dod pa nyid phyir /
translated: and those are held to be permanent.

original: ga las 'khrul pa yin /
analyzed: ga las 'khrul pa yin /
translated: So how can there be error?

original: gang yang gsal ba'i ngo bo mi rtag pa de ni ngo shes pa nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang yang gsal ba'i ngo bo mi rtag pa de ni ngo shes pa nyid med pa'i phyir /
translated: And if the impermanent nature of the manifestation is not recognized,

original: de lta na'ang ga las 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na'ang ga las 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: then how can there be error?

original: cha 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba ni dman pa dang ches dang / ches cher dman pa la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: cha 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba ni dman pa dang ches dang / ches cher dman pa la sogs pa la'o //
translated: In some part means in the inferior, the superior, the very inferior, etc.

original: khyad par 'ga' zhig gis zhes bya ba ni dman pa nyid dang steng du 'gro ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: khyad par 'ga' zhig gis zhes bya ba ni dman pa nyid dang steng du 'gro ba la sogs pas so //
translated: By some distinction means by inferiority, superiority, etc.

original: ji ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar rtogs she na /
translated: How is that understood?

original: tha dad blos nges pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tha dad blos nges pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The response to that is: “because of the ascertainment by different cognitions.”

original: tho tha dad pas 'dir rtogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tho tha dad pas 'dir rtogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because of the difference, it is realized here.

original: kha cig tu gsal bas zhes 'don pa der ni don 'di yin te /
analyzed: kha cig tu gsal bas zhes 'don pa der ni don 'di yin te /
translated: In some texts, the reading is “because of the manifestation.” The meaning there is this:

original: blo tha dad pa 'di spangs pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: blo tha dad pa 'di spangs pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: “the abandonment of this different cognition.”

original: rjes su dpag pas gnod pa bshad pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas gnod pa bshad pa ni /
translated: The refutation by way of inference is explained:

original: yul dang dus zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yul dang dus zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “The difference in object and time, etc.”

original: ba lang gi sgra'i gsal ba dag la blo rnams yul dang dus myur ba dang / dal ba dang / bar ma la sogs par @136a * //🔽snang ba'i khyad par tha dad pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni don gcig gi yul can yin pa'am /
analyzed: ba lang gi sgra'i gsal ba dag la blo rnams yul dang dus myur ba dang / dal ba dang / bar ma la sogs par @136a * // snang ba'i khyad par tha dad pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni don gcig gi yul can yin pa'am /
translated: The difference in the appearance of the cognitions of the manifestations of the word “cow” in terms of object, time, fast, slow, medium, etc.,🔽is not the object of a cognition of a single meaning,

original: sna tshogs pa'i don gyi yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i don gyi yul can ma yin te /
translated: or the object of a cognition of a variety of meanings,

original: ba lang ngo snyam pa'i rnam pa 'dzin par skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ba lang ngo snyam pa'i rnam pa 'dzin par skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: because it arises in the aspect of apprehending “cow,”

original: da ltar skyes pa'i ba lang gi blo bzhin no //
analyzed: da ltar skyes pa'i ba lang gi blo bzhin no //
translated: like the cognition of a cow arisen in the present.

original: yang na gang dang gang ba lang gi sgra'i yul can gyi blo yin pa de ni da ltar gyi ba lang gi sgra'i yul can yin te /🔽der skyes pa'i ba lang gi sgra'i yul can bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na gang dang gang ba lang gi sgra'i yul can gyi blo yin pa de ni da ltar gyi ba lang gi sgra'i yul can yin te / der skyes pa'i ba lang gi sgra'i yul can bzhin no //
translated: Or, whatever is the cognition having the sound of cow as its object is the cognition having the sound of cow as its object in the present.🔽For example, the cognition having the sound of cow as its object in the present is the cognition having the sound of cow as its object in the present.

original: khar rtsang gi ba lang gi sgra'i blo yang ba lang gi sgra'i yul can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: khar rtsang gi ba lang gi sgra'i blo yang ba lang gi sgra'i yul can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The cognition of the sound of cow yesterday is also the cognition having the sound of cow as its object. This is a natural inference.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na da lta'i ba lang gi sgra'i blo ni chos can no //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na da lta'i ba lang gi sgra'i blo ni chos can no //
translated: In one way, the cognition of the sound of cow in the present is the subject.

original: khar rtsang gi ba lang gi sgra'i yul can nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos so //
