analyzed: khar rtsang gi ba lang gi sgra'i yul can nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos so //
translated: The cognition having the sound of cow as its object yesterday is the property to be established.

original: ba lang gi sgra'i yul can yin zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: ba lang gi sgra'i yul can yin zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: The cognition having the sound of cow as its object is the reason.

original: khar rtsang gi ba lang gi sgra'i blo ni dpe'o //
analyzed: khar rtsang gi ba lang gi sgra'i blo ni dpe'o //
translated: The cognition of the sound of cow yesterday is the example.

original: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: yang na 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang na 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Or, this is the cognition of the sound of cow yesterday.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi blo'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi blo'o //
translated: This is the cognition of the sound of cow in the present.

original: de zhes bya ba ni khar rtsang gi ba lang gi sgra yis shes pas dmigs pa'i ba lang gi sgra'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni khar rtsang gi ba lang gi sgra yis shes pas dmigs pa'i ba lang gi sgra'o //
translated: “That” refers to the sound of cow that was heard yesterday, which is the object of the perception.

original: gtan tshigs de phyir zhes bya ba ni ba lang gi sgra'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de phyir zhes bya ba ni ba lang gi sgra'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “For that reason” means because it is the object of the sound of cow.

original: yang na khar rtsang dang de ring gi blo gnyi ga yul gcig pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na khar rtsang dang de ring gi blo gnyi ga yul gcig pa yin te /
translated: Or, the cognition of yesterday and the cognition of today are both the same in having the same object,

original: ba lang gi sgra'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ba lang gi sgra gcig gi blo de bzhin no //
analyzed: ba lang gi sgra'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ba lang gi sgra gcig gi blo de bzhin no //
translated: because they are the object of the sound of cow, just like the cognition of the one sound of cow.

original: de nyid na yang gnyi ga zhes bya bas ston te /
analyzed: de nyid na yang gnyi ga zhes bya bas ston te /
translated: “In that case” indicates that the two are the same.

original: gtan tshigs skabs yin pa'i phyir shes par sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs skabs yin pa'i phyir shes par sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: Since this is the section on reasoning, it is easy to understand, so I will not explain it.

original: de yang na yul la sogs pa'i khyad par tha dad pa'i ba lang nyid kyi blo mtha' dag ni ba lang gi blo gcig gis bskyed par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang na yul la sogs pa'i khyad par tha dad pa'i ba lang nyid kyi blo mtha' dag ni ba lang gi blo gcig gis bskyed par bya ba yin te /
translated: Or, the entire cognition of cow, which has different objects, etc., is to be generated by the one cognition of cow,

original: ba lang gi blo yin pa'i phyir ba lang gcig gi blo bzhin no //
analyzed: ba lang gi blo yin pa'i phyir ba lang gcig gi blo bzhin no //
translated: because it is the cognition of cow, just like the cognition of the one cow.

original: sngar ni ba lang gi sgra'i yul can gyi blo ni chos can la yul gcig pa yang bsgrub bya yin la /
analyzed: sngar ni ba lang gi sgra'i yul can gyi blo ni chos can la yul gcig pa yang bsgrub bya yin la /
translated: Previously, the cognition that has the sound of cow as its object is the subject, and having the same object is the probandum.

original: da ltar gyi ba lang nyid kyi rigs kyi yul can gyi blo chos can yin zhing /
analyzed: da ltar gyi ba lang nyid kyi rigs kyi yul can gyi blo chos can yin zhing /
translated: Now, the cognition that has the universal of cow as its object is the subject,

original: ba lang gi sgra gcig gis bskyed par bya ba nyid ni bsgrub bya yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: ba lang gi sgra gcig gis bskyed par bya ba nyid ni bsgrub bya yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: and being produced by the single sound cow is the probandum. This is the difference.

original: 'di la khar rtsang brjod pa yod pas khar rtsang brjod pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la khar rtsang brjod pa yod pas khar rtsang brjod pa ste /
translated: Here, since there was a statement yesterday, it is a statement from yesterday.

original: 'di yang chos can ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang chos can ston pa'o //
translated: This also teaches the subject.

original: de yang @136b 'jug pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos so //
analyzed: de yang @136b 'jug pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos so //
translated: Moreover, the engagement is the property to be proven.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: ba lang zhes bya ba dang thos sgra zhes bya ba ni chos can ston pa'o //
analyzed: ba lang zhes bya ba dang thos sgra zhes bya ba ni chos can ston pa'o //
translated: The words cow and sound heard teach the subject.

original: de ni khar rtsang yang thos pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos so //
analyzed: de ni khar rtsang yang thos pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos so //
translated: That it was heard yesterday is the property to be proven.

original: sngar bstan nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni ba lang gi sgra'i shes pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar bstan nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni ba lang gi sgra'i shes pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it was previously taught, it is for the sake of understanding the cognition of the sound of cow.

original: yang na rjod par byed pa'i sgra ji snyed pa zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can ston pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rjod par byed pa'i sgra ji snyed pa zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can ston pa'o //
translated: Or else, “as many as the words that express it” is the subject.

original: de ni dus ring brten na bsgrub bya'i chos so //🔽'brel pa nyams myong la ltos pa'i //🔽shes bya shes pa 'jug phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dus ring brten na bsgrub bya'i chos so // 'brel pa nyams myong la ltos pa'i // shes bya shes pa 'jug phyir ro //
translated: “It endures for a long time” is the probandum.

original: zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: “Because the cognition of the object occurs in dependence on the experience of the connection” is the reason.

original: 'brel pa nyams myong la ltos pa zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa nyams su myong ba la ltos pa yang yod la /🔽shes bya ba la shes pa 'jug pa'ang yin pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa nyams myong la ltos pa zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa nyams su myong ba la ltos pa yang yod la / shes bya ba la shes pa 'jug pa'ang yin pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
translated: “In dependence on the experience of the connection” means that the cognition of the object occurs in dependence on the experience of the connection.

original: de lta bas na brtan par shes par bya la /🔽brten pa nyid kyi khyad par dus ring brten //
analyzed: de lta bas na brtan par shes par bya la / brten pa nyid kyi khyad par dus ring brten //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the word “endures” is used in the sense of “it endures for a long time.”

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: “It endures for a long time” is the distinction.

original: 'dir dus brten pas brten pa nyid du 'dod kyi ri la sogs pa bzhin du yul brten pas ni ma yin no zhes khyad par gyis bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir dus brten pas brten pa nyid du 'dod kyi ri la sogs pa bzhin du yul brten pas ni ma yin no zhes khyad par gyis bstan to //
translated: Here, “endures” is asserted in the sense of “it endures for a long time,” not in the sense of “it endures in a place,” like a mountain, etc. This is the distinction that is taught.

original: du ba spyi'i cha bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe ste rang gi mtshan nyid rjes su mi 'gro ba'i phyir rtags ma yin pas spyi'i cha kho na dpe yin no //
analyzed: du ba spyi'i cha bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe ste rang gi mtshan nyid rjes su mi 'gro ba'i phyir rtags ma yin pas spyi'i cha kho na dpe yin no //
translated: The example is “like the general aspect of smoke.” Since it is not a reason because it does not follow its own nature, it is only a general aspect that is the example.

original: mi brtan pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ldog pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: mi brtan pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ldog pa ston pa'o //
translated: “Unstable” and so on teaches the contrapositive.

original: de tshe rgyu mtshan can nyid phyir zhes bya ba la de tshe ni dus de tsam mo //
analyzed: de tshe rgyu mtshan can nyid phyir zhes bya ba la de tshe ni dus de tsam mo //
translated: “At that time, because of the reason” means at that time, at that moment.

original: tha snyad kyi dus su rjes su mi 'gro ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid 'brel pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi dus su rjes su mi 'gro ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid 'brel pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That which has the characteristic of not following at the time of convention is called “the reason that has a connection.”

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: Its nature is that itself.

original: 'on te tshul 'dis bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyang gcig nyid du rjod par nus pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te tshul 'dis bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyang gcig nyid du rjod par nus pa ma yin nam /
translated: But by this method, can a pot and so on also be said to be one?

original: yul dang dus la sogs pa tha dad pa'i bum pa la sogs pa gsal ba'i blo thams cad mtshungs pa'i yul can yin pa'am /
analyzed: yul dang dus la sogs pa tha dad pa'i bum pa la sogs pa gsal ba'i blo thams cad mtshungs pa'i yul can yin pa'am /
translated: All the cognitions of pots and so on that are different in terms of place, time, and so on have the same object.

original: sna tshogs pa'i don gyi yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i don gyi yul can ma yin te /
translated: They are not subjects that have a variety of objects.

original: bum pa'o snyam du blo skye ba'i phyir da ltar skyes pa'i bum pa'i blo bzhin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa'o snyam du blo skye ba'i phyir da ltar skyes pa'i bum pa'i blo bzhin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: because the thought “vase” arises, like the thought of a vase that has arisen in the present.

original: bum pa la sogs pa gcig nyid du 'dod pa'am mthong ba'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa gcig nyid du 'dod pa'am mthong ba'ang ma yin te /
translated: But a vase, etc. is not accepted or seen as a single entity.

original: de lta bas na gtan tshigs de thams cad 'khrul pa yin no snyam du dogs pa la rigs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽gal te rigs @137a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na gtan tshigs de thams cad 'khrul pa yin no snyam du dogs pa la rigs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gal te rigs @137a * //
translated: Therefore, all of these reasons are mistaken.

original: las te rigs kyi ngo bos bum pa la sogs pa gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas bsgrub par bya ba yin na de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: las te rigs kyi ngo bos bum pa la sogs pa gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas bsgrub par bya ba yin na de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: If the vase, etc. were established as a single entity by the nature of the class, then the probandum would be established.🔽For it is said:

original: de ni 'di rigs zhes bya'i cha //🔽rtag cing cig shos 'jig par 'dod //
analyzed: de ni 'di rigs zhes bya'i cha // rtag cing cig shos 'jig par 'dod //
translated: That is called the class.

original: ces smras pa yin no //
analyzed: ces smras pa yin no //
translated: It is permanent, and the other is asserted to be destroyed.

original: ci ste gsal ba'i ngo bo rnams gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas bsgrub na de'i tshe yang 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: ci ste gsal ba'i ngo bo rnams gcig nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas bsgrub na de'i tshe yang 'khrul pa med do //
translated: But if the entities of manifestation were established as a single entity, then there would be no error.

original: dam bca' ba ni mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam bca' ba ni mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The thesis is contradicted by perception and so on.

original: gang gi phyir gnod pa med pa'i yul can yin na zhes 'di la gtan tshigs thams cad khyad par dang bcas par mngon par 'dod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnod pa med pa'i yul can yin na zhes 'di la gtan tshigs thams cad khyad par dang bcas par mngon par 'dod do //
translated: Since it is the object of a nonerroneous cognition, all reasons are accepted as having the property of the subject.

original: de'i phyir ga las 'khrul pa yin snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ga las 'khrul pa yin snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, how could it be erroneous?

original: mthong ba dang 'gal zhes bya ba la dam bca' ba zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: mthong ba dang 'gal zhes bya ba la dam bca' ba zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: It is contradicted by perception, the thesis is understood.

original: ltag ma ni go bar zad do //
analyzed: ltag ma ni go bar zad do //
translated: The rest is easily understood.

original: gzhan yang sgra mi rtag pa nyid du dam bca' ba rjes /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgra mi rtag pa nyid du dam bca' ba rjes /
translated: Moreover, after the thesis that sound is impermanent,

original: su dpag pa dang don gyis go bdag gis gnod par ston to //
analyzed: su dpag pa dang don gyis go bdag gis gnod par ston to //
translated: it is shown that it is contradicted by inference and by the meaning.

original: de la 'di ni rjes su dpag pa yin te /
analyzed: de la 'di ni rjes su dpag pa yin te /
translated: Regarding that, this is the inference:

original: gang dag gi 'brel pa bcos ma ma yin pa de dag ni bcos ma ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gang dag gi 'brel pa bcos ma ma yin pa de dag ni bcos ma ma yin pa ste /
translated: Those whose relation is not fabricated are not fabricated,

original: dper na nam mkha' dang rdul phra rab bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' dang rdul phra rab bzhin no //
translated: like space and a subtle particle.

original: sgra'i rigs kyi ming can gyi don gyi brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed kyi dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yang ma bcos pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //🔽ma grub pa spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sgra'i rigs kyi ming can gyi don gyi brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed kyi dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yang ma bcos pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so // ma grub pa spang ba'i phyir /
translated: The relation of the denotative to the denoted, which is the characteristic of the entity, is also unfabricated. This is a natural inference.

original: bcos ma nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bcos ma nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to avoid the charge of nonestablishment, he says:🔽The very fabrication of a relation.

original: bcos ma nyid ni 'brel pa zhes bya ba la ltos par bya'o //
analyzed: bcos ma nyid ni 'brel pa zhes bya ba la ltos par bya'o //
translated: The very fabrication of a relation should be understood as dependent.

original: gal te 'brel pa bcos mar gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'brel pa bcos mar gyur na /
translated: If the relation were fabricated,

original: de'i tshe sbyor ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i tshe sbyor ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: then, because of the absence of application,

original: sgra'i sbyor ba zhig pa'i phyir sgra yang 'jig pas thams cad du rjes su 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra'i sbyor ba zhig pa'i phyir sgra yang 'jig pas thams cad du rjes su 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because the application of the word would cease, the word would also cease, and so it would not be universal.

original: gang las she na /🔽de ni gsal ba gcig gi mthar thug pa'i phyir te ;
analyzed: gang las she na / de ni gsal ba gcig gi mthar thug pa'i phyir te ;
translated: From what?🔽Because it would terminate in a single manifestation.

original: ba lang gi gsal ba gcig ni mthar thug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba lang gi gsal ba gcig ni mthar thug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a single manifestation of a cow would terminate.

original: de la don gyis go ba ni gang dag pa lang gi gsal ba gcig la mngon sum du phyogs pa'i spyi'i du ma gnas pa na pa lang gi sgra las nges par gzung ba'i ba lang nyid rtogs pa de ni sgra rtag pa nyid med par @137b 'thad
analyzed: de la don gyis go ba ni gang dag pa lang gi gsal ba gcig la mngon sum du phyogs pa'i spyi'i du ma gnas pa na pa lang gi sgra las nges par gzung ba'i ba lang nyid rtogs pa de ni sgra rtag pa nyid med par @137b 'thad
translated: The meaning of the statement “The meaning of the word ‘cow’ is understood through the exclusion of the non-cow” is as follows: When the many instances of the universal cow are present in a single instance of the individual cow, the cow-ness that is ascertained from the word ‘cow’ is understood.

original: pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not tenable without the permanence of the word.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this so?

original: sa byung zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sa byung zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “The word ‘cow’ is not the cause of the understanding of cow-ness,” and so on.

original: don gyis go ba 'di ni sgra las byung ba'i tshad ma sngon du 'gro ba can yin no //
analyzed: don gyis go ba 'di ni sgra las byung ba'i tshad ma sngon du 'gro ba can yin no //
translated: This understanding of the meaning is preceded by the valid knowledge that arises from the word.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa mjug pa sdud par byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa mjug pa sdud par byed de /
translated: “Therefore” is the conclusion of the inference.

original: rtag pa dang zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi ming can gyi don dang ngo //
analyzed: rtag pa dang zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi ming can gyi don dang ngo //
translated: “Permanence” is the meaning of the term “type.”

original: rtag tu ste dus thams cad du 'brel pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtag tu ste dus thams cad du 'brel pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is permanent because it is related at all times.

original: dper na rdul phra rab rnams rtag pa'i nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rdul phra rab rnams rtag pa'i nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the permanent space that is the atoms.

original: don gyis go ba'i ma nges pa nyid spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don gyis go ba'i ma nges pa nyid spang ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to eliminate the uncertainty about the meaning of the statement “The meaning of the word ‘cow’ is understood through the exclusion of the non-cow,” he says,

original: du ma'i spyi la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: du ma'i spyi la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The opponent’s position is stated in the lines beginning “The general🔽characteristic of many things . . . ”

original: ji skad du bshad pa las sgra rtag pa la lan mang du brjod cing sngar thos pa na ba lang gzhan dang gzhan dag la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gi spyi brjod pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa las sgra rtag pa la lan mang du brjod cing sngar thos pa na ba lang gzhan dang gzhan dag la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gi spyi brjod pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: The word “generally” in the phrase “the general property of many” refers to the fact that the word “cow” is pronounced many times in the way it has been explained above. When one hears it pronounced previously, one understands the expression of the general property of the cow that is present in other individual cows.

original: de'i phyir yang rtag pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang rtag pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is also said that the word is permanent.

original: gsal ba rang gi rgyu mtshan can //
analyzed: gsal ba rang gi rgyu mtshan can //
translated: The individual is the reason for itself.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid ji ltar ba'i khyad par tha dad pa rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid ji ltar ba'i khyad par tha dad pa rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the phrase “the individual that is different in its own nature” is this.

original: de dag gi tha dad pa rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni tha dad pa nyid de /
analyzed: de dag gi tha dad pa rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni tha dad pa nyid de /
translated: The reason for the understanding of their difference is difference itself.

original: des na bdag nyid kyi tha dad pa nyid gang dag la yod pa de dag ni rang gi rgyu mtshan can te /
analyzed: des na bdag nyid kyi tha dad pa nyid gang dag la yod pa de dag ni rang gi rgyu mtshan can te /
translated: Therefore, those that have difference in their own nature are the reason for themselves.

original: spangs nas zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: spangs nas zhes 'brel to //
translated: The word “having abandoned” is connected to this.

original: 'di snyam du gal te yun ring mos rtogs pa de lta na yang ji ltar sgra'i dus thams cad du yod pa nyid grub snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te yun ring mos rtogs pa de lta na yang ji ltar sgra'i dus thams cad du yod pa nyid grub snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think in this way, “Even if it is understood in this way for a long time, how is the existence of sound at all times established?”

original: de snyed dus su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de snyed dus su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says “at that time” and so on.

original: de snyed pa'i dus ni tha dad pa'i rang gi don rtogs par byed pa'i dus so //
analyzed: de snyed pa'i dus ni tha dad pa'i rang gi don rtogs par byed pa'i dus so //
translated: That time is the time of understanding the individual object.

original: 'on te bum pa la sogs pa dus de snyed du bstan pa rnams kyang tho ba la sogs pa dag gis phyis 'jig pa de bzhin du sgra yang 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bum pa la sogs pa dus de snyed du bstan pa rnams kyang tho ba la sogs pa dag gis phyis 'jig pa de bzhin du sgra yang 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is the case that the pots and so on that are taught at that time are later destroyed by hammers and so on, then sound also would be like that.

original: slar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: slar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says “again” and so on.

original: slar yang zhes bya ba ni phyi nas so //
analyzed: slar yang zhes bya ba ni phyi nas so //
translated: “Again” means later.

original: dper na bum pa la sogs pa mtshon cha la sogs pas gcod pa'am rnying pas 'jig pa de ltar sgra la rgyu yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa la sogs pa mtshon cha la sogs pas gcod pa'am rnying pas 'jig pa de ltar sgra la rgyu yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Sound does not have a cause in the way that pots and so on are cut by weapons and so on or destroyed by old age.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: lus can ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lus can ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not physical.

original: bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyang lus can yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyang lus can yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: and so too, pots and so on would have bodies.

original: rigs las bum sogs gcig gyur na //🔽grub pa sgrub @138a * //
analyzed: rigs las bum sogs gcig gyur na // grub pa sgrub @138a * //
translated: If the letters were one due to their type,

original: yin par 'dod //
analyzed: yin par 'dod //
translated: then an established fact would be proven.

original: gal te phyogs 'dis gsal ba rnams //
analyzed: gal te phyogs 'dis gsal ba rnams //
translated: If you say that this position

original: gcig tu 'gyur ba byed pas na //
analyzed: gcig tu 'gyur ba byed pas na //
translated: makes the manifest entities one,

original: de tshe tshad ma thams cad kyis //
analyzed: de tshe tshad ma thams cad kyis //
translated: then at that time you would be saying

original: mthong ba dang 'gal brjod par bya //
analyzed: mthong ba dang 'gal brjod par bya //
translated: that you contradict what is seen by all valid cognitions.

original: zhes gang smras pa de ni 'di la yang mtshungs te /
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa de ni 'di la yang mtshungs te /
translated: That is the same here.

original: rigs las ga sogs gcig gyur na //
analyzed: rigs las ga sogs gcig gyur na //
translated: If the letters were one due to their type,

original: grub pa sgrub pa yin par 'dod //
analyzed: grub pa sgrub pa yin par 'dod //
translated: then an established fact would be proven.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa thams cad brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa thams cad brjod par bya'o //
translated: You should say all of that and more.

original: 'di ltar yul dang dus dang sbyor ba po tha dad pa'i phyir ba lang la sogs pa'i gsal ba bzhin du ga la sogs pa yi ge'i gsal ba mang po yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yul dang dus dang sbyor ba po tha dad pa'i phyir ba lang la sogs pa'i gsal ba bzhin du ga la sogs pa yi ge'i gsal ba mang po yin te /
translated: In this way, like the manifest entities of cows and so on, the manifest entities of letters such as ga are many because their objects, times, and performers are different.

original: ba lang nyid la sogs pa bzhin du de'i rten can gyi ga la sogs pa yang spyir 'dod pa'i phyir thams cad mtshungs so zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: ba lang nyid la sogs pa bzhin du de'i rten can gyi ga la sogs pa yang spyir 'dod pa'i phyir thams cad mtshungs so zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Since the universal of cow and so on are accepted as general, just like cow and so on, all are similar.

original: yul dang dus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yul dang dus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this qualm, he says, “Place, time, and so on,” and so forth.

original: ngo shes par brjod pa'i mngon sum las gsal ba rnam gcig tu grub po //
analyzed: ngo shes par brjod pa'i mngon sum las gsal ba rnam gcig tu grub po //
translated: From the direct perception that is said to recognize, the manifestation is established as one.

original: mngon sum dang 'gal na rjes su dpag par tshad mar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum dang 'gal na rjes su dpag par tshad mar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: If it contradicts direct perception, it is not valid as inference.

original: mngon sum ni tshad ma thams cad kyi thu bo yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ni tshad ma thams cad kyi thu bo yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: This is because direct perception is the chief of all valid cognitions.

original: 'on te myur ba dang dal ba dang bar ma la sogs pa'i rtogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir gsal ba rnams tha dad pa nyid du grub pa ma yin nam /🔽de ji ltar ngo shes gsal bar yod //
analyzed: 'on te myur ba dang dal ba dang bar ma la sogs pa'i rtogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir gsal ba rnams tha dad pa nyid du grub pa ma yin nam / de ji ltar ngo shes gsal bar yod //
translated: But if it is established that the manifestations are different because of the difference in the realizations of fast, slow, medium, and so on,

original: ces brjod ce na /🔽myur ba la sogs tha dad kyang //
analyzed: ces brjod ce na / myur ba la sogs tha dad kyang //
translated: how can it be said, “How can recognition exist in the manifestation”?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “Although there is a difference in fast and so on,” and so forth.

original: rnam chad par zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam chad par zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa'o //
translated: “Different” means “separate.”

original: grub pa zhes bya ba ni ma brtags pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa zhes bya ba ni ma brtags pa'o //
translated: “Accomplishment” means non-examination.

original: ga'i gsal ba ni yi ge ga'i gsal ba ste /
analyzed: ga'i gsal ba ni yi ge ga'i gsal ba ste /
translated: The manifestation of the letter “ga” is the manifestation of the letter “ga.”

original: ngo shes pa gcig tu byas pa'i phyir ga'i gsal ba gzhan yod pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //🔽'on te 'di 'dra ga nyid la sogs pa'i rigs kho na shes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ngo shes pa gcig tu byas pa'i phyir ga'i gsal ba gzhan yod pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no // 'on te 'di 'dra ga nyid la sogs pa'i rigs kho na shes pa yin gyi /
translated: Since the recognition is made of one, there is no other manifestation of the letter “ga.”

original: gsal ba ni ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gsal ba ni ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not the case that the cognition is of the class of the letter “ga” itself, and not of the manifestation?

original: de ji ltar gsal ba la ngo shes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar gsal ba la ngo shes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can there be recognition of the manifestation?

original: shin tu tha dad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shin tu tha dad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “because of the extreme difference, etc.”

original: ga gzhan blo yis ma rtogs phyir //
analyzed: ga gzhan blo yis ma rtogs phyir //
translated: Because the other “ga” is not apprehended by the cognition.

original: yi ge ga las gzhan ni ga gzhan te /
analyzed: yi ge ga las gzhan ni ga gzhan te /
translated: The other “ga” is different from the letter “ga.”

original: de la blo des ma rtogs phyir te /
analyzed: de la blo des ma rtogs phyir te /
translated: Because that is not apprehended by the cognition,

original: ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not grasped.

original: kun tu brtags pa'i gnyid bzhin //
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa'i gnyid bzhin //
translated: Like the imagination of a universal.

original: zhes bya ba ni spyi rnams kyi spyi med pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni spyi rnams kyi spyi med pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no universal of universals. This is a tenet.

original: yi ge'i phyir yang 'di bsgrub bya //
analyzed: yi ge'i phyir yang 'di bsgrub bya //
translated: This is to be established even for the sake of the letter.

original: zhes bya ba ni gnyid dgag pa zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnyid dgag pa zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: This is the remainder of the refutation of sleep.

original: de la sbyor @138b ba ni gang dang gang yi ge yin pa de ni shin tu tha dad pa'i gnyid kyi rten du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de la sbyor @138b ba ni gang dang gang yi ge yin pa de ni shin tu tha dad pa'i gnyid kyi rten du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: In that regard, the application is this: Whatever is a letter is not a basis of sleep, which is a different thing.

original: dper na yi ge kha la sogs pa bzhin no //🔽yi ge ga 'di yang yi ge yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gal bas khyad par dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: dper na yi ge kha la sogs pa bzhin no // yi ge ga 'di yang yi ge yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gal bas khyad par dmigs pa ste /
translated: For example, like the letter “ka,” etc.

original: gnyid kyi rten dang 'gal bas yi ge la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyid kyi rten dang 'gal bas yi ge la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This letter “ga” is a letter. This is the observation of a contradictory attribute, because being a letter is pervaded by being a basis of sleep, which is contradictory.

original: 'dir dam bca' ba mthong ba dang 'gal ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'chad pa ni ldog pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir dam bca' ba mthong ba dang 'gal ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'chad pa ni ldog pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Here, the explanation of the thesis that it is not contradictory to observe is “The reversal, etc.”

original: ldog pa ni tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: ldog pa ni tha dad pa'o //
translated: Reversal is difference.

original: mthong ba ni mngon sum mo //
analyzed: mthong ba ni mngon sum mo //
translated: Observation is direct perception.

original: 'di snyam du sangs rgyas pa la grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sangs rgyas pa la grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: In this regard, the Buddhist has established the proof, because the following is observed:

original: 'di ltar blo gcig nyid ni gzhan sel ba'i rgyu mtshan can du 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar blo gcig nyid ni gzhan sel ba'i rgyu mtshan can du 'dod kyi /
translated: Thus, a single cognition is accepted as having the reason of the exclusion of another,

original: tha dad pa'i gnyid kyi rgyu mtshan gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i gnyid kyi rgyu mtshan gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: but not as having the reason of a different sleep.

original: de lta yin dang tha dad pa'i gnyid bkag na yang blo gcig gi dbang gis yi ge gcig nyid du mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de lta yin dang tha dad pa'i gnyid bkag na yang blo gcig gi dbang gis yi ge gcig nyid du mi 'grub ste /
translated: If it were so, then even if the different states of sleep were blocked, the single letter would not be established by the power of a single cognition.

original: de ni gzhan sel ba'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: de ni gzhan sel ba'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa la /
translated: Because that is the reason for the exclusion of other.

original: gnyis las grub pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gnyis las grub pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To address this doubt, he says “established from two” and so on.

original: ci'i phyir gnyi ga la grub pa'i yi ge'i bdag nyid yongs su spangs nas brtags pa'i gzhan sel ba'i rtag pa nyid dang gcig pu dang khyab pa nyid la sogs pa rjod par byed de /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gnyi ga la grub pa'i yi ge'i bdag nyid yongs su spangs nas brtags pa'i gzhan sel ba'i rtag pa nyid dang gcig pu dang khyab pa nyid la sogs pa rjod par byed de /
translated: Why, having abandoned the nature of the letter established from both, do you describe the imagined exclusion of other as permanent, single, and pervasive, and so on?

original: rigs kyi chos gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi chos gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is explained that the universal is the property of abiding.

original: gang kho na gnyi ga la grub pa de kho na brtag par rigs te /
analyzed: gang kho na gnyi ga la grub pa de kho na brtag par rigs te /
translated: It is reasonable to imagine only what is established for both.

original: gzhan du na ma mthong ba rtog na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na ma mthong ba rtog na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if one imagines what is not seen, there would be an absurd consequence.

original: de lta bas na yi ge gcig yin pa'i phyir ngo shes pa'i blo gcig nye bar skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na yi ge gcig yin pa'i phyir ngo shes pa'i blo gcig nye bar skye ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is a single letter, a single cognition of recognition arises.

original: gal te de lta na myur ba dang dal ba dang bar ma la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi blo ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na myur ba dang dal ba dang bar ma la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi blo ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, how does the mind arise in regard to the distinctions of swift, slow, medium, etc.?🔽The mind arises in regard to the distinctions of swift, slow, medium, etc.

original: gsal bar byed pa tha dad pas //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa tha dad pas // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: because of the difference in the manifestation.

original: gsal bar byed pa ni rlung las byung ba'i ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba dag go //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa ni rlung las byung ba'i ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba dag go //
translated: The manifestation is the conjunction and disjunction that arise from the wind.

original: 'on te rlung rnam ba'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir de'i ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba yang rna ba'i yul ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te rlung rnam ba'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir de'i ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba yang rna ba'i yul ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: But, since the wind is not the object of the ear, is not its conjunction and disjunction also not the object of the ear?

original: de ji ltar gsal bar byed pa ma bzung bas gsal bar byed pa 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar gsal bar byed pa ma bzung bas gsal bar byed pa 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: How can the ear sense-faculty grasp the conjunction and disjunction when it does not grasp the manifestation?🔽It is not reasonable to grasp the manifested object, such as a pot, without grasping the manifestation.

original: snang ba ma bzung bar de'i gsal bar bya ba bum pa la sogs pa 'dzin par rigs pa ma yin no snyam du bsams nas rtsod par byed pa ni gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: snang ba ma bzung bar de'i gsal bar bya ba bum pa la sogs pa 'dzin par rigs pa ma yin no snyam du bsams nas rtsod par byed pa ni gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thinking in this way, he argues:

original: gang gi zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: gang gi zhes bya ba ni //
translated: “Whose manifestation?”

original: brda sprod pa la sogs pa gang gi ltar na dbyangs kyi bdag nyid kyi @139a * //🔽sgra gsal bar byed pa yin gyi rlung las byung ba'i ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa de'i ltar na gsal bya dang gsal byed gnyis snang ba'i gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir gcig gi blo dang khyad par gyi blo ste blo
analyzed: brda sprod pa la sogs pa gang gi ltar na dbyangs kyi bdag nyid kyi @139a * // sgra gsal bar byed pa yin gyi rlung las byung ba'i ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba'i bdag nyid ma yin pa de'i ltar na gsal bya dang gsal byed gnyis snang ba'i gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir gcig gi blo dang khyad par gyi blo ste blo
translated: According to the grammarians, etc.,🔽sound is the nature of the vowels and consonants, and it is the manifestor. It is not the nature of the wind, which is the conjoined and the disjoined.

original: gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: According to them, the manifestor and the manifested are objects of apprehension of sight, and therefore there would be two cognitions:🔽the cognition of one and the cognition of the distinction.

original: khyed spyod pa pa la rlung las byung ba'i ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba'i bdag nyid rnams kyis khyad par gyi blo 'byung bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: khyed spyod pa pa la rlung las byung ba'i ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba'i bdag nyid rnams kyis khyad par gyi blo 'byung bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How can the cognition of the distinction arise for you Vaise~ika from the conjoined and disjoined, which are the nature of the wind?

original: ga las she na /🔽sgra tsam rnams ni dbang po las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la lhag ma'o //
analyzed: ga las she na / sgra tsam rnams ni dbang po las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la lhag ma'o //
translated: Why?🔽Because the mere sounds are beyond the senses.

original: gang tshe sgra tsam zhes bya ba la sgos pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: gang tshe sgra tsam zhes bya ba la sgos pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: When the mere sound is the object, the answer is given:

original: de ni ste sgra tsam ni de dang 'brel ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sgra dang 'brel ba'i phyir rtogs pa ste 'dzin pa yin par kha cig rjod par byed de /
analyzed: de ni ste sgra tsam ni de dang 'brel ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sgra dang 'brel ba'i phyir rtogs pa ste 'dzin pa yin par kha cig rjod par byed de /
translated: “That” refers to the mere sound, because it is related to that. Some say that the cognition, i.e., the apprehension, is due to the relation with the sound.

original: gal te sgra tsam 'ba' zhig rna bas gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa de lta na yang sgra dang 'brel pa 'dzin pa ni yod pa'i phyir blo gnyis su 'gyur ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de dag gi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: gal te sgra tsam 'ba' zhig rna bas gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa de lta na yang sgra dang 'brel pa 'dzin pa ni yod pa'i phyir blo gnyis su 'gyur ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de dag gi gsal ba'o //
translated: Even if the mere sound alone is not apprehended by the ear, still, since the relation with the sound is apprehended, there is no occurrence of two cognitions. This is their clarification.

original: yang na de dag ces bya ba 'dis ni mi 'dzin pa'i phyogs la yang blo gnyis sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: yang na de dag ces bya ba 'dis ni mi 'dzin pa'i phyogs la yang blo gnyis sgrub par byed do //
translated: Or, by “those,” they also establish the occurrence of two cognitions in the position that does not apprehend.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba'i bdag nyid kyi sgra tsam rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba'i bdag nyid kyi sgra tsam rnams so //
translated: “Those” refers to the mere sounds that have the nature of conjunction and disjunction.

original: ji ltar ma bzung bas gsal bar byed pas gsal bya'i blor 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar ma bzung bas gsal bar byed pas gsal bya'i blor 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that, since they are not apprehended, they become the object of cognition?

original: de yi dbang gis sgra las snang //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de yi dbang gis sgra las snang // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because of the power of that, it appears as sound.

original: sgra tsam gyi dbang gis te /
analyzed: sgra tsam gyi dbang gis te /
translated: Because of the power of the mere sound.

original: de yod pa tsam nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de yod pa tsam nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: “merely by its existence.”

original: gal te rang gi ngo bo tsam 'dzin du chug mod /
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bo tsam 'dzin du chug mod /
translated: Granted that it apprehends mere sound,

original: chen po la sogs pa'i khyad par 'dzin par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: chen po la sogs pa'i khyad par 'dzin par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: but how does it apprehend the distinctions of “great” and so on?

original: de yang 'du byed rjed byed ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yang 'du byed rjed byed ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is: “It is due to the influence of the formative factors.”

original: gang gi tshe sgra tsam chen po dag gis rna ba la 'du byed pa chen po byed pa de'i tshe sgra la chen po nyid du rtogs la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sgra tsam chen po dag gis rna ba la 'du byed pa chen po byed pa de'i tshe sgra la chen po nyid du rtogs la /
translated: When the mere sound of “great” produces a great formative influence on the ear, then sound is cognized as “great.”

original: gang gi tshe chung dus chung du yin pa de'i tshe chung ba nyid do zhes bya ba de lta bu'i 'du byed kyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir gong nas gong du tha dad pa yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe chung dus chung du yin pa de'i tshe chung ba nyid do zhes bya ba de lta bu'i 'du byed kyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir gong nas gong du tha dad pa yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: When it is small, it is cognized as “small.” Since it is due to the influence of the formative factors, the distinctions of “greater” and “smaller” should be applied in the same way.

original: 'on te gang chen po la sogs pa 'dzin pa de khyod kyi lugs kyis gsal bar byed pa la gnas pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te gang chen po la sogs pa 'dzin pa de khyod kyi lugs kyis gsal bar byed pa la gnas pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: But if the apprehension of “great” and so on is based on the manifestation of sound in your system,

original: gsal bar bya ba la gnas pa ni ma yin nam /
analyzed: gsal bar bya ba la gnas pa ni ma yin nam /
translated: isn’t it based on the manifested object?

original: de yang gsal bar byed pa ma bzung bas mi 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir de ji ltar gsal bar byed pa la gnas pa ma bzung bar sgra la chen po la sogs pa sgro 'dogs par byed de /
analyzed: de yang gsal bar byed pa ma bzung bas mi 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir de ji ltar gsal bar byed pa la gnas pa ma bzung bar sgra la chen po la sogs pa sgro 'dogs par byed de /
translated: Since it does not apprehend sound without apprehending the clarifier, how could it superimpose largeness and so on on sound without apprehending the clarifier?

original: chu la sogs pa yul du ma byas par smig rgyu la sogs pa la sgro 'dogs par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: chu la sogs pa yul du ma byas par smig rgyu la sogs pa la sgro 'dogs par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not that without taking water and so on as objects, one superimposes mirage and so on.

original: dper na mngar ba kha ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dper na mngar ba kha ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: For example, sweet tastes are perceived as sour and so on.🔽Thus, due to the fault of bile, one apprehends sweet and so on as sour and so on, even though they are not the essence of bile.

original: 'di @139b ltar mkhris pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa bzung ba nyid du mkhris pa'i skyon gyis mngar ba la sogs pa'i yul la kha ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor 'dzin pa dang / yang na ji ltar myur du 'gro ba dang grur zhugs pa 'khor bas bsgos pa'i 'khrul pa can dri la sogs pa 'gro ba dang 'khor bar mthong ba dang /
analyzed: 'di @139b ltar mkhris pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa bzung ba nyid du mkhris pa'i skyon gyis mngar ba la sogs pa'i yul la kha ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor 'dzin pa dang / yang na ji ltar myur du 'gro ba dang grur zhugs pa 'khor bas bsgos pa'i 'khrul pa can dri la sogs pa 'gro ba dang 'khor bar mthong ba dang /
translated: Or, just as one who moves quickly or is on a boat mistakes the trees and so on as moving due to the fault of the boat, one who is polluted by samsara sees smells and so on as moving and revolving.

original: ji ltar sbal ba'i zhag gis mig byugs pas gdung ma sprul gyi ngo bor mthong ste /
analyzed: ji ltar sbal ba'i zhag gis mig byugs pas gdung ma sprul gyi ngo bor mthong ste /
translated: Just as when the eyes are affected by bile, one sees a white shell as yellow.

original: ji ltar gsal bar chung ba dang che ba dag gis de la brten pa'i gsal ba la brten pa'i spyi chung ba dang che ba dag gis rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gsal bar chung ba dang che ba dag gis de la brten pa'i gsal ba la brten pa'i spyi chung ba dang che ba dag gis rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Just as the small and the large are understood through the smallness and largeness of the universals based on them.

original: yod pa zhes bya ba ni spyi chen po'o //
analyzed: yod pa zhes bya ba ni spyi chen po'o //
translated: Existence is a universal.

original: chung ba ni ba lang nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chung ba ni ba lang nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: Smallness and largeness are universals.

original: de lta ma yin na rtag tu thams cad du 'gro ba nyid kyis thams cad du mtshungs pa'i phyir spyi'i chung ngu dang chen po nyid su zhig gis byas par 'gyur /🔽de lta bas na ji ltar mkhris pa la sogs pa rgyu mtshan med par mngar ba la sogs pa de dag kha ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor 'dzin pa de bzhin du gsal bar byed pa la gnas pa chen po la sogs pa ma bzung bar sgra la
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rtag tu thams cad du 'gro ba nyid kyis thams cad du mtshungs pa'i phyir spyi'i chung ngu dang chen po nyid su zhig gis byas par 'gyur / de lta bas na ji ltar mkhris pa la sogs pa rgyu mtshan med par mngar ba la sogs pa de dag kha ba la sogs pa'i ngo bor 'dzin pa de bzhin du gsal bar byed pa la gnas pa chen po la sogs pa ma bzung bar sgra la
translated: Otherwise, since it would always be present everywhere, who would make it small or large through its presence in some places and absence in others?

original: chen po la sogs par 'khrul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chen po la sogs par 'khrul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, just as sweetness, etc. are apprehended as sourness, etc. without a cause such as bile, etc., in the same way, without apprehending the large, etc. which are the bases of the universals, one would be mistaken about the universals of largeness, etc. in sound.

original: ma rtogs nas zhes bya ba ni 'khrul ba'i bya ba la ltos nas byed po mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma rtogs nas zhes bya ba ni 'khrul ba'i bya ba la ltos nas byed po mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: The phrase without understanding refers to the agent in relation to the activity of error.

original: de lta ma yin na kva'i rkyen du mi 'gyur ro //🔽ci ste gang dag sgra la sogs pa'i chung ngu dang chen po la sogs pa'i blo de gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na kva'i rkyen du mi 'gyur ro // ci ste gang dag sgra la sogs pa'i chung ngu dang chen po la sogs pa'i blo de gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin gyi /
translated: Otherwise, the particle ca would not be used.

original: chen po la sogs pa tha dad pa yod pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /🔽rang las thung sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chen po la sogs pa tha dad pa yod pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na / rang las thung sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: But how can it be understood that the cognition of sound, etc. as small, large, etc. is due to something else, and not due to its own nature, because of the existence of difference in the form of large, etc.?

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni ring ba dang 'phar ba dang steng du 'don pa dang / rjes su 'don pa dang / 'bring du 'don pa dang / drug skyes pa la sogs pa yongs su bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni ring ba dang 'phar ba dang steng du 'don pa dang / rjes su 'don pa dang / 'bring du 'don pa dang / drug skyes pa la sogs pa yongs su bzung ngo //
translated: The response is because of the cognition of short, etc. The word etc. includes the cognitions of long, high, low, drawn out, drawn in, and medium.

original: rtag par smra ba la 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni ngo shes pas rtag pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: rtag par smra ba la 'gal lo zhes bya ba ni ngo shes pas rtag pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The phrase it contradicts the doctrine of permanence means that it is thought that permanence is established by recognition.

original: sgra ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi lugs kyis mngon par gsal ba ma grub pa dogs par byed do //
analyzed: sgra ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi lugs kyis mngon par gsal ba ma grub pa dogs par byed do //
translated: The opponent’s position that manifestation is not established is suspected by “sound,” etc.

original: sgra'i mngon par gsal ba de yin na /
analyzed: sgra'i mngon par gsal ba de yin na /
translated: If that is the manifestation of sound,

original: rlung las byung ba'i ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba dag gis sgra legs par byas pa las sam /
analyzed: rlung las byung ba'i ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba dag gis sgra legs par byas pa las sam /
translated: is it from the sound being well-formed due to the conjunction and disjunction arising from wind,

original: dbang po legs par byas pa las sam /
analyzed: dbang po legs par byas pa las sam /
translated: or is it from the sense faculty being well-formed,

original: sgra dang dbang po gnyis ka legs par byas pa las yin grang /
analyzed: sgra dang dbang po gnyis ka legs par byas pa las yin grang /
translated: or is it from both the sound and the sense faculty being well-formed?

original: de la gal te sgra legs par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: de la gal te sgra legs par byed pa yin na /
translated: If it is the sound being well-formed,

original: de'i tshe grong khyer dmar bu can la sogs pa yul @140a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe grong khyer dmar bu can la sogs pa yul @140a * //
translated: then at the time of the city of Pāṭaliputra, etc.,

original: gcig tu legs par byas pa yul thams cad na gnas pa rnams kyis cig car 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gcig tu legs par byas pa yul thams cad na gnas pa rnams kyis cig car 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: those abiding in all places would simultaneously apprehend the sound that is well-formed in one place,

original: de ni thams cad du song ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni thams cad du song ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would extend everywhere.

original: yang ci ste yul gcig tu legs par byas pa yin gyi thams cad du ni ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: yang ci ste yul gcig tu legs par byas pa yin gyi thams cad du ni ma yin no snyam na /
translated: But if it is thought that it is well-formed in one place but not everywhere,

original: cha shas med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: cha shas med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then “if it is partless” is stated.

original: sgra ni cha shas med pa yin te /
analyzed: sgra ni cha shas med pa yin te /
translated: Sound is partless,

original: lus can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not corporeal.

original: ci ltar khyab pa nyid yin na yang cha shas med pa phyogs gcig gis 'du byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: ci ltar khyab pa nyid yin na yang cha shas med pa phyogs gcig gis 'du byed par 'gyur /
translated: Even if it is all-pervading, how can it be combined in one place, being partless?

original: ci ste yang cha shas med pa yin na yang rten tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad par legs par byed par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste yang cha shas med pa yin na yang rten tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad par legs par byed par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: But if it is partless, it is well combined because it has different supports.

original: brten pa'i bye brag dag gis kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: brten pa'i bye brag dag gis kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “Even though the differences in the supports are different,”

original: khyab pa'i phyir sgra ni rten med pa yin no //
analyzed: khyab pa'i phyir sgra ni rten med pa yin no //
translated: because sound is all-pervading, it has no support.

original: 'on te sgra nam mkha'i yon tan yin pa'i phyir dang / yon tan yang yon tan can la brten pa'i phyir sgra'i nam mkha' yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sgra nam mkha'i yon tan yin pa'i phyir dang / yon tan yang yon tan can la brten pa'i phyir sgra'i nam mkha' yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you think that sound is in the space that is the support of sound because sound is a quality of space and because a quality must have a substratum,

original: 'on te nam mkha' rten yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'on te nam mkha' rten yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “But if space is the support of sound,” etc.

original: nam mkha' cha shas med pa'i phyir rten gyi phyogs tha dad pas legs par byed pa tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' cha shas med pa'i phyir rten gyi phyogs tha dad pas legs par byed pa tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Because space is partless, it is not well combined because it has different parts as its support.

original: 'on te gal te yang nam mkha' cha shas med pa yin pa de lta na yang ldan pa tha dad pa'i phyir bum pa'i nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin du rna ba'i khung bu'i mthar thug par yongs su dpyad pa'i nam mkha' tha dad par 'gyur ba yin🔽no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gal te yang nam mkha' cha shas med pa yin pa de lta na yang ldan pa tha dad pa'i phyir bum pa'i nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin du rna ba'i khung bu'i mthar thug par yongs su dpyad pa'i nam mkha' tha dad par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if space is partless, then, because of the difference of the possessor, the space that is investigated as the limit of the cavity of the ear is different from the space of the pot, etc.

original: sgra ma lus pa rtogs phyir yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sgra ma lus pa rtogs phyir yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To respond: Because all sound is cognized,

original: phyogs gcig legs par byas mi 'gyur //🔽zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: phyogs gcig legs par byas mi 'gyur // zhes 'brel to //
translated: one part is not well-taken.

original: sgra ni cha shas med pa nyid rtogs te /
analyzed: sgra ni cha shas med pa nyid rtogs te /
translated: Sound is cognized as partless.

original: nam mkha'i phyogs gcig legs par byas pa yin na de yang rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i phyogs gcig legs par byas pa yin na de yang rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one part of space were well-taken, that also would not be cognized.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'di nyid mjug sdud pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid mjug sdud pa'i phyir /
translated: To summarize this,

original: phyogs gcig legs par byas pa na //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽nam mkha' khyab par gnas pa'i sgra de'i phyogs gcig gis legs par byas pa ni /
analyzed: phyogs gcig legs par byas pa na // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / nam mkha' khyab par gnas pa'i sgra de'i phyogs gcig gis legs par byas pa ni /
translated: one part is not well-taken.

original: mtha' dag shes par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mtha' dag shes par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Sound that pervades space is not able to be cognized by one part of it being well-taken.

original: dbang po legs par byas pa'i phyogs la sun 'byin pa bshad pa ni /
analyzed: dbang po legs par byas pa'i phyogs la sun 'byin pa bshad pa ni /
translated: The refutation of the position that the sense faculty is well formed is as follows:

original: nam mkha' rna ba yin phyogs la //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' rna ba yin phyogs la // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: In the position that space is the ear,🔽In the position that space is the ear,

original: gang dag gi ltar na nam mkha' la rna ba yin no snyam pa'i phyogs de'i ltar na yang nam mkha' ni gcig yin pa'i phyir dang khyab pa yin pa'i phyir sgra thams cad dang phrad par mtshungs pa'i phyir sgra thag ring po na @140b gnas pa yang 'dzin🔽par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang dag gi ltar na nam mkha' la rna ba yin no snyam pa'i phyogs de'i ltar na yang nam mkha' ni gcig yin pa'i phyir dang khyab pa yin pa'i phyir sgra thams cad dang phrad par mtshungs pa'i phyir sgra thag ring po na @140b gnas pa yang 'dzin par 'gyur la /
translated: then, because space is one and pervasive, it is similar in being in contact with all sounds, and therefore distant sounds would be apprehended.

original: srog chags thams cad kyi rna ba yang gcig nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog chags thams cad kyi rna ba yang gcig nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: And the ears of all living beings would be one.

original: de lta yin dang gang gi tshe gcig thos pa de nyid kyi tshe thams cad kyis kyang thos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang gang gi tshe gcig thos pa de nyid kyi tshe thams cad kyis kyang thos par 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, when one hears a sound, all would hear it,

original: rna ba tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rna ba tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the ears would be undifferentiated.

original: gcig gis ma thos pa na thams cad kyis mi thos pa'i skyon yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gcig gis ma thos pa na thams cad kyis mi thos pa'i skyon yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The fault that when one does not hear a sound, all would not hear it should also be stated.

original: 'di snyam du chos dang chos ma yin pas mngon par 'du byas pa'i rna ba'i bu gas yongs su bcad pa'i nam mkha' rna ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du chos dang chos ma yin pas mngon par 'du byas pa'i rna ba'i bu gas yongs su bcad pa'i nam mkha' rna ba yin te /
translated: He thinks: The space that is the inner cavity of the ear is the ear, since it is the basis of the ear, and it is the basis of the ear because it is the object of the eye consciousness that sees the ear.🔽Therefore, since it is pervaded by that, it is similar to the contact theory.🔽And in the same way, the space in the middle of the ear of all living beings is similar to the ear, because it is the basis of the ear.

original: de'i phyir gang las khyab pa'i phyir phrad par mtshungs pa nyid dang / de bzhin du srog chags thams cad kyi rna ba yang gcig nyid du mtshungs par 'gyur ba rna ba'i ga'i dbus kyi nam mkha' la rna bar rna bar gzhag pa'i phyir skyon gnyis po 'di yang gzhi med pa yin no snyam du sems na //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang las khyab pa'i phyir phrad par mtshungs pa nyid dang / de bzhin du srog chags thams cad kyi rna ba yang gcig nyid du mtshungs par 'gyur ba rna ba'i ga'i dbus kyi nam mkha' la rna bar rna bar gzhag pa'i phyir skyon gnyis po 'di yang gzhi med pa yin no snyam du sems na //
translated: Therefore, these two faults are groundless.

original: 'dir bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa ni /
translated: Here we say:

original: de ni cha shas med pa'i phyir //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ni cha shas med pa'i phyir // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because it is partless.🔽If the space of the ear were the ear,

original: gang gi nam mkha' phyogs 'ga' zhig kho na rna bar 'gyur ba cha shas med pa la don dam par phyogs gcig yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi nam mkha' phyogs 'ga' zhig kho na rna bar 'gyur ba cha shas med pa la don dam par phyogs gcig yod pa ma yin no //
translated: then the space of the ear would be partless, because it is the basis of the ear.

original: rnam gzhag gnyis ni phrad par mi mtshungs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa dang / rna ba du ma nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam gzhag gnyis ni phrad par mi mtshungs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa dang / rna ba du ma nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The two theories are the theory of the non-contact of the object and sense faculty and the theory of the multiplicity of sense faculties.

original: yang na sgra 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa gnyis so //
analyzed: yang na sgra 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa gnyis so //
translated: Or, the two theories are the theory of the apprehension and non-apprehension of sound.

original: gzhan yang lan cig ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang lan cig ste /
translated: Again, there is another reply.

original: phyogs gcig rna ba legs par byas na sgra thams cad rtogs par 'gyur te 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs gcig rna ba legs par byas na sgra thams cad rtogs par 'gyur te 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one part of the ear is well-formed, then all sounds are cognized, are apprehended.

original: de ni sgra thams cad kyi thun mong yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de ni sgra thams cad kyi thun mong yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because it is common to all sounds,

original: sgra de dag thams cad kyis khyab pa nyid kyi rung ba'i yul nyid du tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra de dag thams cad kyis khyab pa nyid kyi rung ba'i yul nyid du tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because the entire ear is pervaded by all those sounds, and because the suitable object is not differentiated.

original: 'di snyam du gang gis rtogs par bya ba'i don du smra ba po nyan pa po'i rna ba legs par byed pa'i sgra de kho na rna ba des 'dzin par 'gyur gyi gzhan ni ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gang gis rtogs par bya ba'i don du smra ba po nyan pa po'i rna ba legs par byed pa'i sgra de kho na rna ba des 'dzin par 'gyur gyi gzhan ni ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that the sound which the speaker well-forms the hearer’s ear in order to be cognized is apprehended by that ear and not another,

original: bum pa la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bum pa la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then Nāgārjuna says, “If the ear is well-formed for the sake of apprehending sound,” and so on.

original: mi rtogs par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mi rtogs par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: It is not that they are not cognized,

original: 'on kyang rtogs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang rtogs pa kho na ste /
translated: but rather that they are cognized,

original: yul rung bar mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: yul rung bar mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: because the object is the same.

original: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni sgra thams cad 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni sgra thams cad 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The word “this” refers to the apprehension of all sounds.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: yul mtshungs par ni 'jug pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yul mtshungs par ni 'jug pa'i phyir //
translated: Because they engage the same object.

original: legs byas khyab pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: legs byas khyab pa med phyir ro //
translated: Because the effect of the action is not pervasive.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: sgra thams cad kyang khyab pa nyid kyi nam mkha' la gnas par mtshungs la /
analyzed: sgra thams cad kyang khyab pa nyid kyi nam mkha' la gnas par mtshungs la /
translated: All sounds are the same in that they exist in space, which is pervasive.

original: de lta bas na 'di dag gi legs par byas pa yang khyab par med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir @141a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di dag gi legs par byas pa yang khyab par med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir @141a * //
translated: Therefore, the effect of the action is not pervasive.

original: thams cad 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it follows that all sounds are apprehended.

original: kha cig tu /
analyzed: kha cig tu /
translated: In some texts, the verse is recited as follows:

original: legs byas la ni khyab med phyir //
analyzed: legs byas la ni khyab med phyir //
translated: Because the effect of the action is not pervasive.

original: zhes 'don pa der ni ni'i sgra rgyu'i don te /
analyzed: zhes 'don pa der ni ni'i sgra rgyu'i don te /
translated: In this recitation, the word “ni” has the meaning of cause.

original: khyab par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang po la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir gsum pa'i mtha' can yin pas ta si yin no //
analyzed: khyab par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang po la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir gsum pa'i mtha' can yin pas ta si yin no //
translated: Because the effect of the action is not pervasive, it is the third case, the dative. Therefore, it is “tasya.”

original: de lta yin dang don 'di yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows:

original: gang gi phyir sgra rnams khyad par med par legs par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgra rnams khyad par med par legs par byas pa yin te /
translated: Because the sounds are well-formed without distinction,

original: yul mtshungs par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul mtshungs par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they operate in the same domain.

original: de'i phyir sgra thams cad 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra thams cad 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, all sounds are apprehended.

original: 'di snyam du gal te legs par byas pa khyad par med par de lta na yang nyan pa po sgra gang kho na thos par 'dod pa de kho na 'dzin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te legs par byas pa khyad par med par de lta na yang nyan pa po sgra gang kho na thos par 'dod pa de kho na 'dzin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that even if the well-formed sounds are without distinction, the hearer apprehends only the sound he wishes to hear, not another,

original: 'dir smras pa /🔽brtan pa'i rlung ni yongs bkag pa //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / brtan pa'i rlung ni yongs bkag pa //
translated: then here it is said:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “The stable wind is completely blocked” and so on.

original: rlung ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rlung ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of wind:

original: brtan pa dang brtan pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: brtan pa dang brtan pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: stable and unstable.

original: de la brtan pa gang yin pa de ni mun rum bzhin du sgra sgrib par gnas te /
analyzed: de la brtan pa gang yin pa de ni mun rum bzhin du sgra sgrib par gnas te /
translated: Among them, the stable one abides obscuring sound like a cave.

original: de ni smra ba pa'o 'bang pas kun nas bslang ba'i rlung gis ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba skyed par byed la /
analyzed: de ni smra ba pa'o 'bang pas kun nas bslang ba'i rlung gis ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba skyed par byed la /
translated: That is the speaker. The wind that is produced by the power of the unstable wind causes the production of the separation of the sound.

original: ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba de dag gis kyang brtan pa'i rlung de 'gegs par byed de /
analyzed: ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba de dag gis kyang brtan pa'i rlung de 'gegs par byed de /
translated: And by those connections and divisions, that stable wind is blocked.

original: de nyid sgra'i legs par byas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de nyid sgra'i legs par byas pa yin gyi /
translated: That itself is the good performance of sound.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid rgyas pa la sogs pa gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid rgyas pa la sogs pa gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the other, such as the expansion of its own characteristics, because

original: de ni rtag pa nyid kyi ngo bo gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rtag pa nyid kyi ngo bo gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is the nature of a single permanent entity.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens from that?

original: sgrib pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgrib pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said, “The obscurations . . .”

original: 'dod ces bya ba ni 'jig rten dang bstan bcos dag la'o //
analyzed: 'dod ces bya ba ni 'jig rten dang bstan bcos dag la'o //
translated: “Desired” means in the world and in the treatises.

original: dper na bum pa la sogs pa'i mun pa bsal ba na mngon par mi 'dod pa'i mdun na gnas pa de yang dmigs par 'gyur bar mthong ste /
analyzed: dper na bum pa la sogs pa'i mun pa bsal ba na mngon par mi 'dod pa'i mdun na gnas pa de yang dmigs par 'gyur bar mthong ste /
translated: For example, when the darkness of a pot, etc. is removed, that which was previously undesirable and present in front is seen to be observed.

original: rung ba'i yul la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rung ba'i yul la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is in a suitable place.

original: de la gal te sgra legs byas //
analyzed: de la gal te sgra legs byas //
translated: If it is said, “If the good performance of sound

original: thams cad kyis ni rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad kyis ni rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: is understood by everyone,”

original: zhes gang smras pa de la skyon med do //
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa de la skyon med do //
translated: there is no fault in that.

original: gang gi phyir sgra gcig pa yin na yang skyes bu 'ga' zhig la legs par ma byas pa dang / la la la legs par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgra gcig pa yin na yang skyes bu 'ga' zhig la legs par ma byas pa dang / la la la legs par byas pa yin te /
translated: Because even though the words are the same, they are well done for some people and not well done for others.

original: dper na bud med gcig ltos pa tha dad pa'i phyir ma yang yin la bu mo yang yin pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na bud med gcig ltos pa tha dad pa'i phyir ma yang yin la bu mo yang yin pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: For example, a single woman is both a mother and a daughter because she is related to each in a different way.

original: sgra gcig yin na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sgra gcig yin na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “If the words are the same,”

original: sgra gcig nyid yin na legs par byas pa dang legs par ma byas pa'i gnas skabs gnyis rnam grangs med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgra gcig nyid yin na legs par byas pa dang legs par ma byas pa'i gnas skabs gnyis rnam grangs med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: if the words are the same, the two states of being well done and not well done would not be synonyms.

original: gnas skabs @141b rnams ni gnas skabs can las tha mi dad pa'i phyir gnas skabs can gyi rang gi ngo bo bzhin du gnas skabs dag kyang gcig nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs @141b rnams ni gnas skabs can las tha mi dad pa'i phyir gnas skabs can gyi rang gi ngo bo bzhin du gnas skabs dag kyang gcig nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the states are not different from that which has the states, the states would be the same as the nature of that which has the states.

original: gang yang bud med gcig / ma dang bu mor yang brjod pa //
analyzed: gang yang bud med gcig / ma dang bu mor yang brjod pa //
translated: And also, “A single woman is called both mother and daughter.”

original: zhes bya ba de la ni sgra 'ba' zhig nyid tha dad pa yin gyi dngos po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de la ni sgra 'ba' zhig nyid tha dad pa yin gyi dngos po ni ma yin no //
translated: In that case, only the words are different, not the thing.

original: 'di la ni tha snyad tsam tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di la ni tha snyad tsam tha dad pa yin te /
translated: But in this case, the difference is merely verbal.

original: sgra skyes bu thams cad kyis gzung du rung ba nyid du khyad par med par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra skyes bu thams cad kyis gzung du rung ba nyid du khyad par med par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the sound remains without any difference in being suitable to be apprehended by all persons.

original: de lta yin dang 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa dag tu mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa dag tu mi 'gyur la /
translated: If that were the case, then it would not be apprehended or not apprehended.

original: tha snyad rnam pa gzhan du yin pa tsam gyi don byed par nges pa'i rang bzhin nyams par rigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad rnam pa gzhan du yin pa tsam gyi don byed par nges pa'i rang bzhin nyams par rigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not logical that the nature of something that is ascertained to perform a function by merely being a different convention would be impaired.

original: ci ste de'i rang bzhin ni so sor nges pa'i skyes bus gzung bar bya ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: ci ste de'i rang bzhin ni so sor nges pa'i skyes bus gzung bar bya ba nyid yin la /
translated: But if its nature is to be apprehended by a person whose nature is ascertained,

original: des na skyes bu'i nus pa tha dad pa'i phyir 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa dag mi 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: des na skyes bu'i nus pa tha dad pa'i phyir 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa dag mi 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: then because the capacity of the person is different, it is not contradictory that it is apprehended or not apprehended.

original: gang gis gcig gi tshe ma bzung ba'i skyes bu des nam yang 'dzin pa'i par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang gis gcig gi tshe ma bzung ba'i skyes bu des nam yang 'dzin pa'i par mi 'gyur la /
translated: The person who does not apprehend it at one time would never apprehend it.

original: de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de lta bas na gcig nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur du 'ong bas /
analyzed: de lta bas na gcig nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur du 'ong bas /
translated: Therefore, because it would follow that singularity would be impaired,

original: legs par byas pa dang legs par ma byas pa dag las sgra'i gnas skabs gang yang rung ba cig gis khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: legs par byas pa dang legs par ma byas pa dag las sgra'i gnas skabs gang yang rung ba cig gis khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: It should be accepted that either the state of the sound or the state of the ear is faulty.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the fault?

original: gnas skabs gcig ni khas len na //
analyzed: gnas skabs gcig ni khas len na //
translated: If one of the two is accepted as faulty,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: then the other is also faulty.

original: gnyis ka legs par byed pa'i phyogs la nyes pa bshad pa ni /🔽gnyi ga legs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis ka legs par byed pa'i phyogs la nyes pa bshad pa ni / gnyi ga legs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The explanation of the fault in the position that both are good:🔽If both are good,

original: sgra dang / dbang po'i re re legs par byas pa la skyon brjod pa gang dag ni gnyi ga legs par byas pa la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra dang / dbang po'i re re legs par byas pa la skyon brjod pa gang dag ni gnyi ga legs par byas pa la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: then the faults that are stated in the case of the sound and the ear being good individually also apply in the case of both being good.🔽Therefore,

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud par ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud par ro //
translated: this is the summary.

original: bshad pa byed pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: bshad pa byed pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: The reply by the defender:

original: bshad pa byed pas zhes bya ba ni ji skad du gang gi ltar na rna ba la mngon par gsal bar byed pa de'i ltar na yang nyes pa 'di med de /
analyzed: bshad pa byed pas zhes bya ba ni ji skad du gang gi ltar na rna ba la mngon par gsal bar byed pa de'i ltar na yang nyes pa 'di med de /
translated: The defender says, “The fault does not arise for one according to whom the ear is manifest.

original: ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba dag ni thag ring po na yod pa'i rna ba'i bu ga la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba dag ni thag ring po na yod pa'i rna ba'i bu ga la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: And the ear sense-faculty, which is located far away, is not benefited by the ear sense-faculty, which is located nearby.

original: des na thag ring ba'i rna ba gang yin pa des mi dmigs pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: des na thag ring ba'i rna ba gang yin pa des mi dmigs pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus, the ear sense-faculty, which is located far away, does not perceive sound.

original: de'i dbye bas zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i bu ga'i rna ba tha dad pas so //
analyzed: de'i dbye bas zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i bu ga'i rna ba tha dad pas so //
translated: “By reason of its differentiation” means by reason of the differentiation of the ear sense-faculty located in the ear-cavities.

original: thos pa tha dad pa ni rtogs pa tha dad pa'o //🔽'on te ji ltar gzhan legs par @142a * //
analyzed: thos pa tha dad pa ni rtogs pa tha dad pa'o // 'on te ji ltar gzhan legs par @142a * //
translated: “The differentiation of hearing” means the differentiation of the perception of sound.

original: byas pa na gzhan mngon par gsal bar 'gyur zhe na /
