analyzed: byas pa na gzhan mngon par gsal bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But how can the ear sense-faculty, which is located nearby, manifest sound, since it is the ear sense-faculty, which is located far away, that perceives sound?

original: dper na sgron ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽ji ltar sgron ma la sogs pa mig la phan 'dogs par bum pa la sogs pa mngon par gsal bar byed par 'gyur ba de bzhin du sgra rna legs byas phyir te /
analyzed: dper na sgron ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / ji ltar sgron ma la sogs pa mig la phan 'dogs par bum pa la sogs pa mngon par gsal bar byed par 'gyur ba de bzhin du sgra rna legs byas phyir te /
translated: For example, like a lamp, etc.

original: rna ba legs par byed pa'i phyir sgra'i mngon par gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rna ba legs par byed pa'i phyir sgra'i mngon par gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as a lamp, etc., which benefits the eye, manifests a pot, etc., in the same way, the ear sense-faculty, which is well-formed, manifests sound, because it benefits the ear sense-faculty.

original: 'on te sgra tsam gyis rnam pa gang gis grub pa'i rna ba legs par byed ces bya ba 'di brjod par bya dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sgra tsam gyis rnam pa gang gis grub pa'i rna ba legs par byed ces bya ba 'di brjod par bya dgos so zhe na /
translated: Or else, it must be said by what mode of operation does the ear, which is established by mere sound, function well?

original: de'i phyir rnam pa gang gis zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa gang gis zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said by what mode of operation.

original: skye ba la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the same applies to arising.

original: brgal zhing brtag pa zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: brgal zhing brtag pa zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder is called the objection and examination.

original: sgra rang gi rgyu dag las skyes pa yang brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: sgra rang gi rgyu dag las skyes pa yang brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: The objection and examination are the same with respect to sound, which is produced from its own causes.

original: de la yang sgra dang rna ba rlung las byung ba'i ldan pa dang / rnam par dbye ba'i bdag nyid kyi sgra tsam gyi rnam pa gang gis sam /
analyzed: de la yang sgra dang rna ba rlung las byung ba'i ldan pa dang / rnam par dbye ba'i bdag nyid kyi sgra tsam gyi rnam pa gang gis sam /
translated: In that case, it can be said that sound and the ear are connected with the wind element, and by what mode of operation of mere sound, which has the nature of conjunction and separation,

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis ji ltar byed ces bya ba 'di yang brjod par nus pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis ji ltar byed ces bya ba 'di yang brjod par nus pa nyid yin no //
translated: or by another mode of operation, how does it function?

original: gang gi phyir de la yang nus pa ni dbang po las 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de la yang nus pa ni dbang po las 'das pa yin te /
translated: Because in that case also, the capacity is beyond the senses.

original: de la yang sgra rnams skyed par byed pa na ji ltar sgra'i rgyu skyed par byed pa'i nus pa dbang po las 'das pa yin pa de bzhin du mngon par gsal ba la yang yin pas brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs so //
analyzed: de la yang sgra rnams skyed par byed pa na ji ltar sgra'i rgyu skyed par byed pa'i nus pa dbang po las 'das pa yin pa de bzhin du mngon par gsal ba la yang yin pas brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs so //
translated: Moreover, when sounds are produced, just as the power to produce the sound is beyond the senses, so too is the manifestation. Therefore, the objection is the same.

original: gal te nus pa dbang po las 'das pa yin na ni ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nus pa dbang po las 'das pa yin na ni ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: If the power is beyond the senses, how is it understood?

original: nus pa rtag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽skyed par byed pa'i nus pa yin yang rung /
analyzed: nus pa rtag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / skyed par byed pa'i nus pa yin yang rung /
translated: He says, “The power is always . . . ”

original: mngon par gsal bar byed pa'i nus pa yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: mngon par gsal bar byed pa'i nus pa yin yang rung ste /
translated: Whether it is the power to produce or the power to manifest,

original: nus pa ji snyed pa de thams cad ni rnam pa thams cad du rtag tu 'bras bus rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nus pa ji snyed pa de thams cad ni rnam pa thams cad du rtag tu 'bras bus rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: whatever the power is, it is never at all inferred from the effect.

original: de lta bas na de ni brgal zhing brtag par 'os pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bas na de ni brgal zhing brtag par 'os pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is not proper to object.

original: gang las de go bar 'gyur ba 'bras bu de yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang las de go bar 'gyur ba 'bras bu de yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that effect from which it is understood?

original: de yod na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yod na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If it exists, etc.

original: de yod na ni sgra tsam yod na'o //
analyzed: de yod na ni sgra tsam yod na'o //
translated: If it exists, i.e., if the mere sound exists,

original: de yod pa ni sgra 'dzin pa gang yin pa de nyid de la ste sgra'i nus pa de la tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: de yod pa ni sgra 'dzin pa gang yin pa de nyid de la ste sgra'i nus pa de la tshad ma yin te /
translated: then that existence of the mere sound is a valid cognition in regard to that, i.e., in regard to the potency of the sound.

original: sgra 'dzin pa'i 'bras bus nus pa go bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgra 'dzin pa'i 'bras bus nus pa go bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the potency is understood through the result of the apprehension of the sound.

original: tsam smos pas ni skye ba sel to //
analyzed: tsam smos pas ni skye ba sel to //
translated: The mere is mentioned in order to exclude production.

original: des na zhes bya ba mjug sdud par byed de /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba mjug sdud par byed de /
translated: Therefore, etc. concludes.

original: de lta bas na sgra tsam 'di @142b dag ni dbang po las 'das pa'i nus pas rna ba'i dbang po'i nus pa dbang po las 'das pa skyed par byed pa na mngon par gsal ba'i rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bas na sgra tsam 'di @142b dag ni dbang po las 'das pa'i nus pas rna ba'i dbang po'i nus pa dbang po las 'das pa skyed par byed pa na mngon par gsal ba'i rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, this mere sound, when it produces the potency of the auditory sense faculty that is beyond the senses, becomes the cause of manifestation.

original: sgra rnams kyi zhes bya ba la ltos par bya'o //
analyzed: sgra rnams kyi zhes bya ba la ltos par bya'o //
translated: The words of the sound should be supplied.

original: yang na ci'i phyir sgra tsam skyed par byed pa'i rgyu nyid du shes par mi byed ce na /
analyzed: yang na ci'i phyir sgra tsam skyed par byed pa'i rgyu nyid du shes par mi byed ce na /
translated: Or else, why is it not understood that the mere sound is the cause of production?

original: gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, etc.

original: gang dag ni sangs rgyas pa rnams so //
analyzed: gang dag ni sangs rgyas pa rnams so //
translated: Those who are Buddhists.

original: rna bas sgra ma phrad pa dang skyes pa 'dzin te /
analyzed: rna bas sgra ma phrad pa dang skyes pa 'dzin te /
translated: The ear sense faculty seizes sound that is not in contact and that is arisen.

original: 'di ni ma phrad pa yang yin la skyes pa yang yin pas ma phrad pa dang skyes pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni ma phrad pa yang yin la skyes pa yang yin pas ma phrad pa dang skyes pa ste /
translated: It is not in contact and it is arisen.🔽The eye sense faculty, the nose sense faculty, the tongue sense faculty, the body sense faculty and the mental faculty do not grasp their object-field when they are separated from it.

original: mig dang ra ba dang yid rnams ni yul dang ma phrad pa dang / sgra rnams ni zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽de dag gi lugs kyis ring ba dang chod pa dang nye ba na gnas pa'i sgra rnams rna ba dang ma phrad par mtshungs pa'i phyir /

translated: Sound is the effect of the great elements that are the cause, either appropriated or non-appropriated.🔽According to the Vaibhāṣikas, sound is not in contact with the ear sense faculty, because sound is distant or obstructed or close.

original: nye ba dang ring ba na gnas pa'i skyes bu dag gis 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa mtshungs pa dag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye ba dang ring ba na gnas pa'i skyes bu dag gis 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa mtshungs pa dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If sound were to be in contact with the ear sense faculty, then sound that is distant or obstructed or close would be seized in the same way, because the ear sense faculty is not in contact with sound.

original: nye ba na gnas pas ci 'dra ba 'dzin pa de 'dra ba thag ring po na gnas pas kyang 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nye ba na gnas pas ci 'dra ba 'dzin pa de 'dra ba thag ring po na gnas pas kyang 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: Sound that is close is seized as it is; sound that is distant is also seized as it is.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //🔽gang zhig sngar ni nye ba na gnas pas 'dzin la phyis thag ring ba na gnas pas 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i rim gyis 'dzin par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro // gang zhig sngar ni nye ba na gnas pas 'dzin la phyis thag ring ba na gnas pas 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i rim gyis 'dzin par yang mi 'gyur ro //

original: thos pa smos pa ni rtog ge pa ma yin pa nyid du ston pa lhur len pa yin te /
analyzed: thos pa smos pa ni rtog ge pa ma yin pa nyid du ston pa lhur len pa yin te /
translated: The mention of “hearing” is intended to show that he is not a sophist.

original: 'dis kyang tshig gi zur gyis rang gi phyogs khyad par du 'phags par smras pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang tshig gi zur gyis rang gi phyogs khyad par du 'phags par smras pa yin no //
translated: And by this he also indirectly claims that his own position is superior.

original: rtog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is imagination?

original: 'bad rtsol zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'bad rtsol zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “Exertion, etc.”

original: 'bad rtsol ni rkan la sogs pa'i bye ba'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bad rtsol ni rkan la sogs pa'i bye ba'i bya ba'o //
translated: Exertion is the activity of the palate, etc.

original: de cug pas ni bskul ba'o //
analyzed: de cug pas ni bskul ba'o //
translated: It is “activated” by that.

original: @143a * // gsus pa na gnas pa'i rlung ni lte ba'i phyogs nas langs nas brang du rgyas te /
analyzed: @143a * // gsus pa na gnas pa'i rlung ni lte ba'i phyogs nas langs nas brang du rgyas te /
translated: The wind that resides in the belly rises from the navel region, expands in the chest,

original: mgrin par bsdus nas spyi bor bsdoms nas kha nas rgyus te 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: mgrin par bsdus nas spyi bor bsdoms nas kha nas rgyus te 'gro bar byed do //
translated: is collected in the throat, and is compressed in the head. It is expelled through the mouth.

original: 'di nyid ston pa ni de ni rkan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ston pa ni de ni rkan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is what is being taught: “The palate, etc.”

original: rlung de 'byung ba na rkan la sogs pa'i pa'i ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba ston cing 'gro ba na yang de nam mkha' ji srid par mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: rlung de 'byung ba na rkan la sogs pa'i pa'i ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba ston cing 'gro ba na yang de nam mkha' ji srid par mi 'gro'o //
translated: When that wind arises, it shows the conjunction and separation of the palate, etc. When it goes, it does not go as far as the sky.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what does it do?

original: shugs ji srid du'o //
analyzed: shugs ji srid du'o //
translated: for as long as the impetus lasts.

original: de ni shugs ji srid du de dang rjes su mthun pa nyid du 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni shugs ji srid du de dang rjes su mthun pa nyid du 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the expression “as long as the impetus lasts” is: as long as the sound continues to be in conformity with the original sound.

original: ga las she na /
analyzed: ga las she na /
translated: Why is this?

original: shugs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shugs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the sound is endowed with a certain impetus.

original: rlung 'gro ba de yang bdag nyid kyi yan lag rnams dang brten pa'i rlung ste mi 'gyur ba'i rlung gis gdon mi za ba dang ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rlung 'gro ba de yang bdag nyid kyi yan lag rnams dang brten pa'i rlung ste mi 'gyur ba'i rlung gis gdon mi za ba dang ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: This movement of the sound is due to the wind that is in the sound and to the wind that is in the body, i.e., the wind that is the support of the sound.

original: de yang rna ba'i bu gar phyin nas rna ba la nus pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de yang rna ba'i bu gar phyin nas rna ba la nus pa skyed par byed do //
translated: This wind, in turn, reaches the ear and produces the capacity in the ear.

original: de yod pa nas de rlung las byung ba'i bden pa yod pa na sgra rtogs pa'i phyir sgra'i legs par byas pa mi snang bar 'dod de /
analyzed: de yod pa nas de rlung las byung ba'i bden pa yod pa na sgra rtogs pa'i phyir sgra'i legs par byas pa mi snang bar 'dod de /
translated: Since the sound exists as long as the capacity exists, the sound is not perceived after the capacity has arisen from the wind.

original: dper na sgra sgra gzhan dag gis sam /
analyzed: dper na sgra sgra gzhan dag gis sam /
translated: For example, you accept that a sound is produced by another sound or by a mere sound,🔽even though you do not see that a sound is produced by a sound.

original: sgra tsam gyis skyed par ma mthong yang khyed cag 'dod pa de bzhin du legs par byas pa yang yin te /
analyzed: sgra tsam gyis skyed par ma mthong yang khyed cag 'dod pa de bzhin du legs par byas pa yang yin te /
translated: In the same way, the sound is produced by the capacity.

original: ji skad du bshad pa las rtsol bas bskul ba'i rlung rnams brten pa'i rlung gzhan gnod pa na phyogs thams cad du ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba skyed par byed cing shugs ji srid du gnas te /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa las rtsol bas bskul ba'i rlung rnams brten pa'i rlung gzhan gnod pa na phyogs thams cad du ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba skyed par byed cing shugs ji srid du gnas te /
translated: As it is said, when the winds that are impelled by effort harm the other winds that are their supports, they generate conjunction and disjunction in all directions, and they remain for as long as their force lasts.

original: rlung de dag kyang mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba mi dmigs /
analyzed: rlung de dag kyang mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba mi dmigs /
translated: Since those winds are not directly perceptible, their conjunction and disjunction are not perceived.

original: de dag mi 'jigs pa na sgra dmigs la /
analyzed: de dag mi 'jigs pa na sgra dmigs la /
translated: When they are not destroyed, sound is perceived.

original: de dag 'jig na ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag 'jig na ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: When they are destroyed, it is not.

original: 'on te de lta na skye ba'i phyogs las legs par byas pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par brjod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de lta na skye ba'i phyogs las legs par byas pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par brjod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if that is so, then the special quality of the side of good action would be stated in the section on birth.

original: de khyad par yod na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de khyad par yod na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If there is a difference in that, it is said that even then, etc.

original: de'i khyad par ni legs par bya ba'i khyad par de sgra 'dzin pa'i khyad par las rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i khyad par ni legs par bya ba'i khyad par de sgra 'dzin pa'i khyad par las rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The difference in that is the difference in good action. That is understood from the difference in the apprehension of sound.

original: de'i phyir nye ba dang ring ba na gnas pa rnams kyis 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa mtshungs pa dag tu mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nye ba dang ring ba na gnas pa rnams kyis 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa mtshungs pa dag tu mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, those who are near and those who are far away would not be similar in apprehending or not apprehending sound.

original: skyes bu tha dad pas legs par bya ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu tha dad pas legs par bya ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the actions of different people are different.

original: ji ltar rtsig pa la sogs pas bsgribs pa ni sgra mi 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rtsig pa la sogs pas bsgribs pa ni sgra mi 'dzin zhe na /
translated: If you ask, “Why is sound not apprehended when it is obstructed by a wall, etc.?”

original: rtsig pa la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs @143b pa smos te /
analyzed: rtsig pa la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs @143b pa smos te /
translated: The root text states, “Sound is not obstructed by walls, etc.”

original: gal te yang sgra thogs pa med pa de lta na yang rlung dang rtsig pa las can yin pa na thog pa'i phyir rna ba'i yul mi 'ong bas rna ba la sogs par byas pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yang sgra thogs pa med pa de lta na yang rlung dang rtsig pa las can yin pa na thog pa'i phyir rna ba'i yul mi 'ong bas rna ba la sogs par byas pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though sound is unimpeded, it is obstructed by the wind and walls, etc., because it is a tangible object. Therefore, sound does not reach the ear, and the ear does not come into contact with the sound.

original: des na bsgribs pa thos pa mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na bsgribs pa thos pa mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, sound that is obstructed is not heard.

original: gang dag gi ltar na ma phrad pa 'dzin pa de dag gi ltar na yang skyon 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang dag gi ltar na ma phrad pa 'dzin pa de dag gi ltar na yang skyon 'di nyid yin no //
translated: If sound is apprehended without contact, then this error would also occur in the system of those who maintain that sound is apprehended without contact.

original: 'o na ji ltar ches dang ches cher gsal ba dang dman par thos pa tha dad par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar ches dang ches cher gsal ba dang dman par thos pa tha dad par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you ask, “Why is there a difference in the loudness and softness of sound that is heard?”

original: gsal bar 'jug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gsal bar 'jug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The term “clearly entering” and so on is stated.

original: thams cad du 'thad pa nyid yin no skabs dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du 'thad pa nyid yin no skabs dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It is reasonable in all cases, but it should be applied according to the context.

original: 'jig pa shugs kyi bye brag ces bya ba ni 'jig pa'i bye brag dang shugs kyi bye brag rigs pa dag yin no zhes rnam par dbye ba bsgyur la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa shugs kyi bye brag ces bya ba ni 'jig pa'i bye brag dang shugs kyi bye brag rigs pa dag yin no zhes rnam par dbye ba bsgyur la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The term “destruction and wind” should be analyzed as “destruction is a particular type of wind” and “wind is a particular type of destruction.”

original: yang na de dag ni 'jig pa yang yin la shugs kyi bye brag kyang yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na de dag ni 'jig pa yang yin la shugs kyi bye brag kyang yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Or, they are both destruction and a particular type of wind.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na 'jig pa dang shugs kyi bye brag can gyi rlung zhes 'bru mang po pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na 'jig pa dang shugs kyi bye brag can gyi rlung zhes 'bru mang po pa'o //
translated: In one sense, it is a wind that has the characteristics of destruction and a particular type of wind.

original: de lta yin dang legs par byas pa'i rim pa gsal ba dang zhen pa la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid 'thad pa yin no zhes sbrel bar bya'o //🔽de'i legs par byas pa'i rim pa 'thad pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang legs par byas pa'i rim pa gsal ba dang zhen pa la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid 'thad pa yin no zhes sbrel bar bya'o // de'i legs par byas pa'i rim pa 'thad pa yin te /
translated: Thus, it is reasonable that the sequence of good actions is clear, firm, and so on.

original: rlung rim gyis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung rim gyis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sequence of good actions is reasonable because the wind enters gradually.

original: gsal ba nyid kyang 'thad pa yin te ;
analyzed: gsal ba nyid kyang 'thad pa yin te ;
translated: It is also tenable that it is clear,

original: shugs kyi bye brag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shugs kyi bye brag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it possesses a particular potency.

original: dman pa yang yin te 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dman pa yang yin te 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is inferior because it is perishable.

original: sogs pa'i sgra gong nas gong gi khyad par yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra gong nas gong gi khyad par yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The words “and so on” should be applied to the other qualities as well.

original: 'thad de // nam mkha' rna ba yin phyogs la //
analyzed: 'thad de // nam mkha' rna ba yin phyogs la //
translated: It is tenable that it is a sense faculty,🔽because it pervades space,

original: khyab phyir ring na gnas na yang //
analyzed: khyab phyir ring na gnas na yang //
translated: and because it is located far away.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas rna ba legs par byas pa la skyon mang po dag sngar bstan pa ma yin na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas rna ba legs par byas pa la skyon mang po dag sngar bstan pa ma yin na /
translated: If the ear is well formed, as explained above, then it has many faults.

original: de ji ltar bshad pa byed pas lan smras pa /
analyzed: de ji ltar bshad pa byed pas lan smras pa /
translated: How does the opponent respond to this?

original: rna ba legs par byas pa yin //
analyzed: rna ba legs par byas pa yin //
translated: The ear is well formed.

original: zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: zhes brjod ce na /
translated: If you say this,

original: gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then the opponent says, “Undoubtedly, etc.”

original: des na de khas ma blangs pa nyid kyi phyir de'i phyogs la yod pa'i skyon 'jug pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: des na de khas ma blangs pa nyid kyi phyir de'i phyogs la yod pa'i skyon 'jug pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, since he does not accept that the ear is well formed, the faults that apply to that position do not apply to him.

original: nam mkha' cha shas med min te //
analyzed: nam mkha' cha shas med min te //
translated: He says, “Space is not partless,

original: zhes bya ba khas len par byed pa zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba khas len par byed pa zhes 'brel to //
translated: and he accepts that it is a sense faculty.”

original: ga las she na /🔽rgyal ba grangs can gyis bkag phyir //
analyzed: ga las she na / rgyal ba grangs can gyis bkag phyir //
translated: Why?🔽Because the Jains and the Sāṃkhyas refute it.

original: rgyal ba pa ste mchod 'os pa rnams dang / grangs pa can pa rnams kyis /🔽nam mkha' @144a * //🔽cha shas med pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyal ba pa ste mchod 'os pa rnams dang / grangs pa can pa rnams kyis / nam mkha' @144a * // cha shas med pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Jains and the Sāṃkhyas refute space.

original: spyod pa rnams kyis ni gzhan gyi grub mtha' la grags pa tha snyad du byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: spyod pa rnams kyis ni gzhan gyi grub mtha' la grags pa tha snyad du byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The Lokāyatas do not use what is renowned in other philosophical systems as conventions,

original: rigs pas ma grub pa gang yin pa de dag ni khas len par mi byed de /
analyzed: rigs pas ma grub pa gang yin pa de dag ni khas len par mi byed de /
translated: because they do not accept what is not established by reasoning.

original: de lta ma yin dang rgyal ba dang grangs can la grags pa'i rna ba nam mkha'i bdag nyid du khas len pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: de lta ma yin dang rgyal ba dang grangs can la grags pa'i rna ba nam mkha'i bdag nyid du khas len pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: Otherwise, they would accept the ear, which is renowned to the Jains and the Sāṃkhyas as having the nature of space.

original: yang na dngos po gzhan du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rna 'brug gi ming can no //🔽'bras bu don gyi rtogs bya ba //
analyzed: yang na dngos po gzhan du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rna 'brug gi ming can no // 'bras bu don gyi rtogs bya ba //
translated: Or, “it transforms into another thing” is the name of the frog.

original: zhes bya ba ni sgra 'dzin pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas go bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sgra 'dzin pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas go bar bya'o //
translated: “The object of the result is understood” should be understood as “it is not tenable that sound is apprehended by another.”

original: de lta ma yin na spyod pa pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na spyod pa pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the Lokāyatas themselves would be undermined.

original: yang na cha med pa'i nam mkha' rna ba yin pa'i phyogs la yang nyes pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na cha med pa'i nam mkha' rna ba yin pa'i phyogs la yang nyes pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, in the case of the position that the partless space is the ear, there is no fault.

original: gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says:🔽“If it is the same as the all-pervading, etc.”

original: gal te yang khyab pa nyid dang gcig nyid ces bya ba ni rna ba zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gal te yang khyab pa nyid dang gcig nyid ces bya ba ni rna ba zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: “The same as the all-pervading” is a remainder of “the all-pervading one.”

original: de lta na yang skyes su gang gi sgra tsam dag gi rten la ste rna 'brug la legs par byas pa de yin par 'gyur ba de nyid sgra rtogs par byed kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang skyes su gang gi sgra tsam dag gi rten la ste rna 'brug la legs par byas pa de yin par 'gyur ba de nyid sgra rtogs par byed kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Even so, the ear is the support of the mere sound-class, and it is well-formed. That is the one that causes the understanding of sound, not another.

original: 'dis ni rten legs par byas pa nyid brjod kyi rna ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni rten legs par byas pa nyid brjod kyi rna ba ni ma yin te /
translated: This expresses the well-formedness of the support, not the ear.

original: rten de yang skyes bu so so la tha dad pa'i phyir ji slad du bshad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: rten de yang skyes bu so so la tha dad pa'i phyir ji slad du bshad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: And that support is different for each person. Therefore, the fault stated will not ensue.

original: rna ba legs par byed pa yin na yang nyes pa med do zhe ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: rna ba legs par byed pa yin na yang nyes pa med do zhe ston par byed pa ni /
translated: Even if the ear is well-formed, there is no fault. To demonstrate this, he says:

original: ci ste yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci ste yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “If it is the same as the all-pervading, etc.”

original: rten ni rna 'brug ste de legs par byas pa'i sgo nas rna ba legs par byas pa yin gyi 'ba' zhig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rten ni rna 'brug ste de legs par byas pa'i sgo nas rna ba legs par byas pa yin gyi 'ba' zhig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The support is the ear, which is well formed in the sense that the ear is well formed, not just the ear alone.

original: des na rten legs par ma byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na rten legs par ma byas pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the support is not well formed,

original: 'on pa dang thag ring po na gnas pa dang / sems spangs pa dang / gnyid log pa dang / brgyal ba rnams kyi rna bas ma thos te /
analyzed: 'on pa dang thag ring po na gnas pa dang / sems spangs pa dang / gnyid log pa dang / brgyal ba rnams kyi rna bas ma thos te /
translated: the deaf, those who are far away, those who are distracted, those who are asleep, and those who are unconscious do not hear with their ears.

original: rna khung legs par ma bya spa gang la yod de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rna khung legs par ma bya spa gang la yod de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is why it is said that the ear is not well formed in those who have no ear holes or who have them poorly formed.

original: rten gyi ngo bo la zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'i don la ta si'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: rten gyi ngo bo la zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'i don la ta si'i rkyen yin no //
translated: The phrase “in the nature of the support” is a tatpurusa compound.

original: gal te sgra tsam dag gi rten nam /
analyzed: gal te sgra tsam dag gi rten nam /
translated: If the ear is the support of sound or

original: de'i yul gyi dbang po legs par byas pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de'i yul gyi dbang po legs par byas pa ma yin nam /
translated: if the organ that is its object is well formed,

original: ci'i phyir gang rung bar dmigs pa yod pa na srog chags kyi tshogs thams cad kyi dbang po rten legs par byed par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gang rung bar dmigs pa yod pa na srog chags kyi tshogs thams cad kyi dbang po rten legs par byed par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: why is it that when sound is present, the organ of every living being is not well formed?

original: rna ba'i yul du phyin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rna ba'i yul du phyin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because sound reaches the ear.

original: zhes bya ba la @144b sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la @144b sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: gal te yang sgra tsam rten legs par byed dam /
analyzed: gal te yang sgra tsam rten legs par byed dam /
translated: If sound is produced in dependence on a good organ,

original: de'i yul du dbang po legs par byed kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de'i yul du dbang po legs par byed kyang rung ste /
translated: or if the object is produced in dependence on a good organ,

original: de lta na yang phrad pa nyid yin pa na legs par byed pa'i rten gyi dngos po la lags par byed pa yin gyi ma phrad pa la ni ma yin pa'i phyir skyes bu thams cad kyi rten la sogs pa'i legs par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang phrad pa nyid yin pa na legs par byed pa'i rten gyi dngos po la lags par byed pa yin gyi ma phrad pa la ni ma yin pa'i phyir skyes bu thams cad kyi rten la sogs pa'i legs par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: then sound is produced in dependence on a good organ, but it is not produced in dependence on the good organ of all persons, because it is produced in dependence on the thing that is the support of the organ, and it is not produced in dependence on that which is not the support.

original: rna ba legs par byed pa smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: rna ba legs par byed pa smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: The phrase “the ear is produced in dependence on a good organ” is an example.

original: rten legs par byed pa yang mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: rten legs par byed pa yang mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: The organ is also produced in dependence on a good support.

original: kha cig tu yang na rna bar ma phyin pa'i zhes 'dod pa der ni rten legs par byed pa'i sgo nas rna ba legs par byed pa la brten nas lan sngar bshad zin la /
analyzed: kha cig tu yang na rna bar ma phyin pa'i zhes 'dod pa der ni rten legs par byed pa'i sgo nas rna ba legs par byed pa la brten nas lan sngar bshad zin la /
translated: In some places, it is asserted that “sound is not heard when the ear is not produced.” In that case, the response has already been given above, that sound is heard in dependence on the ear that is produced in dependence on a good organ.

original: da ni rten legs par byed pa'i sgo nas rna ba legs par byed par ma gyur mod /
analyzed: da ni rten legs par byed pa'i sgo nas rna ba legs par byed par ma gyur mod /
translated: Now, sound is not heard in dependence on the ear that is not produced in dependence on a good organ.

original: de lta na yang nyes pa med de /
analyzed: de lta na yang nyes pa med de /
translated: Still, there is no fault.

original: 'di ltar rlung rna 'brug gi rtsa bar phyin pa rna ba legs par bya bar nus kyi ma phyin pa ni ma yin pas de'i phyir phyogs gzhan brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rlung rna 'brug gi rtsa bar phyin pa rna ba legs par bya bar nus kyi ma phyin pa ni ma yin pas de'i phyir phyogs gzhan brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when the wind reaches the nāḍī of the ear, it is able to make the ear well, but when it does not reach it, it does not. Therefore, the other position is stated.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni 'jug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni 'jug sdud pa'o //
translated: “ Thus” refers to the inclusion of the entry.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ma thag tu brjod pa'i phyogs gsum char la yang gzhan gyis klan ka dogs par byed de /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ma thag tu brjod pa'i phyogs gsum char la yang gzhan gyis klan ka dogs par byed de /
translated: The opponent raises an objection to all three positions just stated, beginning with “If that is so.”

original: rna ba gcig la legs par byas pa dang / legs par ma byas pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos gnyis mi rung ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: rna ba gcig la legs par byas pa dang / legs par ma byas pa phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos gnyis mi rung ba'i phyir ;
translated: Because it is not possible for two mutually exclusive qualities, well made and not well made, to exist in one ear.

original: gcig la legs par byas pas tha mi dad pa'i phyir lus thams cad la legs par byas pa nyid yin pas dbang po gcig tu smra ba la 'on pa la sogs pa'i rna ba yang rtogs par byed par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gcig la legs par byas pas tha mi dad pa'i phyir lus thams cad la legs par byas pa nyid yin pas dbang po gcig tu smra ba la 'on pa la sogs pa'i rna ba yang rtogs par byed par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Because the entire body is well made by the well-made ear, which is not different from it, the one sense faculty theory would have to be understood as the ears of the deaf and so on.

original: de lta yin dang 'on pa la sogs par rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'on pa la sogs par rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then it would not be possible to posit that the deaf, etc.

original: skyes bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: skyes bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: The reply is given by the verse, “The person, etc.”

original: skyes bu ni bdag ste thams cad du song ba yin na yang chos dang chos ma yin pas yongs su gzung ba'i lus nyid la shes pa skyed par spyod pa pa dag gis 'dod do //
analyzed: skyes bu ni bdag ste thams cad du song ba yin na yang chos dang chos ma yin pas yongs su gzung ba'i lus nyid la shes pa skyed par spyod pa pa dag gis 'dod do //
translated: The person is the self. Although it pervades everything, the Lokayatikas believe that it produces consciousness in the body alone, which is grasped by virtue and vice.

original: des na / gtso bo lus yul gzhan phyir te //
analyzed: des na / gtso bo lus yul gzhan phyir te //
translated: Therefore, “the primary body is the object of sound.”

original: yul tha dad pa'i phyir thams cad du song ba'i rna ba yang legs par byed par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: yul tha dad pa'i phyir thams cad du song ba'i rna ba yang legs par byed par mi 'thad do //
translated: Since the object is different, it is not tenable that the ear pervades everything and that it functions well.

original: des na ji skad du bshad pa'i nyes pa'i go skabs med do //
analyzed: des na ji skad du bshad pa'i nyes pa'i go skabs med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no opportunity for the previously mentioned faults.

original: kha cig tu /🔽legs byas de 'dri 'thad pa yin //
analyzed: kha cig tu / legs byas de 'dri 'thad pa yin //
translated: In some places,🔽it is tenable that the self is the object of sound.

original: zhes 'dod pa der ni legs byas de zhes 'brel to //🔽'on te bdag thams cad @145a * //
analyzed: zhes 'dod pa der ni legs byas de zhes 'brel to // 'on te bdag thams cad @145a * //
translated: The meaning is that the self is the object of sound.

original: du song ba'i phyir sgra thams cad du 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ba mi bzlog pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: du song ba'i phyir sgra thams cad du 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ba mi bzlog pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn’t it the case that the consequence that all sounds are apprehended because the self pervades everything cannot be avoided?

original: bdag las phyogs gcig med ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bdag las phyogs gcig med ces bya ba smos te /
translated: The response to that is, “There is no part of the self that is not from itself.”

original: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the explanation:

original: gal te de ltar yin pa de lta na yang chos la sogs pas dang 'du byas pa'i lus la brten pa'i bdag sgra 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin pa de lta na yang chos la sogs pas dang 'du byas pa'i lus la brten pa'i bdag sgra 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: Even if that were so, the self that is based on the body that is composed of the elements and so on would be the apprehender of sound.

original: des na skyon med do //
analyzed: des na skyon med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault.

original: yang na ci ltar tha mi dad pa'i bdag dang rna ba la 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa dang legs par byas pa dang legs par ma byas pa'i cha yod ce na ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na ci ltar tha mi dad pa'i bdag dang rna ba la 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa dang legs par byas pa dang legs par ma byas pa'i cha yod ce na ma yin te /
translated: Or else, how could the self, which is not different from the ear, have a part that apprehends and a part that does not apprehend, and a part that is well-formed and a part that is not well-formed?

original: dper na nam mkha' cha shas med pa yin na yang ldan pa can gyi dngos po tha dad pa'i phyir bum pa'i nam mkha' chol zangs kyi nan mkha' zhes tha dad pa de bzhin du 'di la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' cha shas med pa yin na yang ldan pa can gyi dngos po tha dad pa'i phyir bum pa'i nam mkha' chol zangs kyi nan mkha' zhes tha dad pa de bzhin du 'di la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, even though space is partless, because the entities that possess it are different, the space of a vase is different from the space of a copper pot.

original: de nyid kyi phyir spyir khyad pa dang cha shad med pa'i rna ba ldan pa can tha dad pa'i phyir 'on pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'dzog pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir spyir khyad pa dang cha shad med pa'i rna ba ldan pa can tha dad pa'i phyir 'on pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'dzog pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: Therefore, in general, the ear is different from the one who possesses it, and is without a whole and parts. Thus, it is shown that the ear is grasped as different from the one who possesses it.

original: gtan tshigs 'di dag ces bya ba la sgos pa smos te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di dag ces bya ba la sgos pa smos te /
translated: The phrase “because of these reasons” is a general statement.

original: 'di dag nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni ldan pa can tha dad pa'i gtan tshigs kyis so //
analyzed: 'di dag nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni ldan pa can tha dad pa'i gtan tshigs kyis so //
translated: The phrase “because of these very reasons” refers to the reason that the one who possesses the ear is different.

original: gal te ldan pa can tha dad pa de lta na yang ci'i phyir 'ga' zhig kho na 'on par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ldan pa can tha dad pa de lta na yang ci'i phyir 'ga' zhig kho na 'on par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Even if the one who possesses the ear is different, why is it that only some are deaf?

original: chos dang chos min zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: chos dang chos min zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text states, “because of dharma and non-dharma.”

original: rna ba de nyid skyes bu gzhan gyi longs spyad pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: rna ba de nyid skyes bu gzhan gyi longs spyad pa can ma yin no //
translated: That very ear does not belong to another person.

original: ga las she na chos dang chos ma yin pa dag gis dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ga las she na chos dang chos ma yin pa dag gis dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is that? Because it is governed by dharma and non-dharma.

original: 'di nyid dpe'i sgo nas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid dpe'i sgo nas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to make this point clear through an example, the root text states,

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “Just as . . .”

original: dper na grong la sogs pa rje bo 'ga' zhig grong la sogs pa der gnas te 'dug na yang rgyal pos dbang phral te phrogs pa ni grong de nyid du longs spyod mi rnyed pa de bzhin du gzhan la ste /
analyzed: dper na grong la sogs pa rje bo 'ga' zhig grong la sogs pa der gnas te 'dug na yang rgyal pos dbang phral te phrogs pa ni grong de nyid du longs spyod mi rnyed pa de bzhin du gzhan la ste /
translated: For example, even though a lord of a town and so on resides in that town and so on, he is deprived of his enjoyment of that town and so on if he is deprived of his power by the king.

original: skyes bu gzhan la thos kyang 'on pas thos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu gzhan la thos kyang 'on pas thos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, even though one hears from another, the deaf do not hear.

original: 'on te rna ba dang sgra dang nam mkha' gsum char cha shas med pa'i phyir dang / khyab pa'i phyir phyogs gcig 'jug pa med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te rna ba dang sgra dang nam mkha' gsum char cha shas med pa'i phyir dang / khyab pa'i phyir phyogs gcig 'jug pa med pa ma yin nam /
translated: But if the three—the ear, sound, and space—are not engaged in one part because they are all-pervading and partless,

original: de ci ltar phyogs gcig tu 'jug pa nyid kyi 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i nges pa'i rnam par byed pa rnyed par 'gyur zhe na /🔽rna ba sgra dang rten dag gi zhes bya ba la sgos pa smos te /🔽rna ba dang sgra dang sgra'i nam mkha' ste rten zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ci ltar phyogs gcig tu 'jug pa nyid kyi 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i nges pa'i rnam par byed pa rnyed par 'gyur zhe na / rna ba sgra dang rten dag gi zhes bya ba la sgos pa smos te / rna ba dang sgra dang sgra'i nam mkha' ste rten zhes bya ba ni /
translated: how can they be apprehended as having a definite form of engagement in one part or non-engagement in another?🔽The ear, sound, and the space that is their basis,🔽the ear, sound, and the space of sound that is their basis,

original: rna ba sgra dang rten dag go //
analyzed: rna ba sgra dang rten dag go //
translated: the ear, sound, and the space that is their basis,

original: cha @145b shas nyid kyi yod min zhes bya ba ni ldan pa can tha dad pa'i phyir nye bar btags nas ni yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rang nyid kyis zhes bshad do //
analyzed: cha @145b shas nyid kyi yod min zhes bya ba ni ldan pa can tha dad pa'i phyir nye bar btags nas ni yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rang nyid kyis zhes bshad do //
translated: “Nor is it in the parts themselves” means that it is imputed in dependence on the different possessors of the parts, and therefore it is said that it does not exist by itself.

original: de ltar 'di la zhes bya ba ni phyogs gcig tu 'jug pa nyid kyis nges par 'dzin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'di la zhes bya ba ni phyogs gcig tu 'jug pa nyid kyis nges par 'dzin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Thus, in this case” means that it is ascertained by the application of the term to a part.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gsal bar byed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “The manifestation of the sound,” etc.

original: cha shas dang yul tha dad pa rten gyi ming can gyi rna 'brug ste /
analyzed: cha shas dang yul tha dad pa rten gyi ming can gyi rna 'brug ste /
translated: The sound is called “having a different part and a different place” because it is based on the different collections of causes, such as the palate.

original: de gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Those that have that are called that.

original: de'i dngos po ni cha shas dang yul tha dad pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni cha shas dang yul tha dad pa nyid do //
translated: Its nature is the difference of the parts and the place.

original: rigs kyang tha dad ces bya ba ni rkan la sogs pa rgyu'i tshogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs kyang tha dad ces bya ba ni rkan la sogs pa rgyu'i tshogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “The type is also different” because the collections of causes, such as the palate, are different.🔽Also, it is said:

original: gang yang / rna ba lan cig legs byas na //
analyzed: gang yang / rna ba lan cig legs byas na //
translated: Having once well-trained the ear,

original: sgra rnams thams cad rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: sgra rnams thams cad rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: one will understand all sounds.

original: zhes bya ba 'di la lan bshad pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la lan bshad pa ni /
translated: The answer to this is as follows:

original: gzhan gyi don du bskul ba'i rlung //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du bskul ba'i rlung //
translated: The wind that impels for the sake of another

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: gzhan gyi don du zhes bya ba ni yi ge gzhan grub par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du zhes bya ba ni yi ge gzhan grub par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: For the sake of another means for the sake of establishing another letter.

original: yi ge gzhan legs byed nus pa //🔽zhes bya ba ni yi ge gzhan rtogs par bya ba'i don du gang zhig rna ba'i 'du byed pa la yi ge gzhan legs par byed pa'i sgras brjod kyi /
analyzed: yi ge gzhan legs byed nus pa // zhes bya ba ni yi ge gzhan rtogs par bya ba'i don du gang zhig rna ba'i 'du byed pa la yi ge gzhan legs par byed pa'i sgras brjod kyi /
translated: The ability to form another letter

original: yi ge legs par byed pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yi ge legs par byed pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: means that for the sake of understanding another letter, the wind that forms another letter is expressed by the verbal root kar, but not the formation of the letter itself.

original: rna ba legs par byed pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rna ba legs par byed pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the context is the formation of the ear.

original: gzhan mi byed ces bya ba de ni rna ba la legs par byed pa'i sgo nas yi ge gzhan byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan mi byed ces bya ba de ni rna ba la legs par byed pa'i sgo nas yi ge gzhan byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Not forming another means that the wind does not form another letter by forming the ear.

original: yang ci'i phyir rlung kho na la nges pa 'di yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir rlung kho na la nges pa 'di yin zhe na /
translated: Why is this ascertainment only in regard to wind?

original: rkan la sogs zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rkan la sogs zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text states, “The palate and so on.”

original: rkan la sogs pa'i ldan pa tha dad pa'i phyir gsal bar byed pa'i rlung gi sgra can tha dad pa yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rkan la sogs pa'i ldan pa tha dad pa'i phyir gsal bar byed pa'i rlung gi sgra can tha dad pa yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: because of the difference in the conjunctions of the palate, etc., the sound of the air that causes the manifestation is different.

original: yi ge gzhan min zhes bya ba ni byed pa zhes bya ba kha bskang ngo //
analyzed: yi ge gzhan min zhes bya ba ni byed pa zhes bya ba kha bskang ngo //
translated: “The other letters are not different” means that the word “production” is to be supplied.

original: sgra tsam gzhan 'phan pa ni bskul ba ste /
analyzed: sgra tsam gzhan 'phan pa ni bskul ba ste /
translated: The mere sound of another is the stimulus.

original: sgra tsam gzhan byed pa ste rkan la sogs pa'i ldan pa dang gzhi mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra tsam gzhan byed pa ste rkan la sogs pa'i ldan pa dang gzhi mthun pa yin no //
translated: The mere sound of another is the production, the common locus of the conjunction of the palate, etc.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: “Therefore” is the conclusion.

original: skyed dang gsal ba zhes pa ni bdun pa'i mtha' can te /
analyzed: skyed dang gsal ba zhes pa ni bdun pa'i mtha' can te /
translated: “Production and manifestation” has the seventh case ending.

original: sgra'i skye ba dang mngon par gsal ba la 'bad rtsol dang brjod par 'dod pa'i nus pa tha dad par mtshungs so //
analyzed: sgra'i skye ba dang mngon par gsal ba la 'bad rtsol dang brjod par 'dod pa'i nus pa tha dad par mtshungs so //
translated: The effort and the desire to express are similar in the production and manifestation of sound.

original: ga las she na /
analyzed: ga las she na /
translated: Why?

original: 'bras bu gzhan du mi 'thad pas go bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan du mi 'thad pas go bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the object to be understood is not tenable as another effect.

original: gnyis ka la yang 'bras bu don gyis go ba'i bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnyis ka la yang 'bras bu don gyis go ba'i bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In both cases, the meaning is that the result is endowed with the activity that is understood by implication.

original: de ltar re zhig go @146a * //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig go @146a * //
translated: Thus, first,

original: rims bzhin du grub pa'i mtha' gzhan gyis rtogs pa dang / rang gi grub pa'i mtha' rtogs pa rna 'brug gi mtshan nyid can gyi nam mkha'i rna bar khas blangs nas de legs par byed pa'i sgo nas sgra mngon par gsal ba la skyon med do zhes bstan nas //
analyzed: rims bzhin du grub pa'i mtha' gzhan gyis rtogs pa dang / rang gi grub pa'i mtha' rtogs pa rna 'brug gi mtshan nyid can gyi nam mkha'i rna bar khas blangs nas de legs par byed pa'i sgo nas sgra mngon par gsal ba la skyon med do zhes bstan nas //
translated: in accordance with the order, having accepted the ear of space that has the characteristic of a cloud, which is understood by the tenets of others and understood by one's own tenets, the fault in the manifestation of sound through the proper functioning of that is faultless.

original: da ni rig byed la grags pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid can gyi rna ba la brten nas de legs par byed pa'i bye brag gis sgra mngon par gsal ba la skyon med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rig byed la grags pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid can gyi rna ba la brten nas de legs par byed pa'i bye brag gis sgra mngon par gsal ba la skyon med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the faultlessness of the manifestation of sound through the particular proper functioning of the ear that has the characteristic of a direction renowned in the Vedas,

original: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says alternatively, and so on.

original: rna ba phyogs su zhes bya ba ni phyogs nyid rna ba yin no zhes bya ba de ltar phyogs rna ba nyid du nges par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rna ba phyogs su zhes bya ba ni phyogs nyid rna ba yin no zhes bya ba de ltar phyogs rna ba nyid du nges par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The ear is in the direction means that the direction itself is the ear. The meaning is that the direction should be ascertained as being the ear.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rna ba nam mkha'i zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rna ba nam mkha'i zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The ear is in the sky.

original: gal te de lta na rna ba phyogs yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu yang rig byed las ma bshad de /
analyzed: gal te de lta na rna ba phyogs yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu yang rig byed las ma bshad de /
translated: If that is so, then the ear is in the direction is not stated in the Vedas.

original: de ji ltar rnyed ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar rnyed ce na /
translated: How is that known?

original: rna ba phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rna ba phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The ear is in the direction and so on is stated.

original: bra rang bzhin de rang gi ngo bo nyid la thim pa ni 'jig pa ste /
analyzed: bra rang bzhin de rang gi ngo bo nyid la thim pa ni 'jig pa ste /
translated: The dissolution of the nature of the ear into its own nature is destruction.

original: 'jig pa'i dus na srog chags rnams kyi mig la sogs pa rang rang gi rang bzhin la thim par 'gyur bar grags so //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i dus na srog chags rnams kyi mig la sogs pa rang rang gi rang bzhin la thim par 'gyur bar grags so //
translated: At the time of destruction, the eyes and so on of living beings dissolve into their own nature.

original: de la 'jig pa na phyugs kyi dbang du byas nas rig byed las 'di'i mig nyi ma la 'gro la rna ba phyogs la'o zhes bshad pa de 'dir yang 'gro'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de la 'jig pa na phyugs kyi dbang du byas nas rig byed las 'di'i mig nyi ma la 'gro la rna ba phyogs la'o zhes bshad pa de 'dir yang 'gro'o zhes bshad do //
translated: In that regard, at the time of destruction, the Vedas state that the eyes of cattle go to the sun and the ears go to the direction. That is also stated here.

original: 'gro zhes bya bas gang zhig gang las 'ongs pa de ni der 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'gro zhes bya bas gang zhig gang las 'ongs pa de ni der 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word “goes” means that whatever comes from somewhere goes there.

original: des na gal te yang rna ba ni phyogs so zhes dngos sum brjod pa de lta na yang rna ba phyogs la 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis shugs kyis brjod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na gal te yang rna ba ni phyogs so zhes dngos sum brjod pa de lta na yang rna ba phyogs la 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis shugs kyis brjod pa kho na'o //
translated: Thus, even though the ear is directly stated to be in space, the statement “the ear goes to space” only indirectly expresses that.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “That also,” and so on.

original: de yang phyogs la zhes bshad pa'i phyir rna ba rang bzhin la 'gro ba nyid ston pa lhur len pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang phyogs la zhes bshad pa'i phyir rna ba rang bzhin la 'gro ba nyid ston pa lhur len pa yin te /
translated: Since it is explained that “that also is in space,” the statement “the ear goes to its own nature” is the main point.

original: byed pa po rna ba ni rang bzhin du gyur ba phyogs la 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byed pa po rna ba ni rang bzhin du gyur ba phyogs la 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the ear, as an agent, goes to space, which is its own nature.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: mig la sogs pa bzhin zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa bzhin zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, “like the eye and so on.”

original: 'di nyid rnam par 'grel ba ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid rnam par 'grel ba ni /
translated: He explains this very point.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “Just as,” and so on.

original: dper na 'di'i mig nyi ma la 'gro'o zhes brjod pas rnam par shes pa nyi ma'i rang bzhin du brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na 'di'i mig nyi ma la 'gro'o zhes brjod pas rnam par shes pa nyi ma'i rang bzhin du brjod pa yin te /
translated: For example, when it is said, “The eye goes to the sun,” consciousness is said to have the nature of the sun.

original: mig gi zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ngo //
analyzed: mig gi zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ngo //
translated: The word “eye” is to be supplied.

original: rna ba phyogs la zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis de bzhin du rna ba ni phyogs kyi bdag nyid du brjod do zhes tshig @146b rnams de ltar 'brel bar bya'o //
analyzed: rna ba phyogs la zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis de bzhin du rna ba ni phyogs kyi bdag nyid du brjod do zhes tshig @146b rnams de ltar 'brel bar bya'o //
translated: The statement, “The ear is in the direction,” should be connected with the words in the same way.

original: rnam shes nyi ma'i rang bzhin te //
analyzed: rnam shes nyi ma'i rang bzhin te //
translated: Consciousness is of the nature of the sun.

original: nyi ma'i bdag nyid du nges par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyi ma'i bdag nyid du nges par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It should be understood to have the nature of the sun.

original: yang phyogs de ci 'dra ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang phyogs de ci 'dra ba yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what is the nature of that direction?

original: phyogs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phyogs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The statement, “The direction is . . . ,” and so on, is made.

original: kun du 'gro ba nyid kyi 'brel pa ni nam mkha' ji srid par du gnas zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba nyid kyi 'brel pa ni nam mkha' ji srid par du gnas zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The connection with the statement, “It is omnipresent,” is that it exists as long as space exists.

original: de ltar na 'on pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'on pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the classification of the deaf, and so on, would not be possible,

original: phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because they would be one part.

original: rna ba'i bu gas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rna ba'i bu gas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The ear is a hole, etc.

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyis phyogs rna ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis phyogs rna ba ma yin no //
translated: The ear is not a part of space, because it is not all of space.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: rna 'brug gi mthar thug par yongs su bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rna 'brug gi mthar thug par yongs su bshad pa'o //
translated: It is the extreme limit of the ear-hole.

original: 'on te de ni cha shas med pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar cha'i rnam par dbye ba dmigs she na /
analyzed: 'on te de ni cha shas med pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar cha'i rnam par dbye ba dmigs she na /
translated: But since space is partless, how can it be conceived as having parts?

original: nam mkha'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The author replies: Space is like the sky, etc.

original: dper na nam mkha' ldan pa can tha dad pa'i sgo nas cha shas rtog pa de bzhin du phyogs la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' ldan pa can tha dad pa'i sgo nas cha shas rtog pa de bzhin du phyogs la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the sky is imagined to have parts on the basis of the differences in the sky-possessors, so also space is imagined to have parts on the basis of the differences in the space-possessors.

original: 'o na nam mkha' rna ba'i phyogs las 'di khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na nam mkha' rna ba'i phyogs las 'di khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: But what is the difference between space and the part of space that is the ear?

original: lung las khyad par 'gyur zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: lung las khyad par 'gyur zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The author replies: Space is distinguished from the part of space that is the ear by scripture.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas 'on pa la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas 'on pa la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ston pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the author concludes by stating that the position of the ear, etc.

original: yul legs par byed pa'i phyogs la yang nyes pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yul legs par byed pa'i phyogs la yang nyes pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The author states that there is no fault in the position that space is the object of the ear.

original: yul yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yul yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The object is also different.

original: de la gal te sgra legs byas //
analyzed: de la gal te sgra legs byas //
translated: If it is argued that sound is well-formed,

original: thams cad kyis ni rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad kyis ni rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: then it would be cognized by all.

original: zhes gang smras pa de la skyon med do //
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa de la skyon med do //
translated: There is no fault in what was said.

original: ga las she na /
analyzed: ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yul gyi nus pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gyi nus pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the capacity of the object is different.

original: yul legs par byed pa'i rlung nye ba dang ring ba dag gis yul legs par byed pa tha dad pa'i phyir nus pa tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: yul legs par byed pa'i rlung nye ba dang ring ba dag gis yul legs par byed pa tha dad pa'i phyir nus pa tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Because the well-formed objects are different due to the proximity and distance of the well-forming winds, the capacity is different.

original: 'on te rtag pa dang thams cad du song ba nyid kyis 'di skyes bu thams cad la khyad par med pa'i phyir 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa mtshungs par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rtag pa dang thams cad du song ba nyid kyis 'di skyes bu thams cad la khyad par med pa'i phyir 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa mtshungs par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn't it the case that because it is permanent and all-pervading, it would be the same in terms of grasping and not grasping, since there is no difference for all beings?

original: ji ltar yul phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar yul phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: It is said, Just as in the case of a place... and so on.

original: yang rlung dag gis yul legs par byed pa yin gyi yul nyid ni ma yin no zhes ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang rlung dag gis yul legs par byed pa yin gyi yul nyid ni ma yin no zhes ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it understood that the winds form the object, but the object itself is not formed?

original: sgra'i skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgra'i skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said, The arising of sound... and so on.

original: ngo shes pas sgra khyab pa dang gcig pu nyid du grub pa'i phyir sgra skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ngo shes pas sgra khyab pa dang gcig pu nyid du grub pa'i phyir sgra skye ba ma yin te /
translated: Because it is recognized, sound is pervaded by being a single entity, and therefore sound is not produced.

original: de'i phyir shugs kyis sgra'i skye ba yang rtag pa yin no zhes bya bar go'o //🔽'on te sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa bzhin du de @147a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir shugs kyis sgra'i skye ba yang rtag pa yin no zhes bya bar go'o // 'on te sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa bzhin du de @147a * //
translated: Therefore, it is understood that sound’s production is also permanent by implication.

original: yod na yod pa nyid kyis sgra rnams sgra tsam gyis 'bras bu nyid yin par grub ste /
analyzed: yod na yod pa nyid kyis sgra rnams sgra tsam gyis 'bras bu nyid yin par grub ste /
translated: But if it exists, then sound is the effect of mere sound, because it exists when sound exists.

original: dper na sa bon la sogs pa yod na myu gu la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir de dag de'i 'bras bu nyid yin pa de bzhin du sgra tsam yod na sgra rnams dmigs pa yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: dper na sa bon la sogs pa yod na myu gu la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir de dag de'i 'bras bu nyid yin pa de bzhin du sgra tsam yod na sgra rnams dmigs pa yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: For example, because a sprout and so on is observed when a seed and so on exists, it is the effect of that. In the same way, if mere sound exists, sound is observed.

original: 'bras bu'i tha snyad ni de tsam gyi rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir ci'i phyir de 'bras bu nyid du mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i tha snyad ni de tsam gyi rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir ci'i phyir de 'bras bu nyid du mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Because the convention of effect is due to that reason, why would it not be the effect?

original: 'di la de yod na yod ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di la de yod na yod ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here, “if it exists” and so on is stated.

original: dper na rna ba yod na sgra dmigs pa yod de /
analyzed: dper na rna ba yod na sgra dmigs pa yod de /
translated: For example, if the ear exists, sound is observed.

original: de yod na yod pa de las rna ba sgra la skyed par byed pa'i nus pa rjes su dpog par byed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de yod na yod pa de las rna ba sgra la skyed par byed pa'i nus pa rjes su dpog par byed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: If it exists, then the existence of that is not inferred to be the potency to generate the ear and sound.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: 'dzin pa'i nus pa yin pa de bzhin du 'di la yang de yod na yod pa nyid ni sgra rnams kyi nus pa yod pa tsam rtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i nus pa yin pa de bzhin du 'di la yang de yod na yod pa nyid ni sgra rnams kyi nus pa yod pa tsam rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: Just as the existence of the apprehension of sound is the existence of the mere potency of sound,

original: skyed par byed pa'i nus pa rtogs par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i nus pa rtogs par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not the inference of the potency to generate.

original: de ni nus pa tsam la 'brel gyis nus pa'i khyad par la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni nus pa tsam la 'brel gyis nus pa'i khyad par la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That is related to mere potency, but not to a particular potency. This is the meaning.

original: de'i phyir 'di'i nus pa'i khyad par bsgrub na 'khrul pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di'i nus pa'i khyad par bsgrub na 'khrul pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, if the particular potency of that is established, it is just error that is taught.

original: da ni ji ltar legs par byed pa'i nus pa'i khyad par rtogs she na /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar legs par byed pa'i nus pa'i khyad par rtogs she na /
translated: Now, how is the particular potency of a good action understood?🔽It is said:

original: de ru blo ni yang dag bsdus //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ru blo ni yang dag bsdus //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The mind is well-concentrated there.

original: ngo shes pas rtag pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir gzhan du mi 'thad pas legs par bya ba'i khyad par de la bshad pa byed pas blo nye bar bsdus pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ngo shes pas rtag pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir gzhan du mi 'thad pas legs par bya ba'i khyad par de la bshad pa byed pas blo nye bar bsdus pa yin gyi /
translated: Since it is established as permanent by recognition, it is not tenable as other. Therefore, the special good action is the object of the mind’s focus.

original: de yod na yod pa tsam gyis legs par byed pa'i nus pa rjes su dpog par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yod na yod pa tsam gyis legs par byed pa'i nus pa rjes su dpog par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that when it exists, it is not inferred that the capacity for good action exists merely by its existence.

original: gnyi ga legs par byas pa'i phyogs la /
analyzed: gnyi ga legs par byas pa'i phyogs la /
translated: With regard to the position that both are good,🔽he says,

original: gnyi gar legs par byas na yang //
analyzed: gnyi gar legs par byas na yang //
translated: “Even if both are good,

original: re re la brjod skyon du 'gyur //
analyzed: re re la brjod skyon du 'gyur //
translated: there is the fault of expression in each.”

original: zhes gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa de la /
translated: With regard to that, he says,

original: gnyi ga legs par byas phyogs la //
analyzed: gnyi ga legs par byas phyogs la //
translated: “In the position that both are good,

original: khyed kyi nyes pa gnyis log pa //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: khyed kyi nyes pa gnyis log pa // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: your two faults are reversed.”

original: phyogs gnyis ka la yang nyes pa gnyis sngar bstan pa gang yin pa de ni log pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis ka la yang nyes pa gnyis sngar bstan pa gang yin pa de ni log pa ste /
translated: Whatever two faults were previously stated in both positions are reversed.

original: don med pa yin no //
analyzed: don med pa yin no //
translated: They are meaningless.

original: ji ltar zhe na /🔽gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽gang gis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gang gis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: How so?🔽He says “by whom,” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir te /
translated: “By whom” means “for what reason.”

original: rna ba legs par byas pa'am /🔽sgra legs par byas pa gang yang rung ba ma tshang ba'i phyir sgra rtogs pa ma yin te 'di ltar sgra legs par byas na yang 'on pa la rna ba legs par byas @147b pa ma tshang ba'i phyir sgra mi 'dzin la /
analyzed: rna ba legs par byas pa'am / sgra legs par byas pa gang yang rung ba ma tshang ba'i phyir sgra rtogs pa ma yin te 'di ltar sgra legs par byas na yang 'on pa la rna ba legs par byas @147b pa ma tshang ba'i phyir sgra mi 'dzin la /
translated: The sound is not cognized because either the ear or the sound is defective.🔽If the sound is defective, the deaf do not hear it because the ear is defective.

original: ma 'on pa yang mngon par gsal bar ma byas pa'i sgra mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: ma 'on pa yang mngon par gsal bar ma byas pa'i sgra mi 'dzin to //
translated: If the ear is not defective, they do not hear the sound if it is not clearly manifest.

original: kha cig nyes pa gnyis brjod log pa yin //
analyzed: kha cig nyes pa gnyis brjod log pa yin //
translated: Some say that the two faults are stated in reverse order.

original: zhes 'dod te de yang go bla'o //
analyzed: zhes 'dod te de yang go bla'o //
translated: That is easy to understand.

original: gal te sgra thams cad du song ba yin na ji ltar 'di bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du yul rnam par chad pa sna tshogs pa nyid du dmigs te /
analyzed: gal te sgra thams cad du song ba yin na ji ltar 'di bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du yul rnam par chad pa sna tshogs pa nyid du dmigs te /
translated: If sound pervades all, how is it that it is observed as a variety of discrete objects, like pots and so on?

original: 'di ltar sgra thams cad du song ba'i phyir rnam par ma chad pa'i ngo bos thams cad du rtogs pa rigs la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra thams cad du song ba'i phyir rnam par ma chad pa'i ngo bos thams cad du rtogs pa rigs la /
translated: Because sound pervades all, it is logical that it is cognized as a nondistinct entity everywhere.

original: thams cad du song ba la ni nye ba dang ring ba'i tha dad pa rigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: thams cad du song ba la ni nye ba dang ring ba'i tha dad pa rigs pa ma yin la /
translated: It is illogical that there is a difference of near and far in that which pervades all.

original: de ni thams cad na gnas pa'i phyir yul 'ga' zhig nas 'ongs pa yang rigs pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de ni thams cad na gnas pa'i phyir yul 'ga' zhig nas 'ongs pa yang rigs pa ma yin zhing /
translated: It is not logical that sound comes from some place, because it exists everywhere.

original: rtag pa ni ches cher ring ba dang thung ba dang dman pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin tha dad pa dang dus tha dad pa yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa ni ches cher ring ba dang thung ba dang dman pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin tha dad pa dang dus tha dad pa yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical that sound is permanent, because it has a different nature that is very distant, short, inferior, and so on, and it has a different time.🔽Therefore, because it exists as different in terms of place, time, and nature, like a pot and so on, it is established that sound is impermanent and different.

original: de lta bas na yul dang dus dang rang bzhin tha dad du yod pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du sgra tha dad pa dang mi rtag par grub pa'i phyir de ji ltar /
analyzed: de lta bas na yul dang dus dang rang bzhin tha dad du yod pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du sgra tha dad pa dang mi rtag par grub pa'i phyir de ji ltar /
translated: How can you say:

original: sgra yi skye ba bkag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sgra yi skye ba bkag pa'i phyir //

original: gzhan du mi 'thad pa yin na //
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'thad pa yin na //

original: khyad par legs par byas pa'i phyir //🔽sgra tsam dag las skye bar nges //
analyzed: khyad par legs par byas pa'i phyir // sgra tsam dag las skye bar nges //
translated: Because the distinction is well made,

original: zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: zhes brjod ce na /

original: 'dir smras pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa ni /
translated: Here we say:

original: dper na nyi ma la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dper na nyi ma la sogs pa smos te /
